Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, same as select command for arrays, but has higher precedence.

Command.Name: AGLToASL
Command.Descr: Converts position from PositionAGL to PositionASL

Command.Name: AISFinishHeal
Command.Descr: Alternative Injury Simulation (AIS) end state. Used to tell engine that script side healing is done when using "HandleHeal" event handler.

Command.Name: ASLToAGL
Command.Descr: Converts position from PositionASL to PositionAGL

Command.Name: ASLToATL
Command.Descr: Converts a position from PositionASL to PositionATL

Command.Name: ATLToASL
Command.Descr: Converts a position from PositionATL to PositionASL

Command.Name: HUDMovementLevels
Command.Descr: Returns movement borders for HUD [min speed, max speed, min alt, max alt, min dir, max dir, position[x,y,z] or target]

Command.Name: UAVControl
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [unit, vehicleRole] (or sometimes [unit1, vehicleRole, unit2,
Command.Descr: Get array with unit connected to vehicle and position in that vehicle.

Command.Name: WFSideText
Command.Descr: Returns the unlocalized text value of an object's side / a group's side or a side as: east, opfor - "East" west, blufor - "West" resistance, inde

Command.Name: WFSideText
Command.Descr: Returns the unlocalized text value of an object's side / a group's side or a side as: east, opfor - "East" west, blufor - "West" resistance, inde

Command.Name: WFSideText
Command.Descr: Returns the unlocalized text value of an object's side / a group's side or a side as: east, opfor - "East" west, blufor - "West" resistance, inde

Command.Name: abs
Command.Descr: Absolute value of a real Scalar

Command.Name: accTime
Command.Descr: Returns the current time acceleration factor

Command.Name: acos
Command.Descr: ArcCosine of a number, result in Degrees

Command.Name: action
Command.Descr: Make a unit to perform an action. Use the List of Actions for reference about the available actions and their syntax.

Command.Name: actionIDs
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Array with user action IDs
Command.Descr: Returns Array of Numbers, where numbers are IDs of all user actions added to given entity with addAction command.

Command.Name: actionKeys
Command.Descr: Returns Array containing dikCodes of keys, buttons and combos assigned to the given user action.

Command.Name: actionKeysImages
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button images or names assigned to the given user action. A maximum of maxKeys keys is listed.

Command.Name: actionKeysImages
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button images or names assigned to the given user action. A maximum of maxKeys keys is listed.

Command.Name: actionKeysNames
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionKeysNames
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionKeysNames
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionKeysNamesArray
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionKeysNamesArray
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionKeysNamesArray
Command.Descr: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

Command.Name: actionName
Command.Descr: Returns localized name of action.

Command.Name: actionParams
Command.Descr: Returns Array with params for given user action id (similar to addAction param array).

Command.Name: activateAddons
Command.Descr: Activates the listed addons. The list of active addons is initialized during this function.

Command.Name: activateKey
Command.Descr: Activates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.

Command.Name: activatedAddons
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all activated addons.

Command.Name: add3DENConnection
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the connection was made
Command.Descr: Connect entities together.

Command.Name: add3DENEventHandler
Command.Descr: Add code to be run when a Eden Editor event is triggered.See the list of all Eden Editor Event Handlers.

Command.Name: add3DENLayer
Command.Descr: Add an editing layer in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: addAction
Command.Descr: Adds an entry to the action menu of an object (scroll wheel menu). The action can only be activated when in proximity to the object (eg: building).
Command.Syntax: object addAction [title, script, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition, radius, unconscious, selection, memoryPoint]

Command.Name: addBackpack
Command.Descr: Adds a backpack for a unit. If a unit already has a backpack, the old backpack will be placed on the ground under the unit.

Command.Name: addBackpackCargo
Command.Descr: Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle. Classname list of available backpacks is here.

Command.Name: addBackpackCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle. MP synchronized.

Command.Name: addBackpackGlobal
Command.Descr: Adds a backpack to a unit (even non-local)

Command.Name: addBinocularItem
Command.Descr: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the binocular weapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

Command.Name: addCamShake
Command.Descr: Creates the camera shaking effect, like when you are near an explosion

Command.Name: addCuratorAddons
Command.Descr: Allow curator use of given addon.

Command.Name: addCuratorCameraArea
Command.Descr: Adds or changes curator camera area (depends on if ID is already used).

Command.Name: addCuratorEditableObjects
Command.Descr: Register objects which can be edited by a curator.

Command.Name: addCuratorEditingArea
Command.Descr: Adds or changes curator edit area (depends on if ID is already used).

Command.Name: addCuratorPoints
Command.Descr: Adds or removes curator points. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: addEditorObject
Command.Descr: Add an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,called with _new equal to true. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject.

Command.Name: addEventHandler
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - The index of the currently added event handler is returned.
Command.Descr: Adds event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle. If EH has some data to return upon event (e.g.

Command.Name: addForce
Command.Descr: Applies force to given object at given position. Force is defined as vector [x, y, z] in world space, position is vector [x, y, z] in model space.

Command.Name: addGoggles
Command.Descr: Create a new item and try to link it into goggles slot. This command doesn't add NVGoggles. Use addItem and assignItem or just linkItem for latter.

Command.Name: addGroupIcon
Command.Descr: Add icon to a group.

Command.Name: addHandgunItem
Command.Descr: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: addHeadgear
Command.Descr: Creates a headgear item and tries to link it to headgear slot. If slot is occupied with another item, the item in the slot will be replaced.

Command.Name: addItem
Command.Descr: Creates new item and tries to add it into inventory. Inventory must have enough space to accomodate new item or command will fail.

Command.Name: addItemCargo
Command.Descr: Creates new items and stores them in given container. Works with items, weapons and magazines.

Command.Name: addItemCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Creates new items and stores them in the given container. Works with items, weapons and magazines.

Command.Name: addItemPool
Command.Descr: Adds count items of type name into the weapon pool (used in the campaign to transfer items to the next mission)

Command.Name: addItemToBackpack
Command.Descr: Create new item and store it to soldier's backpack. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

Command.Name: addItemToUniform
Command.Descr: Create new item and store it to soldier's uniform. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

Command.Name: addItemToVest
Command.Descr: Create new item and store it to soldier's vest. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

Command.Name: addLiveStats
Command.Descr: Adds score to the Xbox Live Statistics score for the given unit (or the commander unit of the given vehicle).

Command.Name: addMPEventHandler
Command.Descr: Adds MP event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle.

Command.Name: addMagazine
Command.Descr: Add a magazine to a person.

Command.Name: addMagazine
Command.Descr: Add a magazine to a person.

Command.Name: addMagazineAmmoCargo
Command.Descr: Adds magazines with specified ammo count to the cargo space of a vehicle or a container.

Command.Name: addMagazineCargo
Command.Descr: Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

Command.Name: addMagazineCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

Command.Name: addMagazineGlobal
Command.Descr: Adds a magazine to the unit. Note: You may create invalid combinations by adding more magazines than the free space in unit's inventory allows.

Command.Name: addMagazinePool
Command.Descr: Add magazines to the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

Command.Name: addMagazineTurret
Command.Descr: Adds a magazine to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: addMagazine_array
Command.Descr: Adds a magazine to a person with said ammunition count.

Command.Name: addMagazine_array
Command.Descr: Adds a magazine to a person with said ammunition count.

Command.Name: addMagazines
Command.Descr: Adds multiple magazines to the unit. For cargo containers use addMagazineCargoGlobal command.

Command.Name: addMenu
Command.Descr: Adds a new menu button. Priority is optional.

Command.Name: addMenuItem
Command.Descr: Creates a new menu item. Menu can be "file" or "view",index is index,as returned from addMenu command.

Command.Name: addMissionEventHandler
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - The index of the currently added mission event handler is returned.
Command.Descr: Adds event handler (EH) attached to the current mission and returns EH handle.

Command.Name: addMusicEventHandler
Command.Descr: Add music track event handler. Returns id of the handler or -1 when failed.

Command.Name: addOwnedMine
Command.Descr: Sets ownership over a remotely detonatable mine to the unit.

Command.Name: addPlayerScores
Command.Descr: MP server only: Adds player score.

Command.Name: addPrimaryWeaponItem
Command.ReturnDescr: Nothing or Boolean - false is returned if item can not be added
Command.Descr: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: addPrimaryWeaponItem
Command.ReturnDescr: Nothing or Boolean - false is returned if item can not be added
Command.Descr: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: addPublicVariableEventHandler
Command.Descr: This event handler will detect if a missionNamespace variable (it is attached to) has been broadcast over network with publicVariable, publicVariableC

Command.Name: addPublicVariableEventHandler
Command.Descr: This event handler will detect if a missionNamespace variable (it is attached to) has been broadcast over network with publicVariable, publicVariableC

Command.Name: addRating
Command.Descr: Add a number to the rating of a unit - negative values can be used to reduce the rating.

Command.Name: addResources
Command.Descr: Adds resources to a team member.

Command.Name: addScore
Command.Descr: Add a number to the score of a unit. This score is shown in multiplayer in the "I" ("P" in Arma 3) screen. Negative values will remove from the score.

Command.Name: addScoreSide
Command.Descr: Adds side score. This is shown in the MP score tab as the total score. MP Only. Server execution only.

Command.Name: addSecondaryWeaponItem
Command.Descr: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: addSwitchableUnit
Command.Descr: Add a unit into the list of units available for Team Switch.

Command.Name: addTeamMember
Command.Descr: Add given member to given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

Command.Name: addToRemainsCollector
Command.Descr: Adds an array of vehicles/units to disposal manager for automatic wreck/body removal.

Command.Name: addTorque
Command.Descr: Applies torque (rotation momentum) to the center of mass of the given object. Torque force is defined as vector [x, y, z] applied in world space.

Command.Name: addUniform
Command.Descr: Create a new uniform and try to link it into uniform slot (given uniform has to be supported by allowedUniforms list of target soldier).

Command.Name: addVehicle
Command.Descr: Adds a specified vehicle for use by a specified AI led group taking into account vehicle's cost.

Command.Name: addVest
Command.Descr: Create a new vest and try to link it into vest slot.

Command.Name: addWaypoint
Command.Descr: Adds (or inserts when index is given) a new waypoint to a group.The waypoint is placed randomly within a circle with the given center and radius.

Command.Name: addWeapon
Command.Descr: Add a weapon to a unit. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed. For a global version of this command see addWeaponGlobal.

Command.Name: addWeaponCargo
Command.Descr: Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Ignores available cargo space.

Command.Name: addWeaponCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

Command.Name: addWeaponGlobal
Command.Descr: Add a weapon to a unit.

Command.Name: addWeaponItem
Command.Descr: Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon.

Command.Name: addWeaponItem
Command.Descr: Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon.

Command.Name: addWeaponPool
Command.Descr: Add weapons to the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

Command.Name: addWeaponTurret
Command.Descr: Adds a weapon to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargo
Command.Descr: Adds a weapon into cargo space of a vehicle / box with given attachments / magazines. Ignores available cargo space.
Command.Syntax: container addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargo [[weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod]

ParamInfo.Name: [weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod

Command.Name: addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Adds a weapon into cargo space of a vehicle / box with given attachments / magazines. Ignores available cargo space.
Command.Syntax: container addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [[weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod]

ParamInfo.Name: [weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod

Command.Name: addonFiles
Command.Descr: Returns a list of files present in the addon.Querying protected .ebo addons returns empty array [].

Command.Name: admin
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - admin state of given client:0 - client is not an admin1 - client is a
Command.Descr: This is dedicated server command, which queries the admin state of any client on the network by their client (owner) id.

Command.Name: agent
Command.Descr: Return a person for a given agent.

Command.Name: agents
Command.Descr: Return a list of agents in the current mission.

Command.Name: aimPos
Command.Descr: Returns the position of the object other units can aim to.

Command.Name: aimedAtTarget
Command.Descr: Returns how good the weapon of the vehicle is aimed at the target.

Command.Name: airDensityCurveRTD
Command.ReturnDescr: Array with arrays: Returns air density graph Each array consists of:0: Altitud
Command.Descr: Returns array with air density data.

Command.Name: airDensityRTD
Command.Descr: Returns air density in given altitude

Command.Name: airplaneThrottle
Command.Descr: Returns throttle position. Works only on player's vehicle.

Command.Name: airportSide
Command.Descr: Checks a side of the airport. ID is the number to identify which airport on the island you want to check.

Command.Name: airportSide
Command.Descr: Checks a side of the airport. ID is the number to identify which airport on the island you want to check.

Command.Name: alive
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if alive, false if dead/completely destroyed
Command.Descr: Check if given vehicle/person/building is alive (i.e. not dead or destroyed). alive objNull returns false.

Command.Name: all3DENEntities
Command.Descr: Returns an array of all currently placed Eden Editor entities, including groups, waypoints, and markers.

Command.Name: allActiveTitleEffects
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Numbers, where each number represents index of currently active effect
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all layers that have currently active title effect.

Command.Name: allAddonsInfo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Arrays in format [prefix, version, isPatched], where:prefix: String -
Command.Descr: Returns the list of all loaded addons.

Command.Name: allAirports
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [staticAirports, dynamicAirports], where:staticAirports Array
Command.Descr: Returns all map airports, both static and dynamic

Command.Name: allControls
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all controls for desired existing display.

Command.Name: allCurators
Command.Descr: Returns list of all curators.

Command.Name: allCutLayers
Command.Descr: Returns all named layers used by cutRsc, cutText, cutObj or cutFadeOut.

Command.Name: allDead
Command.Descr: Return a list of all dead units including agents and destroyed vehicles. Dead units may be in vehicles.

Command.Name: allDeadMen
Command.Descr: Return a list of dead units including agents. Dead unit might be inside vehicle.

Command.Name: allDisplays
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all opened displays (excluding InGameUI displays for now)

Command.Name: allGroups
Command.Descr: Return a list of all groups created on the following sides east, west, resistance/independent and civilian only. Does not contain groups of sideLogic.

Command.Name: allMapMarkers
Command.Descr: Return all markers in map including user placed markers (_USER_DEFINED #). Since Arma 3 v1.57.

Command.Name: allMines
Command.Descr: Returns an array of all mines in the mission

Command.Name: allMissionObjects
Command.Descr: Returns all mission objects (created by or during a mission) with given type (or its subtype).

Command.Name: allPlayers
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all human players including dead players. The command also returns all connected headless clients.

Command.Name: allSimpleObjects
Command.Descr: Returns array of all simple objects that belong to the listed class names.

Command.Name: allSites
Command.Descr: Return all sites in map.

Command.Name: allTurrets
Command.Descr: Returns array of available turret paths.

Command.Name: allTurrets
Command.Descr: Returns array of available turret paths.

Command.Name: allUnits
Command.Descr: Return a list of all units (all persons except agents) created on the following sides east, west, resistance/independent and civilian only.

Command.Name: allUnitsUAV
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Objects - Array of UAV vehicles
Command.Descr: Return a list of all UAV vehicles.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allVariables
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings - array of variable names.
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace.

Command.Name: allow3DMode
Command.Descr: Allow/dissallow 3D mode.

Command.Name: allowCrewInImmobile
Command.Descr: If true, units can be in a vehicle with broken tracks/wheels.

Command.Name: allowCuratorLogicIgnoreAreas
Command.Descr: Allows curator placing and working with modules outside of edit areas.

Command.Name: allowDamage
Command.Descr: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed).

Command.Name: allowDammage
Command.Descr: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). Alias of allowDamage.

Command.Name: allowFileOperations
Command.Descr: Allow/dissallow file ops (load/save etc).

Command.Name: allowFleeing
Command.Descr: Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit.

Command.Name: allowFleeing
Command.Descr: Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit.

Command.Name: allowGetIn
Command.Descr: Set if the units given in the list are allowed to enter vehicles.

Command.Name: allowSprint
Command.Descr: Force player to run/jog if set to false.

Command.Name: ammo
Command.Descr: Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.55.

Command.Name: ammoOnPylon
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count on given pylon.Returns false (Bool) on failure.

Command.Name: ammoOnPylon
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count on given pylon.Returns false (Bool) on failure.

Command.Name: ammoOnPylon
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count on given pylon.Returns false (Bool) on failure.

Command.Name: ammoOnPylon
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count on given pylon.Returns false (Bool) on failure.

Command.Name: animate
Command.Descr: Activates given object animation. Animation is defined in CfgModels Animations class of model.cfg or another model config. Since Arma 3 v1.65.

Command.Name: animateBay
Command.Descr: Force animation of bay to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released when bay state =1.

Command.Name: animateDoor
Command.Descr: Animates a door on a vehicle. Animation is defined in config file in CfgVehicles -> AnimationSources. Wanted animation phase is set with phase param.

Command.Name: animatePylon
Command.Descr: Force animation of pylon to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released when pylon state =

Command.Name: animateSource
Command.Descr: Process an animation of the object. If animate uses class name from CfgModels Animations, animateSource uses name defined by source property.

Command.Name: animationNames
Command.Descr: Returns Array of Strings where elements are the names of model animations, which should theoretically be available for use with animate command.

Command.Name: animationPhase
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - range 0 (start point of the animation) to 1 (end point of the animation
Command.Descr: Returns the phase of the given animation on the given object. Animation can be scripted (animate, animateSource, animateDoor) or engine driven.

Command.Name: animationSourcePhase
Command.Descr: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationPhase or doorPhase but designed to complement animateSource.

Command.Name: animationState
Command.Descr: Returns the name of a unit's current primary animation. Seems to be forced to lower case in Arma 3.

Command.Name: append
Command.Descr: Appends array2 to the back of array1 modifying array1. NOTE: append does not return array, it modifies existing array.

Command.Name: apply
Command.Descr: Applies given code to each element of the array and returns resulting array.

Command.Name: armoryPoints
Command.Descr: Returns, stored in [USERNAME].ArmaXProfile, value of armoryPoints entry. If the entry doesn't exist, it returns 0.

Command.Name: arrayIntersect
Command.Descr: Intersects array1 with array2 returning array of unique common elements.

Command.Name: asin
Command.Descr: Arcsine of a number, result in Degrees.

Command.Name: assert
Command.Descr: Tests a condition and if the condition is false, displays error on screen (if -showscripterrors enabled) and logs error into .rpt file.

Command.Name: assignAsCargo
Command.Descr: Assign a unit as cargo of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order a unit to get in as cargo into a specific vehicle.

Command.Name: assignAsCargoIndex
Command.Descr: Assigns the character to a specific cargo / passenger index of the given vehicle.

Command.Name: assignAsCommander
Command.Descr: Assign a unit as commander of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as commander of a specific vehicle.

Command.Name: assignAsDriver
Command.Descr: Assign a unit as driver of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as driver of a specific vehicle.

Command.Name: assignAsGunner
Command.Descr: Assign a unit as gunner of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as gunner of a specific vehicle.

Command.Name: assignAsTurret
Command.Descr: Assigns the soldier to turret.

Command.Name: assignCurator
Command.Descr: Assign player as curator. Two players cannot act as one curator.

Command.Name: assignItem
Command.Descr: Assigns existing item from inventory (uniform, vest, backpack) to a correct slot. If the slot is occupied by another item, it gets replaced.

Command.Name: assignTeam
Command.Descr: Assigns the unit (in case of a vehicle, its commander) to the given team.

Command.Name: assignToAirport
Command.Descr: Not correctly implemented yet, currently it does the same as landAt.

Command.Name: assignToAirport
Command.Descr: Not correctly implemented yet, currently it does the same as landAt.

Command.Name: assignedCargo
Command.Descr: Returns the list of soldiers assigned to the given vehicle as a cargo.

Command.Name: assignedCommander
Command.Descr: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a commander.

Command.Name: assignedDriver
Command.Descr: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a driver.

Command.Name: assignedGunner
Command.Descr: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a gunner.

Command.Name: assignedItems
Command.Descr: Get array with all assigned items.

Command.Name: assignedTarget
Command.Descr: Returns the target assigned to the vehicle/unit. To unassign the target use doWatch objNull or commandWatch objNull.

Command.Name: assignedTeam
Command.Descr: Returns the team the unit belongs to.

Command.Name: assignedVehicle
Command.Descr: Returns the vehicle a unit is assigned to. If no vehicle is assigned objNull is returned.

Command.Name: assignedVehicleRole
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - The array which is returned contains:[] - Not assigned to any vehicle[
Command.Descr: Return the role a unit is assigned to within its assigned vehicle.

Command.Name: atan
Command.Descr: ArcTangent of a number, result in Degrees.

Command.Name: atan2
Command.Descr: ArcTangent of x/y. Used to determine the angle of a vector [x,y]. Result in Degrees between -180 and 180.

Command.Name: atg
Command.Descr: Equivalent to atan

Command.Name: attachObject
Command.Descr: Attaches a location to the specified object. To detach a location, attach it to objNull.

Command.Name: attachTo
Command.Descr: Attaches an object to another object. The offset is applied to the object center unless a memory point is provided.

Command.Name: attachedObject
Command.Descr: Returns the object a location is attached to. If the location is unattached, then objNull is returned.

Command.Name: attachedObjects
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Objects attached to the given object
Command.Descr: Returns a list of attached objects.

Command.Name: attachedTo
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - object the given object is attached to
Command.Descr: Returns the object it is attached to.Returns objNull if not attached to anything.

Command.Name: attackEnabled
Command.Descr: Return whether a group's leader can issue attack commands to soldiers under his command.

Command.Name: attackEnabled
Command.Descr: Return whether a group's leader can issue attack commands to soldiers under his command.

Command.Name: backpack
Command.Descr: Returns a class of a backpack.

Command.Name: backpackCargo
Command.Descr: Get array with backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

Command.Name: backpackContainer
Command.Descr: Returns a cargo container of a unit's backpack.

Command.Name: backpackItems
Command.Descr: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) in backpack of the given unit.

Command.Name: backpackMagazines
Command.Descr: Get array with all magazines from backpack of the given unit.

Command.Name: backpackSpaceFor
Command.Descr: Returns how much space is in backpack for given weapon or magazine

Command.Name: behaviour
Command.Descr: Return the behaviour of a unit.

Command.Name: benchmark
Command.Descr: Returns the value of "3D Performance" in OFP Preferences (flashpoint.cfg).

Command.Name: bezierInterpolation
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - a single point position in format Position3D based on progress value
Command.Descr: Gets interpolated value based on bezier curve with given control points (progress is 0-1)This article is a work in progress!

Command.Name: binocular
Command.Descr: Returns class name of currently used binocular weapon.

Command.Name: binocularItems
Command.Descr: Returns array with all items assigned to the binocular weapon except magazines. Use binocularMagazine command for the latter.

Command.Name: binocularMagazine
Command.Descr: Collects all loaded magazines from all binocular muzzles and returns them in Array, otherwise it returns [].

Command.Name: boundingBox
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - An array with the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative
Command.Descr: Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinate space.

Command.Name: boundingBox
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - An array with the extreme points of the model bounding box in format Pos
Command.Descr: Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinate space.

Command.Name: boundingBoxReal
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as b
Command.Descr: Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to boundingBox but gives more precise measurements.

Command.Name: boundingBoxReal
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as b
Command.Descr: Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to boundingBox but gives more precise measurements.

Command.Name: boundingCenter
Command.Descr: Returns the position of original (loaded) center of object in model coordinates.

Command.Name: breakOut
Command.Descr: Breaks the code execution out of scope {} named name. nil is returned. Scope name can be assigned using scopeName command.Since Arma 3 v1.

Command.Name: breakOut
Command.Descr: Breaks the code execution out of scope {} named name. nil is returned. Scope name can be assigned using scopeName command.Since Arma 3 v1.

Command.Name: breakTo
Command.Descr: Breaks block to scope named name. Nil is returned.Scope name can be assigned using scopeName command.

Command.Name: briefingName
Command.Descr: Returns the name of the current briefing/scenario name.

Command.Name: buildingExit
Command.Descr: Returns the given indexed exit in a building. The returned value is in format Position.

Command.Name: buildingPos
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - a single building position in format PositionAGL or (since Arma 3 v.155.
Command.Descr: Returns PositionAGL of a given indexed position in a building. The index is 0-based (i.e. the first possible position would be 0.

Command.Name: buldozer_EnableRoadDiag
Command.Descr: Enables road diagnostics in buldozer.

Command.Name: buldozer_IsEnabledRoadDiag
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - True if enabled, otherwise false
Command.Descr: Returns if road diagnostics are enabled in buldozer.

Command.Name: buldozer_LoadNewRoads
Command.Descr: Generates new roads. Working only in buldozer.

Command.Name: buldozer_reloadOperMap
Command.Descr: Reload oper map visible in costMap diag tool. Working only in buldozer.

Command.Name: buttonAction
Command.Descr: Return the action assigned to a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts.

Command.Name: buttonAction
Command.Descr: Return the action assigned to a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts.

Command.Name: buttonSetAction
Command.Descr: Set the action of a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts.

Command.Name: buttonSetAction
Command.Descr: Set the action of a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts.

Command.Name: cadetMode
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true when playing in cadet mode, false when playing in veteran mode
Command.Descr: Returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode.

Command.Name: calculatePath
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - The agent to add the "PathCalculated" Event Handler to.
Command.Descr: Spawns an agent that will execute an AI path calculation and fire the "PathCalculated" event handler.

Command.Name: calculatePlayerVisibilityByFriendly
Command.Descr: Friendly units will / will not calculate visibility of player. Default false.

Command.Name: call
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - The last value given in the function is returned.
Command.Descr: Executes given set of compiled instructions with an option to pass arguments to the executed Code.

Command.Name: call
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - The last value given in the function is returned.
Command.Descr: Executes given set of compiled instructions with an option to pass arguments to the executed Code.

Command.Name: callExtension
Command.ReturnDescr: String - data sent back from extension; If the extensiion wasn't found an empty
Command.Descr: Execute an extension function.

Command.Name: callExtension
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [result, returnCode, errorCode], where:result: String - data
Command.Descr: Execute an extension function.

Command.Name: camCommand
Command.Descr: Executes a command on the given camera / actor object.

Command.Name: camCommit
Command.Descr: Smoothly conduct the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately.

Command.Name: camCommitPrepared
Command.Descr: Smoothly conduct the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately.

Command.Name: camCommitted
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the last camCommit already finished, false if not
Command.Descr: Checks if the conduction of the last camCommit call already finished.

Command.Name: camConstuctionSetParams
Command.Descr: Sets construction camera parameters. To work with "camconstruct" object.

Command.Name: camCreate
Command.Descr: Create a camera or a seagull object on the given position.

Command.Name: camDestroy
Command.Descr: Destroy an object created with camCreate. camDestroy is conducted immediately, the command doesn't wait for camCommit.

Command.Name: camPreload
Command.Descr: Preload the scene for the prepared camera. Time gives timeout, zero means no (infinite) timeout.

Command.Name: camPreloaded
Command.Descr: Checks whether the camera has finished preloading.

Command.Name: camPrepareBank
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera bank angle.

Command.Name: camPrepareDir
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera heading.

Command.Name: camPrepareDive
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera dive angle.

Command.Name: camPrepareFocus
Command.Descr: focusRange is in format [distance,blur]. Prepares the camera focus blur.

Command.Name: camPrepareFov
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera field of view (zoom). The default zoom level is 0.7, 0.01 is the nearest and 2 the furthest zoom value.

Command.Name: camPrepareFovRange
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera field of view range for auto zooming.

Command.Name: camPreparePos
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera position (format Position).

Command.Name: camPrepareRelPos
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera position relative to the current position of the currect target (see camPrepareTarget).

Command.Name: camPrepareTarget
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera target to a position or to a target.

Command.Name: camPrepareTarget
Command.Descr: Prepares the camera target to a position or to a target.

Command.Name: camSetBank
Command.Descr: Set camera bank angle.Does not commit changes.

Command.Name: camSetDir
Command.Descr: Sets the orientation of the given camera in the direction of the given vector. Needs camCommit.

Command.Name: camSetDive
Command.Descr: Set camera dive angle.Does not commit changes.

Command.Name: camSetFocus
Command.Descr: focusRange is in format [distance,blur]. Sets the camera focus blur. It does not automatically commit changes.

Command.Name: camSetFov
Command.Descr: Set the zoom level (Field Of View) of the given camera.The zoom level is from 0.

Command.Name: camSetFovRange
Command.Descr: Set the zoom level (Field Of View) start and end values for automatical zooming. The default zoom level is 0.

Command.Name: camSetPos
Command.Descr: Sets the position of the given camera or seagull (see camCreate).

Command.Name: camSetRelPos
Command.Descr: Set the position of the given camera relative to its target set with camSetTarget.Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted.

Command.Name: camSetTarget
Command.Descr: Set the target object or position where the given camera should point at. Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted.

Command.Name: camSetTarget
Command.Descr: Set the target object or position where the given camera should point at. Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted.

Command.Name: camTarget
Command.Descr: Returns camera's target.

Command.Name: camUseNVG
Command.Descr: Set / clear using of night vision during cutscenes.

Command.Name: cameraEffect
Command.Descr: Switch to the given camera or object with the given effect.

Command.Name: cameraEffectEnableHUD
Command.Descr: Enable / disable showing of in-game UI during currently active camera effect.

Command.Name: cameraInterest
Command.Descr: Return camera interest for given entity, as set by setCameraInterest, or as autodetected.

Command.Name: cameraOn
Command.Descr: Returns the vehicle to which the camera is attached.

Command.Name: cameraView
Command.Descr: Returns mode of active camera view.

Command.Name: campaignConfigFile
Command.Descr: Return root of campaign description.ext entries hierarchy.

Command.Name: canAdd
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored in inventory of given object or any inventory container (uniform, vest, backpack) of given unit.

Command.Name: canAdd
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored in inventory of given object or any inventory container (uniform, vest, backpack) of given unit.

Command.Name: canAddItemToBackpack
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's backpack.

Command.Name: canAddItemToBackpack
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's backpack.

Command.Name: canAddItemToUniform
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's uniform.

Command.Name: canAddItemToUniform
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's uniform.

Command.Name: canAddItemToVest
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's vest.

Command.Name: canAddItemToVest
Command.Descr: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's vest.

Command.Name: canFire
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if able to fire
Command.Descr: Returns true if the given vehicle is still able to fire.

Command.Name: canMove
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the vehicle is able to move, false if not
Command.Descr: Returns if the given vehicle is still able to move.

Command.Name: canSlingLoad
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if setSlingLoad is possible
Command.Descr: Returns true if it is possible to sling load cargo

Command.Name: canStand
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if he's still able to stand up, false if not.
Command.Descr: Returns if the given soldier is able to stand up.

Command.Name: canSuspend
Command.Descr: Returns true if sleep, uiSleep or waitUntil commands can be used in current scope.

Command.Name: canTriggerDynamicSimulation
Command.Descr: A getter for triggerDynamicSimulation

Command.Name: canUnloadInCombat
Command.Descr: Check if cargo of this vehicle want to get out when in combat.

Command.Name: canVehicleCargo
Command.Descr: Returns bool array if it is possible to load cargo inside vehicle and if possible to load cargo into empty vehicle

Command.Name: cancelSimpleTaskDestination
Command.Descr: Cancels a simple task destination.

Command.Name: captive
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the unit is captive, false if not
Command.Descr: Returns if the given unit is captive. "captive" means that enemies will not shoot at the unit.

Command.Name: captiveNum
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - anything from 0 to value set by setCaptive alt syntax.
Command.Descr: Checks whether the unit is a captive. If the unit is a vehicle, its commander is checked instead.

Command.Name: catch
Command.Descr: Processes code when an exception is thrown in a try block. The exception caught can be found in the _exception variable.

Command.Name: cbChecked
Command.Descr: Returns the current state of a checkbox (CT_CHECKBOX type 77 of Dialog Control).

Command.Name: cbSetChecked
Command.Descr: Sets the current state of a checkbox (CT_CHECKBOX type 77 of Dialog Control).

Command.Name: ceil
Command.Descr: The ceil value of x.

Command.Name: channelEnabled
Command.Descr: Returns true or false depending on whether the given channel is enabled or disabled.

Command.Name: cheatsEnabled
Command.Descr: Checks whether cheats are enabled (whether the designers' version is running).

Command.Name: checkAIFeature
Command.Descr: Check if given AI feature is currently enabled. Feature may be one of:"AwareFormationSoft", "CombatFormationSoft".

Command.Name: checkAIFeature
Command.Descr: Check if given AI feature is currently enabled. Feature may be one of:"AwareFormationSoft", "CombatFormationSoft".

Command.Name: checkVisibility
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - how much end position is visible to start position in range 0..
Command.Descr: Checks if one position is visible from another position and how much.

Command.Name: className
Command.Descr: Returns short name of location.

Command.Name: clear3DENAttribute
Command.Descr: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: clear3DENAttribute
Command.Descr: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: clear3DENAttribute
Command.Descr: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: clear3DENAttribute
Command.Descr: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: clear3DENInventory
Command.Descr: Deletes inventory from mission.sqm of given units. Effect is not immediately visible, only when previewing the inventory resets to default.

Command.Name: clearAllItemsFromBackpack
Command.Descr: Removes all items from the backpack.

Command.Name: clearBackpackCargo
Command.Descr: Removes all backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

Command.Name: clearBackpackCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes all backpacks from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

Command.Name: clearForcesRTD
Command.Descr: Removes all force generators from world.For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled.

Command.Name: clearGroupIcons
Command.Descr: Removes all icon from group.

Command.Name: clearItemCargo
Command.Descr: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

Command.Name: clearItemCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

Command.Name: clearItemPool
Command.Descr: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container)

Command.Name: clearMagazineCargo
Command.Descr: Remove all magazines from the given vehicle's magazine cargo space.

Command.Name: clearMagazineCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes all magazines from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

Command.Name: clearMagazinePool
Command.Descr: Remove all magazines from the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

Command.Name: clearOverlay
Command.Descr: Clear the current overlay.

Command.Name: clearRadio
Command.Descr: Clean up the content of radio protocol history.

Command.Name: clearVehicleInit
Command.Descr: Clear the object's init. For security reasons, the command was disabled in Arma 3.

Command.Name: clearWeaponCargo
Command.Descr: Remove all weapons from the given vehicle's weapon cargo space.

Command.Name: clearWeaponCargoGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes all weapons from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

Command.Name: clearWeaponPool
Command.Descr: Remove all weapons from the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

Command.Name: clientOwner

Command.Name: closeDialog

Command.Name: closeOverlay

Command.Name: collect3DENHistory

Command.Name: collectiveRTD

Command.Name: combatMode

Command.Name: combatMode
Command.Descr: Returns the combat mode of the given unit. See setCombatMode for more information about combat modes.

Command.Name: commandArtilleryFire

Command.Name: commandChat

Command.Descr: Types text to the command radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages.

Command.Descr: In OFP it returns the commander of a vehicle. Since ArmA and VBS2 it returns the primary observer.

Command.Name: comment
Command.Descr: Define a comment. Mainly used in SQF Syntax, as you're able to introduce comment lines with semicolons in a SQS script.

Command.Descr: Commit the current overlay.

Command.Name: compile
Command.Descr: Compile expression.

Command.Name: completedFSM
Command.Descr: Check whether the given FSM completes.The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

Command.Name: composeText

Command.Name: configClasses
Command.Descr: Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code.

Command.Name: configFile

Command.Name: configHierarchy

Command.Name: configName

Command.Name: createAgent
Command.Descr: Creates an (independent) agent (person) of the given type (type is a name of a subclass of CfgVehicles).

Command.Name: createCenter
Command.Descr: In a nutshell, this command creates game Side. Without side it is not possible to create Groups.

Command.Name: createDialog
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true when the dialog was created successfully
Command.Descr: Create a dialog which is defined either in the mission's description.ext, in the campaign's description.ext or in the global resource.cpp.

Command.Name: createDiaryLink
Command.ReturnDescr: String - empty string "" or string in format ["<log subject=""%1"" record=""%2""
Command.Descr: Create a link to the section of diary given by subject. Record is selected based on given object (diary record,task or unit).

Command.Name: createDiaryRecord
Command.Descr: creates a diary entry.Supported tags and their parameters: image: String - path to image.
Command.Syntax: unitName createDiaryRecord [subject, text, task, taskState, showTitle]

Command.Name: createDiaryRecord
Command.Descr: creates a diary entry.Supported tags and their parameters: image: String - path to image.
Command.Syntax: unitName createDiaryRecord [subject, [title, text], task, stateState, showTitle]

Command.Name: createDiarySubject
Command.Descr: Create a new subject page in a log.

Command.Name: createDisplay
Command.Descr: Create child display of given display and load from "resourceName".
