Command.Descr: Create child display of given display and load from "resourceName".

Command.Name: createGearDialog
Command.Descr: Opens gear dialog for given unit.

Command.Name: createGroup
Command.Descr: Creates a new Group for the given Side. An HQ (center) for that side must already be in the Mission.sqm or have been initialized with createCenter.

Command.Name: createGroup
Command.Descr: Creates a new Group for the given Side. An HQ (center) for that side must already be in the Mission.sqm or have been initialized with createCenter.

Command.Name: createGuardedPoint
Command.Descr: Adds a point guarded by the given side (scripted way of adding equivalent of "GUARDED BY" trigger in Editor).

Command.Name: createLocation
Command.Descr: Creates a location of the specified class and dimensions at the specified position. Classes are defined in CfgLocationTypes.

Command.Name: createMPCampaignDisplay
Command.Descr: Create a MP campaign display.

Command.Name: createMarker
Command.Descr: Creates a new marker at the given position. The marker name has to be unique.

Command.Name: createMarkerLocal
Command.Descr: Creates a local marker at the given position. Marker exists only on PC that created it. The marker name has to be unique.

Command.Name: createMenu
Command.Descr: Creates a previously added menu.

Command.Name: createMine
Command.Descr: Creates a mine of the given type (type is the name of the subclass of CfgVehicles).

Command.Name: createMissionDisplay
Command.Descr: Create single missions display as a child of given display. The mission dialog will be set to the directory given as an argument "root".

Command.Name: createSimpleObject
Command.Descr: Create object with given shape defined as path to .p3d model. Supported LODs include Geometry, Fire Geometry, Roadway, View Geometry and ShadowVolume.

Command.Name: createSimpleObject
Command.Descr: Create object with given shape defined as path to .p3d model. Supported LODs include Geometry, Fire Geometry, Roadway, View Geometry and ShadowVolume.

Command.Name: createSimpleTask
Command.Descr: Creates a new Task. The task effect is local, it will only exist on PC it was added.

Command.Name: createSite
Command.Descr: Create a new site.

Command.Name: createSoundSource
Command.Descr: Creates a sound source of the given type (type is the name of the subclass of CfgVehicles which is pointing to the sound defined in CfgSFX).

Command.Name: createTask
Command.Descr: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.
Command.Syntax: teamMember createTask [[type, parentTask], priority, name1, value1, (...), nameN, valueN]

Command.Name: createTeam
Command.Descr: Create a team and name it.

Command.Name: createTrigger
Command.Descr: Creates a sensor (trigger) of the given type and at the given position.

Command.Name: createUnit
Command.Descr: Create unit of a class that's defined in CfgVehicles.The Group parameter MUST be an existing group or the unit won't be created.
Command.Syntax: group createUnit [type, position, markers, placement, special]

Command.Name: createUnit
Command.ReturnDescr: Nothing - This syntax does NOT return a unit reference! In order to reference t
Command.Descr: Create unit of a class that's defined in CfgVehicles.The Group parameter MUST be an existing group or the unit won't be created.
Command.Syntax: type createUnit [position, group, init, skill, rank]

Command.Name: createVehicle
Command.Descr: Creates an empty object of given classname type (See Arma 3 Assets or createVehicle/vehicles)For a class reference from older games see Classes.

Command.Name: createVehicle
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - created vehicle or objNull if failed
Command.Descr: Creates an empty object of given classname type (See Arma 3 Assets or createVehicle/vehicles)For a class reference from older games see Classes.

Command.Name: createVehicleCrew
Command.ReturnDescr: Group - the group of the created crew (since Arma 3 v1.93.
Command.Descr: Creates crew to given empty vehicle. Crew members are default crew defined in config. Crew side will also correspond to vehicle's faction.

Command.Name: createVehicleLocal
Command.Descr: Creates an object of the given type. Created object is not transferred through network in MP games.

Command.Name: crew
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - An array with all units in the vehicle is returned.
Command.Descr: Returns the crew (both dead and alive) of the given vehicle.

Command.Name: ctAddHeader
Command.Descr: Adds a header line of controls according to the HeaderTemplate class.

Command.Name: ctAddRow
Command.Descr: Adds one row of controls according to the RowTemplate class. It returns an array containing row index and array of created controls in a format [, [, .

Command.Name: ctClear
Command.Descr: Removes all the lines from the RscControlsTable. Returns Nothing.

Command.Name: ctCurSel
Command.Descr: Returns index of the selected row. Will take only rows, but not headers into account.

Command.Name: ctData
Command.Descr: Returns metadata (string) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

Command.Name: ctFindHeaderRows
Command.Descr: Takes index of a header as a parameter. Returns array of indices of rows under this header.

Command.Name: ctFindRowHeader
Command.Descr: Takes index of a row as a parameter. Returns index of the closest header above this row.

Command.Name: ctHeaderControls
Command.Descr: Returns array of controls on the header with the given index.

Command.Name: ctHeaderCount
Command.Descr: Returns number of headers (rows not included) in the RscControlsTable.

Command.Name: ctRemoveHeaders
Command.Descr: Takes array of header indices as a parameter and removes headers with those indices. Indices of remaining headers will be recomputed.

Command.Name: ctRemoveRows
Command.Descr: Takes array of row indices as a parameter and removes rows with those indices. Indices of remaining rows will be recomputed.

Command.Name: ctRowControls
Command.Descr: Returns array of controls on the row with the given index.

Command.Name: ctRowCount
Command.Descr: Returns number of rows (headers not included) in the RscControlsTable.

Command.Name: ctSetCurSel
Command.Descr: Selects the line with the given index. Will take only rows, but not headers into account. -1 deselects all. Returns Nothing.

Command.Name: ctSetData
Command.Descr: Associates metadata (string) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

Command.Name: ctSetHeaderTemplate
Command.Descr: Takes config path to the new header template. Clears the whole RscControlsTable and sets the new header template.

Command.Name: ctSetRowTemplate
Command.Descr: Takes config path to the new row template.

Command.Name: ctSetValue
Command.Descr: Associates metadata (number) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

Command.Name: ctValue
Command.Descr: Returns metadata (number) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

Command.Name: ctrlActivate
Command.Descr: Launch actions attached to given (button based) control.

Command.Name: ctrlAddEventHandler
Command.Descr: Add an event handler (User Interface Event Handlers) to the given control. Returns id of the handler or -1 when failed.

Command.Name: ctrlAngle
Command.Descr: Gets rotation info of an ST_PICTURE control.

Command.Name: ctrlAnimateModel
Command.Descr: Process an animation of 3D Dialog Control. Command uses name defined by source property and works similar like animateSource command.

Command.Name: ctrlAnimationPhaseModel
Command.Descr: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationSourcePhase.

Command.Name: ctrlAutoScrollDelay
Command.Descr: Returns number of seconds auto-scroll will wait before scroll and/or rewind. -2 if scrollbar not present.

Command.Name: ctrlAutoScrollRewind
Command.Descr: Returns true if auto-scroll should move back to start after it reaches the end.

Command.Name: ctrlAutoScrollSpeed
Command.Descr: Returns number of seconds to auto-scroll one line. -1 if auto-scroll is disabled. -2 if scrollbar not present.

Command.Name: ctrlChecked
Command.Descr: Returns the current state of checkbox (CT_CHECKBOXES, Type 7).

Command.Name: ctrlChecked
Command.Descr: Returns the current state of checkbox (CT_CHECKBOXES, Type 7).

Command.Name: ctrlClassName
Command.Descr: Returns the class name of a control as it defined in config.

Command.Name: ctrlCommit
Command.Descr: Commit control animation.

Command.Name: ctrlCommitted
Command.Descr: Check if the control animation is finished.

Command.Name: ctrlCreate
Command.Descr: Creates new control in given display.

Command.Name: ctrlDelete
Command.Descr: Deletes given control.Returns whether the deletion was successful.

Command.Name: ctrlEnable
Command.Descr: Enable or disable a control of the currently active user dialog. Disabled controls cannot be clicked onto.

Command.Name: ctrlEnable
Command.Descr: Enable or disable a control of the currently active user dialog. Disabled controls cannot be clicked onto.

Command.Name: ctrlEnabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the control is enabled, false if not.
Command.Descr: Returns if a control on the currently active user dialog is enabled. Disabled controls cannot be focused.

Command.Name: ctrlEnabled
Command.Descr: Returns if a control on the currently active user dialog is enabled. Disabled controls cannot be focused.

Command.Name: ctrlFade
Command.Descr: Returns the current fade factor of control.

Command.Name: ctrlHTMLLoaded
Command.Descr: Returns true when HTML content was successfully loaded.

Command.Name: ctrlIDC
Command.Descr: Returns control IDC.

Command.Name: ctrlIDD
Command.Descr: Returns display IDD.

Command.Name: ctrlMapAnimAdd
Command.Descr: Adds the next frame to the map animation.

Command.Name: ctrlMapAnimClear
Command.Descr: Clears the map animation.

Command.Name: ctrlMapAnimCommit
Command.Descr: Plays the map animation.

Command.Name: ctrlMapAnimDone
Command.Descr: Checks whether the map animation has finished.

Command.Name: ctrlMapCursor
Command.Descr: Changes the default cursor that appears when interacting with a map control to a custom one. Use an empty string to restore the default cursor.

Command.Name: ctrlMapMouseOver
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Possible values:["unit", Object]["vehicle", Object]["vehicleGroup", O
Command.Descr: Returns description of map sign mouse cursor is over. Works with in-game map as well as 2D editor map in edit mode.

Command.Name: ctrlMapScale
Command.Descr: Returns the current scale of given map control.

Command.Name: ctrlMapScreenToWorld
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - world coordinates in format Position2D
Command.Descr: Convert screen coordinates in map to world coordinates.

Command.Name: ctrlMapWorldToScreen
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - screen coordinates in format [x, y]
Command.Descr: Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to posWorldToScreen.

Command.Name: ctrlModel
Command.Descr: Returns model used in 3D Dialog Control.

Command.Name: ctrlModelDirAndUp
Command.Descr: Returns vectorDir and vectorUp of the model used in 3D Dialog Control.

Command.Name: ctrlModelScale
Command.Descr: Returns 3D control model scale

Command.Name: ctrlMousePosition
Command.Descr: Returns position of the mouse on the screen relative to UI Control in UI coordinates.

Command.Name: ctrlParent
Command.Descr: Returns container of the given control.

Command.Name: ctrlParentControlsGroup
Command.Descr: Returns the parent control of a given child control

Command.Name: ctrlPosition
Command.Descr: Returns the current position of 2D control as [x, y, w, h] array. For 3D control it returns relative [x,y,z].

Command.Name: ctrlRemoveAllEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Remove all event handlers from the given control.

Command.Name: ctrlRemoveEventHandler
Command.Descr: Remove a given event handler from the given control.

Command.Name: ctrlScale
Command.Descr: Returns the current scale of the control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetActiveColor
Command.Descr: Sets text color of given control when control is selected.

Command.Name: ctrlSetAngle
Command.Descr: Sets the rotation of an ST_PICTURE control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetAngle
Command.Descr: Sets the rotation of an ST_PICTURE control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetAutoScrollDelay
Command.Descr: Sets number of second before auto-scroll starts/rewinds. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollDelay.

Command.Name: ctrlSetAutoScrollRewind
Command.Descr: Defines if scroll should rewind when auto-scroll reach end. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollRewind.

Command.Name: ctrlSetAutoScrollSpeed
Command.Descr: Sets number of second required to scroll to next line. If speed < 0, auto-scroll is disabled. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollSpeed.

Command.Name: ctrlSetBackgroundColor
Command.Descr: Sets background color of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetChecked
Command.Descr: Sets checked state of checkbox (CT_CHECKBOXES, Type 7).

Command.Name: ctrlSetChecked
Command.Descr: Sets checked state of checkbox (CT_CHECKBOXES, Type 7).

Command.Name: ctrlSetEventHandler
Command.Descr: Sets given event handler of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFade
Command.Descr: Sets wanted transparency for control animation. Requires ctrlCommit to commit changes.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFocus
Command.Descr: Set the input focus on given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFont
Command.Descr: Sets the font of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH1
Command.Descr: Sets H1 font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH1B
Command.Descr: Sets H1 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH2
Command.Descr: Sets H2 font of given HTML control

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH2B
Command.Descr: Sets H2 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH3
Command.Descr: Sets H3 font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH3B
Command.Descr: Sets H3 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH4
Command.Descr: Sets H4 font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH4B
Command.Descr: Sets H4 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH5
Command.Descr: Sets H5 font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH5B
Command.Descr: Sets H5 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH6
Command.Descr: Sets H6 font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontH6B
Command.Descr: Sets H6 bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeight
Command.Descr: Sets the font size of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH1
Command.Descr: Sets H1 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH2
Command.Descr: Sets H2 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH3
Command.Descr: Sets H3 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH4
Command.Descr: Sets H3 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH5
Command.Descr: Sets H5 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightH6
Command.Descr: Sets H6 font size of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontHeightSecondary
Command.Descr: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontP
Command.Descr: Sets P font of given HTML control or its size.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontP
Command.Descr: Sets P font of given HTML control or its size.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontPB
Command.Descr: Sets P bold font of given HTML control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetFontSecondary
Command.Descr: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetForegroundColor
Command.Descr: Sets foreground color of given control. Color is in format Color.

Command.Name: ctrlSetModel
Command.Descr: Sets model for 3D Dialog Control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetModelDirAndUp
Command.Descr: Sets orientation of 3D control model. It is similar to setVectorDirAndUp command for an object.

Command.Name: ctrlSetModelScale
Command.Descr: Sets 3D control model scale

Command.Name: ctrlSetPixelPrecision
Command.Descr: Enable or disable pixel precision (rounding) in a given control interface.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPixelPrecision
Command.Descr: Enable or disable pixel precision (rounding) in a given control interface.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPosition
Command.Descr: Sets wanted position and size for 2D control animation. Width and height are optional. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPosition
Command.Descr: Sets wanted position and size for 2D control animation. Width and height are optional. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPosition
Command.Descr: Sets wanted position and size for 2D control animation. Width and height are optional. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPositionH
Command.Descr: Sets wanted H position for 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPositionW
Command.Descr: Sets wanted W position for 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPositionX
Command.Descr: Sets wanted X position for 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetPositionY
Command.Descr: Sets wanted Y position for 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

Command.Name: ctrlSetScale
Command.Descr: Sets wanted scale for control animation. Top left corner remains same. This command requires ctrlCommit.

Command.Name: ctrlSetStructuredText
Command.Descr: Set the structured text which will be displayed in structured text control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetText
Command.Descr: Set the text of a control of the currently active user dialog or display.

Command.Name: ctrlSetText
Command.Descr: Set the text of a control of the currently active user dialog or display.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTextColor
Command.Descr: Sets text color of given control. Color is in format Color. As of Arma 3 v1.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTextColorSecondary
Command.Descr: Sets the secondary text color of a text control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTextSecondary
Command.Descr: Sets the secondary text of a text control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTextSelection
Command.Descr: Selects 'length' characters of edit control from the 'start' position and places cursor at the end of selection.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTooltip
Command.Descr: Sets tooltip text of given control.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTooltipColorBox
Command.Descr: Sets tooltip border color of given control. Color is in format Color.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTooltipColorShade
Command.Descr: Sets tooltip background color of given control. Color is in format Color.

Command.Name: ctrlSetTooltipColorText
Command.Descr: Sets tooltip text color of given control. Color is in format Color.

Command.Name: ctrlShow
Command.Descr: Set if a control of the currently active user dialog is shown or not.Read Dialog Control for more information about user dialogs and controls.

Command.Name: ctrlShow
Command.Descr: Set if a control of the currently active user dialog is shown or not.Read Dialog Control for more information about user dialogs and controls.

Command.Name: ctrlShown
Command.Descr: Returns whether given control is shown.

Command.Name: ctrlText
Command.ReturnDescr: String - The text or image path is returned, dependent on the control type.
Command.Descr: Returns the text of a control of the currently active user dialog.

Command.Name: ctrlText
Command.Descr: Returns the text of a control of the currently active user dialog.

Command.Name: ctrlTextColor
Command.Descr: Returns control's text color in Color format (see ctrlSetTextColor).

Command.Name: ctrlTextHeight
Command.Descr: Returns the control text height. Supported control types are: CT_STATIC 0 CT_EDIT 2 (Since Arma 3 v1.57.

Command.Name: ctrlTextSecondary
Command.ReturnDescr: String - Secondary text of given control
Command.Descr: Returns the secondary text of a text control.

Command.Name: ctrlTextSelection
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [start, length, selectedText] where:start: Number - position in
Command.Descr: Returns edit control text selection in format [start, length, selectedText]

Command.Name: ctrlTextWidth
Command.Descr: Returns the control text width.

Command.Name: ctrlType
Command.Descr: Returns number representing the type of control, which is also defined by type property in config.

Command.Name: ctrlVisible
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the control is shown, false if not
Command.Descr: Returns if a control of the currently active user dialog is shown or not. Read Dialog Control for more information about user dialogs and controls.

Command.Name: curatorAddons
Command.Descr: Returns list of addons allowed to given curator.

Command.Name: curatorCamera
Command.Descr: Returns curator camera object.

Command.Name: curatorCameraArea
Command.Descr: Returns all curator camera areas.

Command.Name: curatorCameraAreaCeiling
Command.Descr: Returns ceiling height for curator camera.

Command.Name: curatorCoef
Command.Descr: Returns current coeficient setting.

Command.Name: curatorEditableObjects
Command.Descr: Returns all editable objects which belong to a curator.

Command.Name: curatorEditingArea
Command.Descr: Returns all curator editing areas.

Command.Name: curatorEditingAreaType
Command.Descr: Returns type of edit areas assigned to curator (blacklist/whitelist).

Command.Name: curatorMouseOver
Command.Descr: Returns Curator Editable Object under curator mouse pointer in form of array: [] - when not in curator mode [""] - if no curator editable object und

Command.Name: curatorPoints
Command.Descr: Returns number of points that curator have. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: curatorRegisteredObjects
Command.Descr: Returns array with all objects that has curator registered and their settings.

Command.Name: curatorSelected
Command.Descr: Returns list of all curator selected items.

Command.Name: curatorWaypointCost
Command.Descr: Return current price for placing waypoints (curator specific).

Command.Name: current3DENOperation
Command.Descr: Returns the currently performed editing operation in Eden Editor.

Command.Name: currentChannel
Command.Descr: Returns currently selected user chat channel on the UI (selected with in MP).

Command.Name: currentCommand
Command.Descr: Return the current command type (empty string when no command) for the commander of given vehicle (or for a given soldier).

Command.Name: currentMagazine
Command.Descr: Returns class name of currently loaded vehicle's magazine.

Command.Name: currentMagazineDetail
Command.Descr: Returns description of vehicle's currently loaded magazine, its ammo count (current/default) and its id.

Command.Name: currentMagazineDetailTurret
Command.Descr: Returns the class name of currently used magazine on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: currentMagazineTurret
Command.Descr: Returns the name of the type of the currently using magazine on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: currentMuzzle
Command.Descr: Returns current muzzle of unit's weapon. This command will return 0 Number if given object is a vehicle instead of a person.

Command.Name: currentNamespace
Command.Descr: Returns current global namespace the script runs in.

Command.Name: currentPilot
Command.Descr: Returns the person piloting the vehicle. If co-pilot is piloting, co-pilot is returned.

Command.Name: currentTask
Command.Descr: Return current task of given person.

Command.Name: currentTasks
Command.Descr: List all uncompleted tasks.

Command.Name: currentThrowable
Command.Descr: Returns currently selected throwable, which will be launched if user presses "G". Please note: The weapon/magazine id system is W.I.P.

Command.Name: currentVisionMode
Command.Descr: Returns current vision mode of unit's weapon.

Command.Name: currentWaypoint
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - the index of current waypoint
Command.Descr: Return the index of the current waypoint.To determine the validity of the index, compare it to the waypoints count.

Command.Name: currentWeapon
Command.Descr: Return the name of the currently selected weapon (on the primary turret for vehicles).

Command.Name: currentWeaponMode
Command.Descr: Returns current weapon mode of unit's weapon.

Command.Name: currentWeaponTurret
Command.Descr: Returns the name of the currently selected weapon on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: currentZeroing
Command.Descr: Returns zeroing of unit's weapon.

Command.Name: cursorObject
Command.Descr: Returns the object under cursor.

Command.Name: cursorTarget
Command.Descr: Returns the target pointed at by the player (usually with cross-hairs). The target has to be known to the player to some degree (knowsAbout > 0).

Command.Name: customChat
Command.Descr: Sends the chat message to the custom radio channel. The radio channel needs to be created on the server before hand, with radioChannelCreate command.

Command.Name: customRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the message to the custom radio channel. The message is defined in the description.ext file or radio protocol.

Command.Name: customWaypointPosition
Command.Descr: Returns player's custom waypoint position.

Command.Name: cutFadeOut
Command.Descr: Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration.

Command.Name: cutFadeOut
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - number of the corresponding layer
Command.Descr: Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration.

Command.Name: cutObj
Command.Descr: Displays an object defined in the global config in CfgTitles.

Command.Name: cutObj
Command.Descr: Displays an object defined in the global config in CfgTitles.

Command.Name: cutObj
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - number of the allocated layer
Command.Descr: Displays an object defined in the global config in CfgTitles.

Command.Name: cutRsc
Command.Descr: Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's Description.ext, the campaign's description.ext or the global config.

Command.Name: cutRsc
Command.Descr: Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's Description.ext, the campaign's description.ext or the global config.

Command.Name: cutRsc
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - number of the allocated layer
Command.Descr: Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's Description.ext, the campaign's description.ext or the global config.

Command.Name: cutText
Command.Descr: Displays a text message in the center of the screen.

Command.Name: cutText
Command.Descr: Displays a text message in the center of the screen.
Command.Syntax: layer cutText [text, type, speed, showInMap, isStructuredText]

Command.Name: cutText
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - number of the allocated layer
Command.Descr: Displays a text message in the center of the screen.
Command.Syntax: layerName cutText [text, type, speed, showInMap, isStructuredText]

Command.Name: damage
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - the returned number in range (healthy) 0..1 (dead).
Command.Descr: Return the damage value of an object.

Command.Name: date
Command.ReturnDescr: Date - format [year, month, day, hour, minute]
Command.Descr: Return the actual mission date and time as an array [year, month, day, hour, minute].

Command.Name: dateToNumber
Command.Descr: Convert a date to a float number, based on Jan 1st 00:00:00 = 0 and Dec 31st 23:59:59 = 1.

Command.Name: daytime
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - day time using a 24 hour clock, using fractions of hours.
Command.Descr: Returns the current ingame time in hours.

Command.Name: deActivateKey
Command.Descr: Deactivates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.

Command.Name: debriefingText
Command.Descr: Returns debriefing text.

Command.Name: debugFSM
Command.Descr: Dump (something about FSM) to debugging output. This command is (assumed to be) non-functional in the retail version.

Command.Name: debugLog
Command.Descr: Dump argument type and value to debugging output.

Command.Name: decayGraphValues
Command.Descr: Multiplies graph values by the given coefficient. The corresponding lower bound value is used instead if the product is smaller than the bound.

Command.Name: deg
Command.Descr: Convert a number from Radians to Degrees.

Command.Name: delete3DENEntities
Command.Descr: Delete given entities in Eden Editor, including anything that can be placed in editor.

Command.Name: deleteAt
Command.Descr: Removes array element at the given index and returns removed element (modifies the original array, just like resize or set).

Command.Name: deleteCenter
Command.Descr: In a nutshell, this command removes gaming Side (see createCenter). If a side has >0 Groups it cannot be deleted.

Command.Name: deleteCollection
Command.Descr: Delete a collection. As example, used with a soldier, it'll hide the ingame model.When targetting ArmA 2 1.06 or newer, use hideObject instead.

Command.Name: deleteEditorObject
Command.Descr: Delete the editor object. Requires all editor object links to be removed prior.

Command.Name: deleteGroup
Command.Descr: Destroys the given group. Group must be empty and local to the machine executing command.

Command.Name: deleteGroupWhenEmpty
Command.Descr: Marks given group for auto-deletion when group is empty.

Command.Name: deleteIdentity
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the identy was deleted successfully, false if not
Command.Descr: Delete an identity (created with saveIdentity) from the campaign's progress file.

Command.Name: deleteLocation
Command.Descr: Delete a location.

Command.Name: deleteMarker
Command.Descr: Destroys the given marker.

Command.Name: deleteMarkerLocal
Command.Descr: Destroys the given marker.

Command.Name: deleteRange
Command.Descr: Removes a range of array elements from the given array (modifies the original array, just like resize or set).

Command.Name: deleteResources
Command.Descr: Delete (unregister) resources of the team member. Resources are deleted in the order they were added. Case insensitive.

Command.Name: deleteSite
Command.Descr: Removes the site.

Command.Name: deleteStatus
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the status was deleted successfully, false if not
Command.Descr: Delete a status (created with saveStatus) from the campaign's progress file.

Command.Name: deleteTeam
Command.Descr: Destroy given team.

Command.Name: deleteVehicle
Command.Descr: Deletes an object. Only units inserted in the mission editor and units created during the game's progress can be deleted by this command.

Command.Name: deleteVehicleCrew
Command.Descr: Deletes a member of the crew of a vehicle. Human players cannot be deleted.

Command.Name: deleteWaypoint
Command.Descr: Removes the specified waypoint.

Command.Name: detach
Command.Descr: Detaches previously attached with attachTo object.

Command.Name: detectedMines
Command.Descr: Returns an array of all mines detected by a given side

Command.Name: diag_activeMissionFSMs
Command.Descr: Returns array with active Mission FSMs.

Command.Name: diag_activeSQFScripts
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Arrays - to format [[scriptName, fileName, isRunning, currentLine], ...
Command.Descr: Returns an array with active SQFs.

Command.Name: diag_activeSQSScripts
Command.Descr: Returns array with active SQSs.

Command.Name: diag_activeScripts
Command.Descr: Returns 4 element array with numbers of currently running scripts in format: [spawn-ed, execVM-ed, exec-ed, execFSM-ed]

Command.Name: diag_allMissionEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Returns an array with all mission event handlers.

Command.Name: diag_captureFrame
Command.Descr: This command starts counting frames from the moment it is executed and when the count reaches the number passed as param, the current frame is capture

Command.Name: diag_captureFrameToFile
Command.Descr: This command starts counting frames from the moment it is executed and when the count reaches the number passed as param, the current frame is capture

Command.Name: diag_captureSlowFrame
Command.Descr: Opens "capture frame" dialog if current frame exceeds set threshold in seconds.

Command.Name: diag_codePerformance
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [duration, cycles], where:duration: Number - average duration of
Command.Descr: Attempts to run given code with given arguments given number of cycles in unscheduled environment and returns average time it took to run the code as

Command.Name: diag_deltaTime
Command.Descr: Returns the duration of the previous frame in seconds

Command.Name: diag_drawMode
Command.Descr: Activates specific debug visualization.

Command.Name: diag_dynamicSimulationEnd
Command.Descr: Ends dynamic simulation stats gathering and writes it into given file.

Command.Name: diag_enable
Command.Descr: Used to enable/disabled various diagnostics.

Command.Name: diag_enabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true when enabled, false when disabled
Command.Descr: Checks whether specific diagnostic mode is activated.

Command.Name: diag_fps
Command.Descr: Returns average framerate calculated over last 16 frames.

Command.Name: diag_fpsMin
Command.Descr: Returns minimal framerate. Calculated from the longest frame over last 16 frames.

Command.Name: diag_frameNo
Command.Descr: Returns number of frame currently displayed.

Command.Name: diag_lightNewLoad
Command.Descr: Allows loading of lightning config during the gameplay (effectively changing the current scene lightning).

Command.Name: diag_list
Command.Descr: Returns an array of all diag modes available in the game.

Command.Name: diag_log
Command.Descr: Dumps the argument's value to the report file. Each call creates a new line in the file.

Command.Name: diag_logSlowFrame
Command.Descr: Log all frames, where section takes longer than the threshold (in seconds). Note: Only available in specific builds.

Command.Name: diag_mergeConfigFile
Command.Descr: Adjust configs on-the-fly without the need of restarting the game (by merging the given config file into the main config in memory).

Command.Name: diag_recordTurretLimits
Command.Descr: Start recording tool for creating turret aiming limits.

Command.Name: diag_resetShapes
Command.Descr: Reload models on-the-fly without the need of restarting the game.

Command.Name: diag_scope
Command.Descr: Returns script scope depth. When script is directly executed by the engine or a new script is added to the scheduler, the scope depth is 0.

Command.Name: diag_setLightNew
Command.Descr: Overrides currently used scene lightning. The operand is config that is placed as a string (not file).

Command.Name: diag_tickTime
Command.Descr: Real time spent from the start of the game. Expressed in fractions of second. Resolution of 1 tick is 1 ms.

Command.Name: diag_toggle
Command.Descr: Used to enable/disabled various diagnostics.

Command.Name: dialog
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if a dialog is open, false if not
Command.Descr: Tests whether any user dialog is open.

Command.Name: diaryRecordNull
Command.Descr: isNull diaryRecordNull; //truediaryRecordNull isEqualTo diaryRecordNull; //true

Command.Name: diarySubjectExists
Command.Descr: Checks whether given subject is present in the diary of given person.

Command.Name: didJIP
Command.Descr: Checks if the current client Joined In Progress.

Command.Name: didJIPOwner
Command.Descr: Checks if the current owner of supplied Object Joined In Progress. Server execution only. On clients returns false.

Command.Name: difficulty
Command.Descr: Returns high-level selected difficulty mode.

Command.Name: difficultyEnabled
Command.Descr: This command is deprecated since Arma 3 1.58. Since this version it always returns false. Use difficultyOption instead.

Command.Name: difficultyEnabledRTD
Command.Descr: Returns true if rotorlib simulation is enabled.

Command.Name: difficultyOption
Command.Descr: Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user.

Command.Name: directSay
Command.Descr: Sends given audio message to the direct channel.

Command.Name: direction
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Direction in degrees, range 0 to 360
Command.Descr: Returns the direction an object or a location is facing (differs from getDir in that this also works with locations).

Command.Name: direction
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Direction in degrees, range 0 to 360
Command.Descr: Returns the direction an object or a location is facing (differs from getDir in that this also works with locations).

Command.Name: disableAI
Command.Descr: Disable parts of the AI behaviour to get a better control over the actions of a unit. Must be executed where AI unit is local.

Command.Name: disableCollisionWith
Command.Descr: Disable collision between vehicles. This commmand doesn't disable collision between PhysX objects.

Command.Name: disableConversation
Command.Descr: Disable the ability to talk to other people.

Command.Name: disableDebriefingStats
Command.Descr: Disable debrifing score table.

Command.Name: disableMapIndicators
Command.Descr: Command allows suppressing visualization of FRIENDLY, ENEMY, MINES and/or PING map indicators from difficulty setting EXTENDED MAP CONTENT.

Command.Name: disableNVGEquipment
Command.Descr: Enables or disables transport NV (Night Vision). To disable TI (Thermal Imaging) use disableTIEquipment.

Command.Name: disableRemoteSensors
Command.Descr: This command will halt raycasting calculations (on the local machine only) for all groups which don't contain any local entities.

Command.Name: disableSerialization
Command.Descr: Disable saving of script containing this command. After this script can work with the data types which do not support serialization (UI types).

Command.Name: disableTIEquipment
Command.Descr: Disables TI (Thermal Imaging) equipment for given vehicle.

Command.Name: disableUAVConnectability
Command.Descr: Disables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

Command.Name: disableUserInput
Command.Descr: Disable and enable the keyboard and mouse input, usually used during cutscenes.

Command.Name: displayAddEventHandler
Command.Descr: Adds an event handler to the given display. Returns the ID of the event handler, or -1 when failed.

Command.Name: displayCtrl
Command.Descr: Return child control with specified idc.

Command.Name: displayParent
Command.Descr: Returns parent display of the given display.

Command.Name: displayRemoveAllEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Remove all even handlers from the given display.

Command.Name: displayRemoveEventHandler
Command.Descr: Remove a given event handler from the given display.

Command.Name: displaySetEventHandler
Command.Descr: Sets given event handler of given display.The return code of the provided function should indicate whether this event was handled correctly.

Command.Name: dissolveTeam
Command.Descr: Dissolves the given team. All members become members of the main team. Possible team values are: "RED", "GREEN", "BLUE" or "YELLOW".

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

Command.Name: distance2D
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a 2D distance (distance projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two Objects or two Positions or Object and Position.

Command.Name: distance2D
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a 2D distance (distance projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two Objects or two Positions or Object and Position.

Command.Name: distance2D
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a 2D distance (distance projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two Objects or two Positions or Object and Position.

Command.Name: distance2D
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Returns a 2D distance (distance projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two Objects or two Positions or Object and Position.

Command.Name: distanceSqr
Command.ReturnDescr: Number Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Computes the squared distance between two objects or positions.

Command.Name: distanceSqr
Command.ReturnDescr: Number Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Computes the squared distance between two objects or positions.

Command.Name: distanceSqr
Command.ReturnDescr: Number Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Computes the squared distance between two objects or positions.

Command.Name: distanceSqr
Command.ReturnDescr: Number Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
Command.Descr: Computes the squared distance between two objects or positions.

Command.Name: distributionRegion
Command.Descr: Returns the numerical index for the distribution region of this copy of ArmA.

Command.Name: do3DENAction
Command.Descr: Performs given Eden Editor action.See the list of all actions.

Command.Name: doArtilleryFire
Command.Descr: Orders a unit to reload defined magazine commence fire burst on the given position (silently).

Command.Name: doFSM
Command.Descr: Orders a unit to process command defined by FSM file (silently).

Command.Name: doFSM
Command.Descr: Orders a unit to process command defined by FSM file (silently).

Command.Name: doFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages).The target is set with doTarget or commandTarget.

Command.Name: doFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages).The target is set with doTarget or commandTarget.

Command.Name: doFollow
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to follow the given other unit or vehicle eg (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doFollow
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to follow the given other unit or vehicle eg (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doGetOut
Command.Descr: Orders a unit or units to get out from the vehicle (silently).

Command.Name: doGetOut
Command.Descr: Orders a unit or units to get out from the vehicle (silently).

Command.Name: doMove
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given position (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doMove
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given position (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doStop
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to stop (without radio messages). The units stopped in this way will leave the groups formation.

Command.Name: doStop
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to stop (without radio messages). The units stopped in this way will leave the groups formation.

Command.Name: doSuppressiveFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit to suppress a given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doSuppressiveFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit to suppress a given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doSuppressiveFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit to suppress a given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doSuppressiveFire
Command.Descr: Order the given unit to suppress a given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doTarget
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doTarget
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doWatch
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doWatch
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doWatch
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doWatch
Command.Descr: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages).

Command.Name: doorPhase
Command.Descr: Return animation phase of door on vehicle.

Command.Name: drawArrow
Command.Descr: Draws a single line arrow on the map.

Command.Name: drawEllipse
Command.Descr: Draws an ellipse on the map. Just like with marker or trigger area, negative a and b will result in hexagon.
Command.Syntax: map drawEllipse [c, a, b, angle, color, fill]

Command.Name: drawIcon
Command.Descr: Draw an icon on the map. The command needs to be called every frame, preferably with "Draw" control event handler ctrlAddEventHandler.
Command.Syntax: map drawIcon [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, align]

Command.Name: drawIcon3D
Command.Descr: Draws an ingame icon at a given position. Command has to be executed each frame.
Command.Syntax: drawIcon3D [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, textAlign, drawSideArrows]

Command.Name: drawLine
Command.Descr: Draw a line on the map.

Command.Name: drawLine3D
Command.Descr: Draws a line of a given color between two 3D positions. Command has to be executed each frame. Use onEachFrame or addMissionEventHandler "Draw3D".

Command.Name: drawLink
Command.Descr: The editor will draw a line between the two specified editor objects. Line type can be LINE or ARROW.

Command.Name: drawLocation
Command.Descr: Unknown effect.

Command.Name: drawPolygon
Command.Descr: Draws given polygon on the given map control with given color. The polygon must consist of at least 3 points.

Command.Name: drawRectangle
Command.Descr: Draws a rectangle on the map.
Command.Syntax: map drawRectangle [c, a, b, angle, color, fill]

Command.Name: drawTriangle
Command.Descr: Draws a single triangle or multiple triangles on the map.

Command.Name: driver
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - The unit sitting in the driver place is returned.
Command.Descr: Returns the driver of a vehicle.

Command.Name: drop
Command.Descr: Creates a particle effect.This command is used to create smoke, fire and similar effects.

Command.Name: dynamicSimulationDistance
Command.Descr: A getter for setDynamicSimulationDistance

Command.Name: dynamicSimulationDistanceCoef
Command.Descr: A getter for setDynamicSimulationDistanceCoef

Command.Name: dynamicSimulationEnabled
Command.Descr: A getter for enableDynamicSimulation

Command.Name: dynamicSimulationEnabled
Command.Descr: A getter for enableDynamicSimulation

Command.Name: dynamicSimulationSystemEnabled
Command.Descr: A getter for enableDynamicSimulationSystem

Command.Name: echo
Command.Descr: Sends any text into the debugger console or the logfile. Present in internal version only, not working in the retail version.

Command.Name: edit3DENMissionAttributes
Command.Descr: Open a window with scenario attribute in given section.

Command.Name: editObject
Command.Descr: Show the edit object dialog for the given object.

Command.Name: editorSetEventHandler
Command.Descr: Sets given event handler of given editor.

Command.Name: effectiveCommander
Command.Descr: Returns the effective commander of the vehicle. Effective commander is the player whom driver AI will listen to.

Command.Name: elevatePeriscope
Command.Descr: Elevates periscope of a vehicle.

Command.Name: emptyPositions
Command.Descr: Returns the number of given positions in the vehicle.

Command.Name: enableAI
Command.Descr: Enables parts of the AI behavior that was disabled by disableAI.

Command.Name: enableAIFeature
Command.Descr: Enable/disable given AI feature. Feature may be one of:"AwareFormationSoft", "CombatFormationSoft".

Command.Name: enableAIFeature
Command.Descr: Enable/disable given AI feature. Feature may be one of:"AwareFormationSoft", "CombatFormationSoft".

Command.Name: enableAimPrecision
Command.Descr: Set whether animation's aim precision affects weapon sway.

Command.Name: enableAttack
Command.Descr: Set if leader can issue attack commands to the soldiers in his group.

Command.Name: enableAttack
Command.Descr: Set if leader can issue attack commands to the soldiers in his group.

Command.Name: enableAudioFeature
Command.Descr: Enable/disable an audio feature, features are: "lowpass", "building_interior".

Command.Name: enableAutoStartUpRTD
Command.Descr: Toggle availability of the automated helicopter start-up and shutdown sequences.

Command.Name: enableAutoTrimRTD
Command.Descr: Toggle auto-trim for RTD helicopters.

Command.Name: enableCamShake
Command.Descr: Allows camera shake effects via addCamShake. If set to false, then a currently active shake effect will stop immediately.

Command.Name: enableCaustics
Command.Descr: Enable/disable caustics drawing.

Command.Name: enableChannel
Command.Descr: Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel.

Command.Name: enableChannel
Command.Descr: Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel.

Command.Name: enableCollisionWith
Command.Descr: Enable collision between vehicles.

Command.Name: enableCopilot
Command.Descr: Enables copilot actions.

Command.Name: enableDebriefingStats
Command.Descr: enable debrifing score table.

Command.Name: enableDiagLegend
Command.Descr: Enable or disable the legend for diagnostics.

Command.Name: enableDynamicSimulation
Command.Descr: Enables or disables Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for given non AI object

Command.Name: enableDynamicSimulation
Command.Descr: Enables or disables Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for given non AI object

Command.Name: enableDynamicSimulationSystem
Command.Descr: Enables or disables the whole Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation system

Command.Name: enableEndDialog
Command.Descr: Enables the execution of a custom camera sequence after the players death, coded in the script onPlayerKilled.sqs.

Command.Name: enableEngineArtillery
Command.Descr: Enable/disable the artillery engine. This allows the user to use the artillery computer on mortar/artillery, and for AI to use it for indirect fire.

Command.Name: enableEnvironment
Command.Descr: Enable/disable environmental effects (ambient life + sound).

Command.Name: enableEnvironment
Command.Descr: Enable/disable environmental effects (ambient life + sound).

Command.Name: enableFatigue
Command.Descr: Enables/Disables the person's fatigue.

Command.Name: enableGunLights
Command.Descr: Sets AI group option how to use gun lights.

Command.Name: enableGunLights
Command.Descr: Sets AI group option how to use gun lights.

Command.Name: enableIRLasers
Command.Descr: Allows the AI to use IR lasers

Command.Name: enableIRLasers
Command.Descr: Allows the AI to use IR lasers

Command.Name: enableInfoPanelComponent
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwi
Command.Descr: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

Command.Name: enableInfoPanelComponent
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwi
Command.Descr: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

Command.Name: enableMimics
Command.Descr: Enables/disables mimics on a given unit.

Command.Name: enablePersonTurret
Command.Descr: Enables or disables firing from a vehicle cargo position. To get the turret path use assignedVehicleRole or getCargoIndex command.

Command.Name: enableRadio
Command.Descr: Enable and disable radio messages to be heard and shown in the left lower corner of the screen. This command can be helpful during cutscenes.

Command.Name: enableReload
Command.Descr: Enable / disable reload when magazine is empty.

Command.Name: enableRopeAttach
Command.Descr: Enable/disable ability to attach or be attached to ropes for given vehicle

Command.Name: enableSatNormalOnDetail
Command.Descr: Enables/Disables satellite normal map od detail maps.

Command.Name: enableSaving
Command.Descr: Enable / disable saving of the game.When disabled, the autosave is created (if not forbidden by save == false).

Command.Name: enableSaving
Command.Descr: Enable / disable saving of the game.When disabled, the autosave is created (if not forbidden by save == false).

Command.Name: enableSentences
Command.Descr: Enables radio transmissions to be heard and seen on screen. It does not affect KBTell conversations.

Command.Name: enableSimulation
Command.Descr: Enable / disable simulation for given entity.

Command.Name: enableSimulationGlobal
Command.Descr: MP command. Enable or disable simulation for given entity, globally. Call this only from the server.

Command.Name: enableStamina
Command.Descr: Enable/disable stamina system

Command.Name: enableStressDamage
Command.Descr: Toggles stress damage. The same as toggling it in the game settings.

Command.Name: enableTeamSwitch
Command.Descr: Enable / disable Team Switch. The default setting is enabled.

Command.Name: enableUAVConnectability
Command.Descr: Enables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

Command.Name: enableUAVWaypoints
Command.Descr: Enables/disables the option for player to set waypoints for UAV in AV terminal.

Command.Name: enableVehicleCargo
Command.Descr: Enable/disable option to transport other vehicles (if configured) or be transported.

Command.Name: enableVehicleSensor
Command.Descr: Enable/disable given sensor

Command.Name: enableWeaponDisassembly
Command.Descr: Enables or disables disassembly of static weapons. Could be applied to local player, to another unit or to static weapon directly.

Command.Name: enableWeaponDisassembly
Command.Descr: Enables or disables disassembly of static weapons. Could be applied to local player, to another unit or to static weapon directly.

Command.Name: endLoadingScreen
Command.Descr: Finishes loading screen started by startLoadingScreen.

Command.Name: endMission
Command.Descr: Finish the mission.The end type can be: "CONTINUE" "KILLED" "LOSER" "END1" "END2" "END3" "END4" "END5" "END6"Mission saves are deleted.

Command.Name: endl
Command.Descr: Creates a string containing a line break, similar to lineBreak for text. The name is inspired by c++ std::endl (line end).

Command.Name: engineOn
Command.Descr: Activates and deactivates the engine of a vehicle. This command has to be executed where vehicle is local.

Command.Name: enginesIsOnRTD
Command.Descr: Returns which engines are producing some work.

Command.Name: enginesPowerRTD
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Watts produced by the engines, to format [engine1, engine2].
Command.Descr: Returns power produced by engines in Watts.

Command.Name: enginesRpmRTD
Command.Descr: Returns all engines RPM

Command.Name: enginesTorqueRTD
Command.Descr: Torque produced by engines in Nm (Newton*meter)

Command.Name: entities
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all alive and dead entities of the given type or deriving from the given type. Units in vehicles are ignored.

Command.Name: entities
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all alive and dead entities of the given type or deriving from the given type. Units in vehicles are ignored.

Command.Name: environmentEnabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [ambientLife, ambientSound] where:ambientLife: BooleanambientS
Command.Descr: Returns status of enableEnvironment command

Command.Name: estimatedEndServerTime
Command.Descr: Estimated end of MP game in seconds converted to serverTime.

Command.Name: estimatedTimeLeft
Command.Descr: Sets the estimated time left in the game.

Command.Name: evalObjectArgument
Command.Descr: Return argument in mission editor of a given object.

Command.Name: everyBackpack
Command.Descr: Returns array of backpacks stored in given crate or vehicle. Used for accessing backpack content of a backpack on ground.

Command.Name: everyContainer
Command.Descr: Returns array of all containers (uniforms, vests, backpacks) stored in given crate or vehicle.

Command.Name: exec
Command.Descr: Execute a script using (the deprecated but still available) .sqs syntax.

Command.Name: execEditorScript
Command.Descr: Execute an editor script for the specified object.

Command.Name: execFSM
Command.Descr: Executes scripted FSM and returns the FSM handle or 0 when failed.

Command.Name: execFSM
Command.Descr: Executes scripted FSM and returns the FSM handle or 0 when failed.

Command.Name: execVM
Command.ReturnDescr: Script - script handle, can be used to determine (via scriptDone (also via isNul
Command.Descr: Compiles and adds SQF Script to the scheduler queue and returns script handle.

Command.Name: execVM
Command.ReturnDescr: Script - script handle, can be used to determine (via scriptDone (also via isNul
Command.Descr: Compiles and adds SQF Script to the scheduler queue and returns script handle.

Command.Name: exit
Command.Descr: Stops the execution of a SQS script.It's ignored in SQF Scripts.

Command.Name: exp
Command.Descr: Let x be a number, then exp (x) is equal to e to the power of x (or e^x)

Command.Name: expectedDestination
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in form:0: Position1: planningMode2: forceReplan
Command.Descr: Return expected destination of unit as an array with format: [ Position, planningMode, forceReplan].

Command.Name: exportJIPMessages
Command.Descr: Export list of JIP to a file.

Command.Name: eyeDirection
Command.Descr: Returns the direction object is watching (eyes, or a vehicle primary observer).

Command.Name: eyePos
Command.Descr: Returns the object's eyes / main turret position.

Command.Name: face
Command.Descr: Returns the face of a person.

Command.Name: faction
Command.Descr: Gets unit faction. Factions are defined under CfgFactionClasses. If the given faction is not defined, the command returns empty string.

Command.Name: fadeMusic
Command.Descr: Changes the music volume smoothly within the given time.

Command.Name: fadeRadio
Command.Descr: Causes a smooth change in the radio volume. The change duration is given by time, the target volume by volume. The default radio volume is 1.0.

Command.Name: fadeSound
Command.Descr: Changes the sound volume smoothly within the given time.

Command.Name: fadeSpeech
Command.Descr: Cause a smooth change in the master speech volume. The change duration is given by time, the target volume by volume. The default master is 1.0.

Command.Name: failMission
Command.Descr: Finish the mission. If the server is set to run persistent mission, failMission will not end the mission when last player gets kicked to the lobby.

Command.Name: fillWeaponsFromPool
Command.Descr: Adds magazines from the campaign pool to the given unit, depending on his weapons.

Command.Name: find
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - 0 based position of the first array element that matches x, -1 if not f
Command.Descr: Searches for an array element within array or a string within a string. Returns the 0 based index on success or -1 if not found.

Command.Name: find
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - 0 based position of the first sequence of characters that matches subst
Command.Descr: Searches for an array element within array or a string within a string. Returns the 0 based index on success or -1 if not found.

Command.Name: findCover
Command.Descr: Returns the object around where the unit finds cover. The minDist, visibilityPosition and ignoreObject parameters are optional.
Command.Syntax: object findCover [position, hidePosition, maxDist, minDist, visibilityPosition, ignoreObject]

Command.Name: findDisplay
Command.Descr: Find display by its IDD (which is defined in the description.ext or config).

Command.Name: findEditorObject
Command.Descr: Return object that matches the provided reference.

Command.Name: findEmptyPosition
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - A suitable empty position in format Position3D or [] if not found
Command.Descr: Searches for an empty position around specified position.

Command.Name: findEmptyPositionReady
Command.Descr: Check if findEmptyPosition can be called without waiting for files.

Command.Name: findIf
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - Zero-based position of the first array element for which the code evalu
Command.Descr: Searches for an element within array for which the code evaluates to true. Returns the 0 based index on success or -1 if not found.

Command.Name: findNearestEnemy
Command.Descr: Finds the nearest enemy to the specified position. Returns a null object if the object's group does not know about any enemies.

Command.Name: findNearestEnemy
Command.Descr: Finds the nearest enemy to the specified position. Returns a null object if the object's group does not know about any enemies.

Command.Name: finishMissionInit
Command.Descr: Finish world initialization before mission is launched.

Command.Name: finite
Command.Descr: True, if number is finite (not infinite and a valid number)

Command.Name: fire
Command.Descr: Forces a unit to fire the given weapon.

Command.Name: fire
Command.Descr: Forces a unit to fire the given weapon.

Command.Name: fireAtTarget
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if fired, false if not
Command.Descr: Remotely forces a unit to fire the given weapon.

Command.Name: firstBackpack
Command.Descr: Returns the first stored backpack.

Command.Name: flag
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - Flag pole object the flag belongs to.
Command.Descr: Returns the original flag pole of the flag the unit is carrying.

Command.Name: flagAnimationPhase
Command.Descr: Returns flag position on the flag pole in range of 0..1, where 0 is bottom of the flag pole, 1 is the top of the flag pole.

Command.Name: flagOwner
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - The person or vehicle that owns the flag is returned.
Command.Descr: Returns the global owner of a flag. A getter for setFlagOwner.

Command.Name: flagSide
Command.Descr: Returns Side of the local instance of the flag. A getter for setFlagSide.

Command.Name: flagTexture
Command.Descr: Returns texture of the local instance of the flag. A getter for setFlagTexture.

Command.Name: fleeing
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - Returns true if a unit is fleeing, false if not.
Command.Descr: Checks if a unit is fleeing.

Command.Name: floor
Command.Descr: Returns the next lowest integer in relation to x.

Command.Name: flyInHeight
Command.Descr: Sets the flying altitude for aircraft relatively to the ground surface.

Command.Name: flyInHeightASL
Command.Descr: Sets the minimal ASL height. Final height is max(flyInHeight, flyInHeightASL).

Command.Name: fog
Command.Descr: Return the current value of the fog in range 0...1.

Command.Name: fogForecast
Command.Descr: Returns the forecast fog value. A value of 0 means no fog, 1 means maximum fog.

Command.Name: fogParams
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format setFog: [fogValue, fogDecay, fogBase]
Command.Descr: Returns extended params for the fog

Command.Name: forEachMember
Command.Descr: Executes the given command recursively for both teams and agents that are members of the given team. For teams only use forEachMemberTeam.

Command.Name: forEachMemberAgent
Command.Descr: Executes the given command recursively for each agent that is a member of the given team. For just teams use forEachMemberTeam.

Command.Name: forEachMemberTeam
Command.Descr: Executes the given command recursively for each team that is a member of the given team. For just agents use forEachMemberAgent.

Command.Name: forceAddUniform
Command.Descr: Create a new uniform and hard link it into slot (without any restrictions).

Command.Name: forceAtPositionRTD
Command.Descr: Adds force generator to world.For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled.

Command.Name: forceEnd
Command.Descr: Enforces mission termination. Can be used in an "END" trigger to force end conditions in the editor.

Command.Name: forceFlagTexture
Command.Descr: Forces a flag texture onto a flag carrier (unit, vehicle or flag pole). No flag holder is required. If "" is used as texture, the texture is removed.

Command.Name: forceFollowRoad
Command.Descr: Forces the vehicle to stay on road.

Command.Name: forceGeneratorRTD
Command.Descr: Adds force generator to world.For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled.

Command.Name: forceMap
Command.Descr: Opens non-interactive main map in background that overrides user screen. The user is able to fire but cannot see the world just the map.

Command.Name: forceRespawn
Command.Descr: Forces unit to respawn.

Command.Name: forceSpeed
Command.Descr: Force the speed limit on given object (object will never attempt to move faster than given by forceSpeed).

Command.Name: forceWalk
Command.Descr: Forces unit to walk even if run or sprint is selected.

Command.Name: forceWeaponFire
Command.Descr: The unit will be forced to fire weapon from the given muzzle.

Command.Name: forceWeatherChange
Command.Descr: Forces saved wanted settings for weather to be actual (BEWARE: Will cause lag).

Command.Name: forcedMap
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [forceMapForced, openMapForced] where:forceMapForced: Boolean
Command.Descr: Returns if map was forced by using forceMap command or openMap command with force option

Command.Name: forgetTarget
Command.Descr: Resets info group has about target

Command.Name: forgetTarget
Command.Descr: Resets info group has about target

Command.Name: formLeader
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - the leader of the formation is returned.
Command.Descr: Returns the formation leader of a given unit.

Command.Name: format
Command.ReturnDescr: String - The full string (up to 8kb, see above) is returned.
Command.Descr: Composes a string containing other variables or other variable types.Converts any variable type to a string.

Command.Name: formatText
Command.Descr: Creates a structured text by replacing%1,%2, etc. in format with plain or structured texts given as arguments.

Command.Name: formation
Command.ReturnDescr: String - returns either "COLUMN", "STAG COLUMN", "WEDGE", "ECH LEFT", "ECH RIGH
Command.Descr: Returns the current formation of a group.

Command.Name: formation
Command.ReturnDescr: String - returns either "COLUMN", "STAG COLUMN", "WEDGE", "ECH LEFT", "ECH RIGH
Command.Descr: Returns the current formation of a group.

Command.Name: formationDirection
Command.Descr: Return the direction in degrees of the 'unit' watching in formation.

Command.Name: formationLeader
Command.Descr: Return leader of the formation.

Command.Name: formationMembers
Command.Descr: Return list of units (drivers) in the formation.

Command.Name: formationPosition
Command.Descr: Return position of unit in the formation

Command.Name: formationTask
Command.Descr: Return the current task of the unit in the formation.

Command.Name: freeLook
Command.Descr: Returns true if freelook is active.

Command.Name: fromEditor
Command.Descr: Return if given team was inserted directly from mission editor.

Command.Name: fuel
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - The returned number is in range 0 (empty tank) to 1 (full tank).
Command.Descr: Checks how much fuel is left in the gas tank of a vehicle.

Command.Name: fullCrew
Command.Descr: Returns array with all crew inside given vehicle. Since Arma 3 v1.55.133810 it is possible to return empty seats as well.

Command.Name: fullCrew
Command.Descr: Returns array with all crew inside given vehicle. Since Arma 3 v1.55.133810 it is possible to return empty seats as well.

Command.Name: gearIDCAmmoCount
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

Command.Name: gearSlotAmmoCount
Command.Descr: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

Command.Name: gearSlotData
Command.Descr: Returns gear slot item name.

Command.Name: get3DENActionState
Command.Descr: Returns state of given action in the Eden Editor.See the list of all actions.

Command.Name: get3DENAttribute

Command.Descr: Return all connections currently present on an entity.

Command.Descr: Returns unique index of an Eden Entity. This number remains the same even after saving and loading the scenario.

Command.Descr: Get current aiming coefficient (higher ~ less precise, default is 1)

Command.Name: getAllEnvSoundControllers

Command.Descr: Returns aim precision for current animation

Command.Name: getAnimSpeedCoef
Command.Descr: Get coefficient for animation speed.

Command.Descr: Extract array from config entry.

Command.Name: getArtilleryAmmo
Command.Descr: Get list of all available magazines of artillery units on the list.

Command.Name: getArtilleryComputerSettings
Command.Descr: Returns settings from artillery computer currently opened by player.

Command.Name: getArtilleryETA
Command.Descr: Returns ETA to the target in seconds for given artillery unit based on target position and used magazine, -1 if target can't be hit.

Command.Name: getAssignedCuratorLogic
Command.Descr: Returns curator logic to which given player has access.

Command.Name: getAudioOptionVolumes

Command.Name: getBackpackCargo

Command.Name: getCargoIndex
Command.Descr: Returns index of the unit in cargo. 0,1,2... or -1 if not in cargo.

Command.Name: getCenterOfMass
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre
Command.Descr: Returns center of mass of a PhysX object.

Command.Name: getClientState
Command.Descr: Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server.

Command.Descr: Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server.

Command.ReturnDescr: Number - load value, -1 if not available.

Command.Name: getCursorObjectParams
Command.Descr: Returns the object under cursor, named selection pointed at as well as distance to the object.

Command.Name: getCustomAimCoef
Command.Descr: Returns aimPrecision from animation state with custom value that will directly affects weapon sway size and speed.

Command.Name: getCustomSoundController
Command.Descr: Returns current value set to the controller (see setCustomSoundController)

Command.Name: getCustomSoundControllerCount
Command.Descr: Returns current number of custom sound controllers supported by the engine for the given vehicle (currently 32)

Command.Name: getDLCAssetsUsage

Command.Descr: Returns an array of the DLC usage times.

Command.Name: getDLCAssetsUsageByName
Command.Descr: Returns an array with the session and global time the asset has been used.

Command.Name: getDLCUsageTime
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - DLC assets usage time in seconds
Command.Descr: Returns total time the assets of the given DLC have been used. See Arma 3 DLCs Overview for a list of DLCs and ids.

Command.Name: getDLCs
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array of DLC numbers (see above)
Command.Descr: Returns array of appIDs of DLCs.

Command.Name: getDammage
Command.Descr: Returns the object damage in the range from 0 to 1. Alias of damage.

Command.Name: getDescription
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Strings to format [unitClass, uniformName, vestName, backpackClass]
Command.Descr: Returns the string representation of unit as an four slots array.

Command.Name: getDir
Command.Descr: Returns the object heading in the range from 0 to 360. Since Arma 3 v1.55.

Command.Name: getDiverState

Command.Name: getEnvSoundController

Command.Name: getFSMVariable
Command.Descr: Return the value of variable in the variable space of given FSM. The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

Command.Name: getPlayerScores
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - the score of the given player in format [infantry kills, soft vehicle ki
Command.Descr: In MP: returns the unit's table of scores (infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score).

Command.Name: getPlayerUID
Command.ReturnDescr: String "_SP_AI_" or "_SP_PLAYER_" in SP, "" or UID in MP.
Command.Descr: Return an uniqueID of the given unit as string if it's player and empty value if it's AI.

Command.Name: getPlayerVoNVolume
Command.ReturnDescr: Number in range 0..1, -1 in case of error (e.
Command.Descr: Gets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

Command.Name: getPos
Command.Descr: Returns the object position in format PositionAGLS. Z value is height over the surface underneath. Since Arma 3 v1.55.

Command.Name: getPos
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [x,y,z], where z is -1 * getTerrainHeightASL at the location
Command.Descr: Returns the object position in format PositionAGLS. Z value is height over the surface underneath. Since Arma 3 v1.55.

Command.Name: getPos
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [x,y,z], where z is land surface in format PositionAGL
Command.Descr: Returns the object position in format PositionAGLS. Z value is height over the surface underneath. Since Arma 3 v1.55.

Command.Name: getPos
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [x,y,z], where z is land surface in format PositionAGL
Command.Descr: Returns the object position in format PositionAGLS. Z value is height over the surface underneath. Since Arma 3 v1.55.

Command.Name: getPosASL
Command.Descr: Returns the object position height above sea level.

Command.Name: getPosASLVisual
Command.Descr: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ASL (z value above sea level) in render time scope. Alias of visiblePositionASL.

Command.Name: getPosASLW
Command.Descr: Returns the object position height above sea surface (waves included).

Command.Name: getPosATL
Command.Descr: Returns the position of an object relative to the terrain.

Command.Name: getPosATLVisual
Command.Descr: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ATL (z value above ground) in render time scope.

Command.Name: getPosVisual
Command.Descr: Returns an object's rendered 3D position (z value above sea when over sea, or above ground when over land) in render time scope.

Command.Name: getPosWorld
Command.Descr: Returns PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0] of an object, rather than transformed boundingCenter or LandContact vertices.

Command.Name: getPosWorldVisual
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format PositionWorld in render scope
Command.Descr: Returns render version of PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0] of an object in render scope, rather than transformed boundi

Command.Name: getPylonMagazines
Command.Descr: Return array of magazines on pylons

Command.Name: getRelDir
Command.Descr: Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the eq

Command.Name: getRelDir
Command.Descr: Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the eq

Command.Name: getRelPos
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [x,y,z], where z is land surface in format PositionAGL
Command.Descr: Returns position, which is given distance and relative direction away from original object.

Command.Name: getRemoteSensorsDisabled
Command.Descr: Get status of disabled raycasts for remote entities. See disableRemoteSensors for detailed description.

Command.Name: getRepairCargo
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - repair cargo value, -1 if repair cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehic
Command.Descr: Returns the amount of repair resources from empty (0) to full (1) in the cargo space of a repair vehicle.

Command.Name: getResolution
Command.Descr: Returns an array containing all information about resolution.

Command.Name: getRoadInfo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [mapType, width, isPedestrian, texture, textureEnd, material, be
Command.Descr: Returns road info in format [maptype, width, ispedestrian, texture, texture end, material]

Command.Name: getRotorBrakeRTD
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - True if on, otherwise false
Command.Descr: Returns if rotor break is on.For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled.

Command.Name: getShadowDistance
Command.Descr: Gets the shadows rendering distance.

Command.Name: getShotParents
Command.Descr: Returns shot information Array for the given projectile in format [vehicle, instigator], where vehicle is the vehicle the shot was fired from, and the

Command.Name: getSlingLoad
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - the sling loaded vehicle. objNull if nothing is sling loaded.
Command.Descr: Return object which is sling loaded by vehicle

Command.Name: getSoundController
Command.Descr: Returns value of the given sound controller.

Command.Name: getSoundControllerResult
Command.Descr: Returns the calculated value of simple expression in config.

Command.Name: getSpeed
Command.Descr: Get the speed for the given speed mode.

Command.Name: getStamina
Command.Descr: Get current stamina (~ seconds until depletion)

Command.Name: getStatValue
Command.Descr: Returns value of the given stat.

Command.Name: getStatValue
Command.Descr: Returns value of the given stat.

Command.Name: getSteamFriendsServers
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Array of Strings - to format [ipAndPort, steamFriendName]
Command.Descr: Returns servers information of Steam friends currently playing the game.

Command.Name: getSubtitleOptions
Command.Descr: Returns subtitles settings in format [subtitles, radio subtitles].

Command.Name: getSuppression
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - from 0 to 1, or -1 if suppression is not available.
Command.Descr: Gets the suppression value of given unit. Returns SCALAR between 0 and 1. Suppression is not calculated for player entities.

Command.Name: getTerrainGrid
Command.Descr: Returns the current terrain grid

Command.Name: getTerrainHeightASL
Command.Descr: Returns the terrain height above the sea for the given position.

Command.Name: getText
Command.Descr: Extract text from config entry.

Command.Name: getTextWidth
Command.Descr: Returns estimated width of the text based on font type and size.

Command.Name: getTotalDLCUsageTime
Command.Descr: Returns total DLC usage time in this game session

Command.Name: getTrimOffsetRTD
Command.Descr: Returns controls trim offset.

Command.Name: getUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Returns an array with all assigned items, weapons, containers and their stored items.

Command.Name: getUnitLoadout

Command.Name: getUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Returns an array with all assigned items, weapons, containers and their stored items.

Command.Descr: Returns an array with all assigned items, weapons, containers and their stored items.
