Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean or Number - trait's valueNothing - if unit is invalid, e.
Command.Descr: Gets the current value of a trait of the given unit.

Command.Descr: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

Command.Descr: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

Command.Descr: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

Command.Name: getVehicleCargo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - vehicles loaded in storingVehicle, in order of their loading
Command.Descr: Gets a list of vehicles loaded as cargo inside this vehicle. The returned array is in the order the cargo vehicles were added to containing vehicle.

Command.Name: getVehicleTIPars
Command.Descr: returns array [alive factor, movementfactor, metabolism factor] see setVehicleTIPars

Command.Name: getWPPos
Command.Descr: Returns the position of a selected waypoint of a given group. Waypoints include only those which were placed in the mission editor.

Command.Name: getWeaponCargo
Command.Descr: Returns all weapons types and count from the cargo space

Command.Name: getWeaponSway
Command.Descr: Returns current size of weapon sway of a given unit, in radians

Command.Name: getWingsOrientationRTD
Command.Descr: Returns orientation of horizontal stabilizers.

Command.Name: getWingsPositionRTD
Command.Descr: Returns position of stabilizers.

Command.Name: glanceAt
Command.Descr: Control what the unit is glancing at (target or Position).How frequently the unit is glancing there depends on behaviour.

Command.Name: glanceAt
Command.Descr: Control what the unit is glancing at (target or Position).How frequently the unit is glancing there depends on behaviour.

Command.Name: glanceAt
Command.Descr: Control what the unit is glancing at (target or Position).How frequently the unit is glancing there depends on behaviour.

Command.Name: glanceAt
Command.Descr: Control what the unit is glancing at (target or Position).How frequently the unit is glancing there depends on behaviour.

Command.Name: globalChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the global radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed.

Command.Name: globalRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the audio message to the global radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol.

Command.Name: goggles
Command.Descr: Returns name of currently used goggles (for NVGoggles use hmd).

Command.Name: group
Command.ReturnDescr: Group - For dead units, the returned group equals grpNull.
Command.Descr: Returns the group a unit is assigned to.

Command.Name: groupChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the group radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages.

Command.Name: groupFromNetId
Command.Descr: Get group with given unique ID. For objects use objectFromNetId.

Command.Name: groupIconSelectable
Command.Descr: Return if groups icon raises onClick and onOver events.

Command.Name: groupIconsVisible
Command.Descr: Return group icons are visible.

Command.Name: groupId
Command.Descr: Returns group name.

Command.Name: groupOwner
Command.Descr: Returns ID of client to which the group is local. Can be run only from server.

Command.Name: groupRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the audio message to the group radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to send or receive the transmission.

Command.Name: groupSelectUnit
Command.Descr: Selects a unit from player's group. If player is the leader, the effect of this command is similar to player pressing F1, F2, F3...

Command.Name: groupSelectedUnits
Command.Descr: Returns selected units in source group for normal commanding mode (individual units). For the High Command equivalent, see hcSelected.

Command.Name: gunner
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - The person sitting in the gunner place is returned.
Command.Descr: Returns the gunner of a vehicle.

Command.Name: gusts
Command.Descr: Return the current gusts value. Scale is 0 to 1.

Command.Name: halt
Command.Descr: Stops the program into a debugger. In retail version using halt results in error.

Command.Name: handgunItems
Command.Descr: Returns array with all items assigned to the handgun. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

Command.Name: handgunMagazine
Command.Descr: Returns either single element array, containing class name of currently loaded in the handgun magazine, or an empty array if unit has no handgun or ha

Command.Name: handgunWeapon
Command.Descr: Returns the name of a unit's handgun (an empty string if there is none).

Command.Name: handsHit
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - If the hands aren't damaged, the returned value is 0.
Command.Descr: Checks if a soldier's hands are hit, which results in inaccurate aiming.

Command.Name: hasInterface
Command.Descr: Returns true if the computer has an interface (a real player). False for a dedicated server or for a headless client.

Command.Name: hasPilotCamera
Command.Descr: Returns true if the object airplane or helicopter has a pilotCamera.

Command.Name: hasWeapon
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - Returns true if the unit has the weapon, false if not.
Command.Descr: Checks if a unit has the given weapon.

Command.Name: hcAllGroups
Command.Descr: Returns selected groups in high command.

Command.Name: hcGroupParams
Command.Descr: Returns parameters describing group in high command bar.

Command.Name: hcLeader
Command.Descr: Returns group's high command commander.

Command.Name: hcRemoveAllGroups
Command.Descr: Remove all groups from unit's high command bar.

Command.Name: hcRemoveGroup
Command.Descr: Removes group from unit's high command bar.

Command.Name: hcSelectGroup
Command.Descr: Select given group in high command bar.

Command.Name: hcSelected
Command.Descr: Returns selected groups in high command.

Command.Name: hcSetGroup
Command.Descr: Add group to unit's high command bar.Array parameters are group, group-name and team (teammain, teamred, teamgreen, teamblue, teamyellow).

Command.Name: hcShowBar
Command.Descr: Shows or hides high command bar.There must be some groups under HC command to show HC bar.

Command.Name: hcShownBar
Command.Descr: Return true if the high command bar is shown/active.

Command.Name: headgear
Command.Descr: Returns headgear of unit.

Command.Name: hideBody
Command.Descr: Hides dead body of the given unit. After a short delay, the body slowly sinks into the ground.

Command.Name: hideObject
Command.Descr: Hide entity. Can be used on soldiers and vehicles, also on static objects.

Command.Name: hideObject
Command.Descr: Hide entity. Can be used on soldiers and vehicles, also on static objects.

Command.Name: hideObjectGlobal
Command.Descr: MP command. Hides object on all connected clients as well as JIP. Call on the server only. Can be used on all objects with class names, i.e.

Command.Name: hideObjectGlobal
Command.Descr: MP command. Hides object on all connected clients as well as JIP. Call on the server only. Can be used on all objects with class names, i.e.

Command.Name: hideSelection
Command.Descr: Hides or enables the given selection for the object

Command.Name: hint
Command.Descr: Outputs a multi-line hint message in the left upper corner of the screen (in the right upper corner in Arma).

Command.Name: hintC
Command.Descr: Displays attractive hint in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until user presses "Continue".

Command.Name: hintC
Command.Descr: Displays attractive hint in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until user presses "Continue".

Command.Name: hintC
Command.Descr: Displays attractive hint in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until user presses "Continue".

Command.Name: hintCadet
Command.Descr: Shows a text hint only when in cadetMode.The text can contain several lines. \n is used to indicate the end of a line.

Command.Name: hintSilent
Command.Descr: Same as hint, but without a sound.

Command.Name: hmd
Command.Descr: Returns class name of currently used Head Mounted Display. Returns an empty string if the slot is empty.

Command.Name: hostMission
Command.Descr: Host the mp mission described by config class. Should be called as reaction to some UI action in some dialog.

Command.Name: htmlLoad
Command.Descr: Load HTML from file to given control. File path is relative to current mission dir or an absolute path (with drive letter etc.).

Command.Name: humidity
Command.Descr: Returns the current humidity value. 0 is no humidity and 1 is 100% humidity.

Command.Name: image
Command.Descr: Creates a structured text containing the given image.

Command.Name: importAllGroups
Command.Descr: Imports all groups into the RTE.

Command.Name: importance
Command.Descr: Returns a location's importance value.

Command.Name: in
Command.Descr: Checks whether value is in array, unit in vehicle or position inside location.

Command.Name: in
Command.Descr: Checks whether value is in array, unit in vehicle or position inside location.

Command.Name: in
Command.Descr: Checks whether value is in array, unit in vehicle or position inside location.

Command.Name: in
Command.Descr: Checks whether value is in array, unit in vehicle or position inside location.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.
Command.Syntax: position inArea [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

Command.Name: inArea
Command.Descr: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format.
Command.Syntax: position inArea [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

Command.Name: inAreaArray
Command.ReturnDescr: Array: Objects and/or Positions inside the trigger area
Command.Descr: Filters given list of Objects and/or Positions in relation to the given area, defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.

Command.Name: inAreaArray
Command.ReturnDescr: Array: Objects and/or Positions inside the marker area
Command.Descr: Filters given list of Objects and/or Positions in relation to the given area, defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.

Command.Name: inAreaArray
Command.ReturnDescr: Array: Objects and/or Positions inside the location area
Command.Descr: Filters given list of Objects and/or Positions in relation to the given area, defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.

Command.Name: inAreaArray
Command.ReturnDescr: Array: Objects and/or Positions inside the area
Command.Descr: Filters given list of Objects and/or Positions in relation to the given area, defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.
Command.Syntax: positions inAreaArray [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

Command.Name: inGameUISetEventHandler
Command.Descr: Sets given event handler of in-game UI. If EH function returns true, performed action is overridden.

Command.Name: inPolygon
Command.Descr: Checks whether position is inside given polygon

Command.Name: inRangeOfArtillery
Command.Descr: Returns true if all given units are able to fire at given position with given magazineType.

Command.Name: incapacitatedState
Command.Descr: Returns the incapacitated state of the given unit.

Command.Name: inflame
Command.Descr: Control fireplace burning. Set inflame to true (on) or false (off).

Command.Name: inflamed
Command.Descr: Checks if fireplace is inflamed (burning) or not. To check if a unit is receiving damage from fire, use isBurning command.

Command.Name: infoPanel
Command.Descr: Returns information about what is currently displayed on given player's info panel.

Command.Name: infoPanelComponentEnabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwi
Command.Descr: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

Command.Name: infoPanelComponentEnabled
Command.Descr: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

Command.Name: infoPanelComponents
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [className, componentType, isAccessible]:className: String - com
Command.Descr: Returns array of all components available to given object info panel.

Command.Name: infoPanelComponents
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - format [className, componentType, isAccessible]:className: String - com
Command.Descr: Returns array of all components available to given object info panel.

Command.Name: infoPanels
Command.Descr: Returns array all info panels configured for given object or object and turret path.

Command.Name: infoPanels
Command.Descr: Returns array all info panels configured for given object or object and turret path.

Command.Name: inheritsFrom
Command.Descr: Returns base entry of config entry.

Command.Name: initAmbientLife
Command.Descr: Initialize the ambient life.

Command.Name: inputAction
Command.Descr: Return the state of input devices mapped to given input action.For Arma 3 inputActions see: inputAction/actions.

Command.Name: insertEditorObject
Command.Descr: Insert an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,not called. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject. Subtype class is,optional.

Command.Name: intersect
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array of intersections in format: [[selection, distance],...
Command.Descr: Finds named selections in object which are in specified LOD, intersected by given section of a line.

Command.Name: is3DEN
Command.Descr: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently being used.

Command.Name: is3DENMultiplayer
Command.Descr: Returns true if the Eden Editor is in multiplayer mode.

Command.Name: is3DENPreview
Command.Descr: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently in mission preview mode, single player or multiplayer.

Command.Name: isAbleToBreathe
Command.Descr: If unit is diving and doesn't have a re-breather, it returns false. Diving means the unit's head is underwater.

Command.Name: isActionMenuVisible
Command.Descr: Returns true if scroll menu is visible.

Command.Name: isAgent
Command.Descr: Check if team member is an agent.

Command.Name: isAimPrecisionEnabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - True if affected, false if not
Command.Descr: Returns true if procedural aiming precision affects weapon sway.

Command.Name: isArray
Command.Descr: Check if config entry represents array.

Command.Name: isAutoHoverOn
Command.Descr: Return true if vehicle has enabled auto hover.

Command.Name: isAutonomous
Command.Descr: Returns true if UAV is in autonomous mode.

Command.Name: isAutotest
Command.Descr: Returns true if game was started with autotest parameter

Command.Name: isBleeding
Command.Descr: Returns whether the unit is bleeding.

Command.Name: isBurning
Command.Descr: Returns whether the unit is burning.

Command.Name: isClass
Command.Descr: Check if config entry represents config class.

Command.Name: isCollisionLightOn
Command.Descr: Returns true if vehicle collision lights are on otherwise false.

Command.Name: isCopilotEnabled
Command.Descr: Returns true if copilots actions are enabled.

Command.Name: isDLCAvailable
Command.Descr: Returns true if the DLC is marked as available.

Command.Name: isDamageAllowed
Command.Descr: A getter for allowDamage command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current locality, hence local effect of the command.

Command.Name: isDedicated
Command.Descr: Return true if the machine (executing the command) is a dedicated multiplayer server. In single player returns false.

Command.Name: isEngineOn
Command.Descr: Returns true if engine is on, false if it is off.

Command.Name: isEqualTo
Command.Descr: Performs strict comparison between var1 and var2 and returns true if equal, otherwise false.

Command.Name: isEqualType
Command.Descr: Compares 2 values by their type. A much faster alternative to typeName a == typeName b.

Command.Name: isEqualTypeAll
Command.Descr: Compares types of all elements of an array to the type of a single value.

Command.Name: isEqualTypeAny
Command.Descr: Compares type of given value to every type in the given array and if match is found, true is returned.

Command.Name: isEqualTypeArray
Command.Descr: Compares types of all elements of one array to types of all elements of another array.

Command.Name: isEqualTypeParams
Command.Descr: Compares types of all elements of input array to types of all elements of template array.

Command.Name: isFilePatchingEnabled
Command.Descr: Returns true if file patching is enabled otherwise false

Command.Name: isFinal
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - True if final, false if not
Command.Descr: Checks if code or a variable was compiled final with compileFinal.

Command.Name: isFlashlightOn
Command.Descr: Returns true if there is a linked and enabled flashlight on a given weapon.

Command.Name: isFlatEmpty
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Empty array [] if check failed or PositionASL if succeded.
Command.Descr: Checks given position against given filter params.
Command.Syntax: position isFlatEmpty [minDistance, mode, maxGradient, maxGradientRadius, overLandOrWater, shoreLine, ignoreObject]

Command.Name: isForcedWalk
Command.Descr: Returns true if player is forced to walk with forceWalk.

Command.Name: isFormationLeader
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if unit is subgroup leader.
Command.Descr: Returns true if the specified unit is subgroup leader.

Command.Name: isGameFocused
Command.Descr: Returns false if the game window lost focus, due to user Alt+Tab-ing for example.

Command.Name: isGamePaused

Command.Name: nearestObject

Command.Name: nearestObject
Command.Descr: Returns the nearest object of given type to given position within a sphere. Hardcoded radius is 50 meters.

Command.Name: nearestTerrainObjects

Command.Name: needReload

Command.Name: netId
Command.Descr: Unique ID of object or group. As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_netId, which extends the use to SP as well.

Command.Name: netId

Command.Name: nextWeatherChange

Command.Name: nil

Command.Name: numberToDate

Command.Name: objectParent

Command.Descr: Return the rank of the given unit for comparison.

Command.Descr: Switches on remote control of the unit. Command needs to be executed locally to the player. If driver is remote it will get transferred to players PC.

Command.Name: remoteExec
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - Nil in case of error. String otherwise.
Command.Descr: Asks server to execute given scripted function or script command.

Command.Name: remoteExec
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - Nil in case of error. String otherwise.

Command.Descr: Returns clientOwner of the PC, which initiated Remote Execution call. If used in SP or outside of remote executed context, the command returns 0.

Command.Name: remove3DENConnection
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the connection was removed

Command.Name: remove3DENEventHandler

Command.Name: remove3DENLayer

Command.Descr: Remove Eden Editor editing layer.

Command.Name: removeAction
Command.Descr: Removes user added action with given id index. This only removes actions added with the addAction command.

Command.Name: removeAll3DENEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Removes all Eden Editor event handlers of given type. See the list of all Eden Editor Event Handlers.

Command.Name: removeAllActions
Command.Descr: Removes all unit's user added actions.

Command.Name: removeAllAssignedItems
Command.Descr: Unassigns and deletes all linked items from inventory. The commands operates on assignedItems array, which doesnt include goggles or headgear.

Command.Name: removeAllContainers
Command.Descr: Removes all containers from the unit.

Command.Name: removeAllCuratorAddons
Command.Descr: Restrict access to all addons for given curator.

Command.Name: removeAllCuratorCameraAreas

Command.Name: removeAllCuratorEditingAreas

Command.Name: removeAllEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Removes all event handlers of given type that were added by addEventHandler. Since VBS2 v1.24 can be applied on individual weapon rounds.

Command.Name: removeAllHandgunItems
Command.Descr: Removes all items from weapon except magazine.

Command.Name: removeAllItems
Command.Descr: Removes all special items from the unit.

Command.Name: removeAllItemsWithMagazines
Command.Descr: Removes all itemsWithMagazines from the uniform, vest and backpack.

Command.Name: removeAllMPEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Removes all MP event handlers of the given type which were added by addMPEventHandler.

Command.Name: removeAllMissionEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Removes all mission event handlers of the given type which were added by addMissionEventHandler.

Command.Name: removeAllMusicEventHandlers
Command.Descr: Removes all music track event handlers of given type.

Command.Name: removeAllOwnedMines
Command.Descr: Removes ownership of all owned mines/explosive devices of the given unit

Command.Name: removeAllPrimaryWeaponItems
Command.Descr: Removes all items from weapon except magazine.

Command.Name: removeAllWeapons
Command.Descr: Remove all weapons and magazines of the unit. On vehicles only ammo is removed Does not remove map, compass, radio.

Command.Name: removeBackpack
Command.Descr: Removes unit's backpack

Command.Name: removeBackpackGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes backpack from a unit.

Command.Name: removeBinocularItem
Command.Descr: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the binocular weapon.

Command.Name: removeCuratorAddons

Command.Name: removeCuratorCameraArea
Command.Descr: Removes curator camera area.

Command.Name: removeCuratorEditableObjects

Command.Name: removeCuratorEditingArea
Command.Descr: Removes editing area for given curator.

Command.Name: removeDiaryRecord
Command.Descr: Remove a log record.

Command.Name: removeDiarySubject
Command.Descr: Remove a subject from a log This article is a work in progress!

Command.Name: removeDrawIcon
Command.Descr: Removes an icon for an editor object.

Command.Name: removeDrawLinks
Command.Descr: Remove all drawn links for the given editor object for the given editor,object type.

Command.Name: removeEventHandler
Command.Descr: Removes event handler added by addEventHandler. When any handler is removed, all handler indices higher than the deleted one should be decremented.

Command.Name: removeFromRemainsCollector
Command.Descr: Removes vehicles/units from disposal manager, added earlier with addToRemainsCollector

Command.Name: removeGoggles
Command.Descr: Removes goggles from unit (diver goggles for example). This command does not remove NVGoggles.

Command.Name: removeGroupIcon
Command.Descr: Remove icon with given ID from group.

Command.Name: removeHandgunItem
Command.Descr: Removes given weapon item from the handgun weapon cargo space.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: removeHeadgear
Command.Descr: Removes headgear from a unit. If unit has no headgear command quietly fails.

Command.Name: removeItem
Command.Descr: Removes item from the inventory.

Command.Name: removeItemFromBackpack
Command.Descr: Removes item from soldier's backpack.

Command.Name: removeItemFromUniform
Command.Descr: Removes item from soldier's uniform. Can be used with magazines and weapons too.

Command.Name: removeItemFromVest
Command.Descr: Removes item from soldier's vest.

Command.Name: removeItems
Command.Descr: Removes all items with given template from the inventory.

Command.Name: removeMPEventHandler
Command.Descr: Removes MP event handler added by addMPEventHandler. Format of handler is [type,index]. Index is returned by addMPEventHandler.

Command.Name: removeMagazine
Command.Descr: Remove magazine from the unit. Note: You may create invalid combinations with this function. When doing so, application behaviour is undefined.

Command.Name: removeMagazineGlobal
Command.Descr: Removes the magazine from the unit.

Command.Name: removeMagazineTurret
Command.Descr: Removes the magazine from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.Note: you may create invalid combinations by using this function.

Command.Name: removeMagazines
Command.Descr: Remove all magazines of given type from the unit.Note: You may create invalid combinations with this function.

Command.Name: removeMagazinesTurret
Command.Descr: Removes all magazines of the given type from given vehicle. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: removeMenuItem
Command.Descr: Removes a previously added menu item.

Command.Name: removeMissionEventHandler
Command.Descr: Removes mission event handler added by addMissionEventHandler.

Command.Name: removeMusicEventHandler
Command.Descr: Removes specified music track event handler.

Command.Name: removeOwnedMine
Command.Descr: Removes ownership over a remotely detonatable mine from the unit.

Command.Name: removePrimaryWeaponItem
Command.Descr: Removes given weapon item from the primary weapon cargo space.As of Arma 3 DEV 1.37, this command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: removeSecondaryWeaponItem
Command.Descr: Removes given weapon item from the secondary weapon cargo space. This command also supports weapon magazines.

Command.Name: removeSimpleTask
Command.Descr: Remove a simple task from the list of simple tasks.

Command.Name: removeSwitchableUnit
Command.Descr: Remove a unit from the list of units available for Team Switch.

Command.Name: removeTeamMember
Command.Descr: Remove given member from given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

Command.Name: removeUniform
Command.Descr: Removes uniform from unit.

Command.Name: removeVest
Command.Descr: Removes vest from unit.

Command.Name: removeWeapon
Command.Descr: Remove weapon from a unit. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed.

Command.Name: removeWeaponAttachmentCargo
Command.Descr: Remove attachment linked to a weapon from the vehicle cargo space. This is unoffical documentation.

Command.Name: removeWeaponCargo
Command.Descr: Remove weapon from the vehicle cargo space. This is unoffical documentation. All Information here is as it exists in the Engine.

Command.Name: removeWeaponGlobal
Command.Descr: Remove a weapon from a unit. An attempt to remove a weapon, which is not in unit's possession, is simply ignored.

Command.Name: removeWeaponTurret
Command.Descr: Removes weapon from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: reportRemoteTarget
Command.Descr: Shares the target vehicle via datalink to the Side center for a given time.

Command.Name: requiredVersion
Command.Descr: Check if version of application is available. If the current version is older than the required one, a warning message is shown and false is returned.

Command.Name: resetCamShake
Command.Descr: Stops any ongoing camera shake effects. Does not prevent new effects from being created.

Command.Name: resetSubgroupDirection
Command.Descr: Resets direction of subgroup.

Command.Name: resize
Command.Descr: Change array size. Can be used to add or remove elements from an array.

Command.Name: resources
Command.Descr: Returns the resources of a team member. Results are local to the PC on which command was executed.

Command.Name: respawnVehicle
Command.Descr: Sets vehicle as respawnable in MP game. The vehicle will be spawned at the locality and coordinates it was prior to destruction.

Command.Name: restartEditorCamera
Command.Descr: Restarts the mission editor camera (if it was deleted by a script,for example).

Command.Name: reveal
Command.Descr: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.

Command.Name: reveal
Command.Descr: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.

Command.Name: reveal
Command.Descr: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.

Command.Name: reveal
Command.Descr: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.

Command.Name: revealMine
Command.Descr: Sets given mine as known to the side. (Knowledge about a mine is always shared across all units in a side.

Command.Name: reverse
Command.Descr: Reverses given array by reference (modifies the original array, just like resize).

Command.Name: reversedMouseY
Command.Descr: Return if mouse vertical axe is inverted.

Command.Name: roadAt
Command.Descr: Returns road segment at given position, objNull otherwise. Same as isOnRoad only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

Command.Name: roadAt
Command.Descr: Returns road segment at given position, objNull otherwise. Same as isOnRoad only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

Command.Name: roadsConnectedTo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Objects - connected road segments
Command.Descr: Find the road segments connected to the given road segment.

Command.Name: roadsConnectedTo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of Objects - connected road segments
Command.Descr: Find the road segments connected to the given road segment.

Command.Name: roleDescription
Command.Descr: Returns unit description set in Editor and visible on role selection screen in MP. Works in MP and SP.

Command.Name: ropeAttachEnabled
Command.Descr: Returns true if vehicle can be attached to ropes

Command.Name: ropeAttachTo
Command.Descr: Attach vehicle to rope with optional offset

Command.Name: ropeAttachedObjects
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array of attached entities on ropes
Command.Descr: Returns list of attached objects on ropes

Command.Name: ropeAttachedTo
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - a transport from which the ropes originate, the ropes owner
Command.Descr: Returns the object it is attached to by rope

Command.Name: ropeCreate
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - created rope or objNull on failure
Command.Descr: Create a rope (PhysX rope in Arma 3).
Command.Syntax: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]

Command.Name: ropeCreate
Command.ReturnDescr: Object - created rope or objNull on failure
Command.Descr: Create a rope (PhysX rope in Arma 3).

Command.Name: ropeCut
Command.Descr: Cut rope and detach rope from vehicle

Command.Name: ropeDestroy
Command.Descr: Destroy a rope.

Command.Name: ropeDetach
Command.Descr: Detach a rope from an object.

Command.Name: ropeEndPosition
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array in format [startPos, endPos], where:startPos: Array - rope start
Command.Descr: Return rope end positions in Position3D format

Command.Name: ropeLength
Command.Descr: Return rope length in meters (set by ropeCreate, ropeCut, ropeUnwind)

Command.Name: ropeUnwind
Command.Descr: Unwind rope to target length.

Command.Name: ropeUnwound
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if unwinding is complete
Command.Descr: False if unwinding in progress, otherwise true

Command.Name: ropes
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array of the actual rope objects
Command.Descr: Returns a vehicle's rope objects in an Array.

Command.Name: rotorsForcesRTD
Command.Descr: Returns force produced by rotors.

Command.Name: rotorsRpmRTD
Command.Descr: Returns rotors RPM

Command.Name: round
Command.Descr: Rounds up or down to the closest integer.

Command.Name: runInitScript
Command.Descr: Launch init.sqs or init.sqf scripts.

Command.Name: safeZoneH
Command.Descr: Returns the height of the screen in screen measurement units.

Command.Name: safeZoneW
Command.Descr: Returns the width of the screen in screen measurement units.

Command.Name: safeZoneWAbs
Command.Descr: Returns SafeZone width (of all monitors, in case there's more than one)

Command.Name: safeZoneX
Command.Descr: Returns the X of the left border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0

Command.Name: safeZoneXAbs
Command.Descr: Returns SafeZone left border (of all monitors, in case there's more than one)

Command.Name: safeZoneY
Command.Descr: Returns the Y of the top border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0)

Command.Name: save3DENInventory
Command.Descr: Saves current state of entitie's inventory to SQM.

Command.Name: saveGame
Command.Descr: Autosave game (used for Retry).

Command.Name: saveIdentity
Command.Descr: Saves person's identity to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

Command.Name: saveJoysticks
Command.Descr: Saves joysticks key mappings into the joysticks.cfg file. Engine add these joysticks to the Joystick Scheme mapping dialog in options controls section.

Command.Name: saveOverlay
Command.Descr: Save the current overlay.

Command.Name: saveProfileNamespace
Command.Descr: Saves the variables stored in profileNamespace to the persistent active user profile.

Command.Name: saveStatus
Command.Descr: Saves object's properties to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

Command.Name: saveVar
Command.Descr: Save variable value into the campaign space. This variable is available to all following missions in the campaign.

Command.Name: savingEnabled
Command.Descr: Check if saving the game is enabled.

Command.Name: say
Command.Descr: Unit will say given sound.When the Unit is a Person, it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .

Command.Name: say
Command.Descr: Unit will say given sound.When the Unit is a Person, it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .

Command.Name: say
Command.Descr: Unit will say given sound.When the Unit is a Person, it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .

Command.Name: say
Command.Descr: Unit will say given sound.When the Unit is a Person, it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .

Command.Name: say2D
Command.Descr: Plays given sound in 2D

Command.Name: say2D
Command.Descr: Plays given sound in 2D

Command.Name: say2D
Command.Descr: Plays given sound in 2D

Command.Name: say2D
Command.Descr: Plays given sound in 2D

Command.Name: say3D
Command.Descr: Unit or object will say given sound in 3D Space.

Command.Name: say3D
Command.Descr: Unit or object will say given sound in 3D Space.
Command.Syntax: from say3D [sound, maxDistance, pitch, isSpeech, offset]

Command.Name: say3D
Command.Descr: Unit or object will say given sound in 3D Space.

Command.Name: say3D
Command.Descr: Unit or object will say given sound in 3D Space.
Command.Syntax: [from, to] say3D [sound, maxDistance, pitch, isSpeech, offset]

Command.Name: scopeName
Command.Descr: Defines name of current scope. Name is visible in debugger, and name is also used as reference in some commands like breakOut and breakTo.

Command.Name: score
Command.Descr: Returns the person's score in MP.

Command.Name: scoreSide
Command.Descr: Returns score for the given side.

Command.Name: screenToWorld
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - PositionAGL, world position on surface [x,y,0]
Command.Descr: Returns the position on landscape (PositionAGL) corresponding to the given point on screen (in UI coordinates).

Command.Name: screenshot
Command.Descr: Captures a screenshot and stores it to given filename. PNG is the only available format and the file must have .png extension.

Command.Name: scriptDone
Command.Descr: Check if a script is finished running using the Script_(Handle) returned by execVM or spawn.

Command.Name: scriptName
Command.Descr: Assign a user friendly name to the VM script this command is executed from.Once name is assigned, it cannot be changed.

Command.Name: scudState
Command.Descr: Current state of given Scud launcher.

Command.Name: secondaryWeapon
Command.Descr: Returns name of a unit's secondary weapon (empty string if none).

Command.Name: secondaryWeaponItems
Command.Descr: Returns array with all items assigned to the secondary weapon. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

Command.Name: secondaryWeaponMagazine
Command.Descr: Returns either single element array, containing class name of currently loaded in the secondary weapon magazine, or an empty array if unit has no seco

Command.Name: select
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - a reference to array element given by its index
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: select
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - a reference to array element given by its index (false - 0, true - 1)
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: select
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: select
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: select
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - a new array from selection
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: select
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - a new array of all elements from the original array that satisfied expre
Command.Descr: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

Command.Name: selectBestPlaces
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in Format [[position: Position2D, expressionResult: Number], ...
Command.Descr: Find the places with the maximum value of expression in the given area. Places can be on water. Results are sorted by value.

Command.Name: selectDiarySubject
Command.Descr: Select the subject page in a log.

Command.Name: selectEditorObject
Command.Descr: Select an editor object. Does not un-select previously selected objects.

Command.Name: selectLeader
Command.Descr: Select a group's leader. In MP the group has to be local to the PC executing the command.

Command.Name: selectMax
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - element with maximum numerical value
Command.Descr: Returns the array element with maximum numerical value. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_greatestNum and BIS_fnc_findExtreme.

Command.Name: selectMin
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - element with minimum numerical value
Command.Descr: Returns the array element with minimum numerical value. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_lowestNum and BIS_fnc_findExtreme.

Command.Name: selectNoPlayer
Command.Descr: Switches player to no unit, makes player return objNull. SP only, the command is completely ignored in MP.

Command.Name: selectPlayer
Command.Descr: Moves player into given unit. In Arma 3 it is now not possible to selectPlayer into unit occupied by another player.

Command.Name: selectRandom
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - random selected value or Nothing if array is empty
Command.Descr: Returns a random element from the given array.

Command.Name: selectRandomWeighted
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - random weighted value or Nothing if array is empty or all weights are
Command.Descr: Returns a random element from the given array according to assigned weights. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted.

Command.Name: selectRandomWeighted
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - random weighted value or Nothing if any of arrays is empty or all wei
Command.Descr: Returns a random element from the given array according to assigned weights. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted.

Command.Name: selectWeapon
Command.Descr: Selects the given weapon.Note: For weapons that have more than one muzzle, you have to input the muzzlename and not the weaponName.

Command.Name: selectWeaponTurret
Command.Descr: Selects the given weapon on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Since ver. 1.63.

Command.Name: selectedEditorObjects
Command.Descr: Returns a list of currently selected editor objects.

Command.Name: selectionNames
Command.Descr: Returns the list of model selections

Command.Name: selectionNames
Command.Descr: Returns the list of model selections

Command.Name: selectionPosition
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format PositionRelative ([x,y,z] relative position in model space)
Command.Descr: Search for selection in the object model (first in the memory level, then in geometry LODs).Returns position in model space.

Command.Name: selectionPosition
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - [x,y,z] relative position in model space
Command.Descr: Search for selection in the object model (first in the memory level, then in geometry LODs).Returns position in model space.

Command.Name: sendAUMessage
Command.Descr: Send the command to the list of clients.

Command.Name: sendSimpleCommand
Command.Descr: Sends a simple command to the vehicle's driver / gunner.

Command.Name: sendTask
Command.Descr: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

Command.Name: sendTaskResult
Command.Descr: Send a result of the task to the task sender.

Command.Name: sendUDPMessage
Command.Descr: Send message to given address using UDP protocol.

Command.Name: serverCommand
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - always true for some reason (since Arma 3 v1.
Command.Descr: Executes a server command on the server. In order to be able to execute admin command the user must be logged in as admin.

Command.Name: serverCommand
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if password is correct
Command.Descr: Executes a server command on the server. In order to be able to execute admin command the user must be logged in as admin.

Command.Name: serverCommandAvailable
Command.Descr: Returns true if the serverCommand can be performed on the machine, false if not.

Command.Name: serverCommandExecutable
Command.Descr: Returns true if the serverCommand can be performed on the machine and in this exact environment, otherwise false.

Command.Name: serverName
Command.Descr: Returns name of the hosting server in MP, "" in SP.

Command.Name: serverTime
Command.Descr: Server time synchronized to clients. Returns always 0 in Singleplayer.Note that in ArmA2 1.

Command.Name: set
Command.Descr: Changes the element at the given (zero-based) index of the array.If the element does not exist, resize index+1 is called to create it.

Command.Name: set3DENAttribute
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set one of entity attributes.! Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace.

Command.Name: set3DENAttribute
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set one of entity attributes.! Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace.

Command.Name: set3DENAttribute
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set one of entity attributes.! Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace.

Command.Name: set3DENAttribute
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set one of entity attributes.! Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace.

Command.Name: set3DENAttributes
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set entity attributes.An attribute is identified by its property (data when it's engine-drive attribute) value in config.

Command.Name: set3DENGrid
Command.Descr: Sets the grid increment for the given transformation type.

Command.Name: set3DENIconsVisible
Command.Descr: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor icons.

Command.Name: set3DENLayer
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the entity was moved succesfully
Command.Descr: Set layer for Eden Entity.

Command.Name: set3DENLayer
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the entity was moved succesfully
Command.Descr: Set layer for Eden Entity.

Command.Name: set3DENLayer
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the entity was moved succesfully
Command.Descr: Set layer for Eden Entity.

Command.Name: set3DENLayer
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the entity was moved succesfully
Command.Descr: Set layer for Eden Entity.

Command.Name: set3DENLinesVisible
Command.Descr: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor lines.

Command.Name: set3DENLogicType
Command.Descr: Sets the new type of Logic object(s).

Command.Name: set3DENMissionAttribute
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set scenario attribute.An attribute is identified by its property (data when it's engine-drive attribute) value in config.

Command.Name: set3DENMissionAttributes
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if the value was set
Command.Descr: Set scenario attributes.An attribute is identified by its property (data when it's engine-drive attribute) value in config.

Command.Name: set3DENModelsVisible
Command.Descr: Enables or disables lines visibility in 3DEN

Command.Name: set3DENObjectType
Command.Descr: Sets the classname of one or more given Eden Editor objects.

Command.Name: set3DENSelected
Command.Descr: Changes selection in 3den to what is inside entities array.

Command.Name: setAccTime
Command.Descr: Set time acceleration coefficient. May be also used to slow time in cutscenes. This command does NOT work in multiplayer.

Command.Name: setActualCollectiveRTD
Command.Descr: Sets the collective pitch control to a specific position, regardless of input devices (until those are changed).0: collective fully down~0.

Command.Name: setAirplaneThrottle
Command.Descr: Sets a wanted throttle position, works only on player's vehicle.

Command.Name: setAirportSide
Command.Descr: Set owning side of the airport. ID is the number to identify which airport on the island you want to check.

Command.Name: setAirportSide
Command.Descr: Set owning side of the airport. ID is the number to identify which airport on the island you want to check.

Command.Name: setAmmo
Command.Descr: Sets custom ammo count in the currently loaded magazine of the specified weapon. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed.

Command.Name: setAmmoCargo
Command.Descr: Set amount of ammo resources in cargo space of a rearm vehicle. Ammo resource is used to resupply vehicles that take ammo.

Command.Name: setAmmoOnPylon
Command.Descr: Set count of ammo in magazine on pylon

Command.Name: setAnimSpeedCoef
Command.Descr: Sets a coefficient for animation speed

Command.Name: setAperture
Command.Descr: Sets custom camera aperture (-1 to do it automatically).

Command.Name: setApertureNew
Command.Descr: Sets custom camera aperture ([-1] to do it automatically).

Command.Name: setArmoryPoints
Command.Descr: Stores passed number into [USERNAME].ArmaXProfile file, where it assigns it as a value to armoryPoints entry. If entry doesn't exist, it is created.

Command.Name: setAttributes
Command.Descr: Returns a structured text created by the given structured or plain text by setting attributes to the given values.

Command.Name: setAutonomous
Command.Descr: Sets UAV autonomous mode.

Command.Name: setBehaviour
Command.Descr: Sets group behaviour mode. If a unit is given as argument, behaviour is set for the unit's group.

Command.Name: setBehaviour
Command.Descr: Sets group behaviour mode. If a unit is given as argument, behaviour is set for the unit's group.

Command.Name: setBehaviourStrong
Command.Descr: Sets group behaviour mode & forces it to a group. If a unit is given as argument, behaviour is set for the unit's group.

Command.Name: setBehaviourStrong
Command.Descr: Sets group behaviour mode & forces it to a group. If a unit is given as argument, behaviour is set for the unit's group.

Command.Name: setBleedingRemaining
Command.Descr: Sets for how many seconds injured unit leaves blood trail. The unit damage must be >= 0.

Command.Name: setBrakesRTD
Command.Descr: Enable landing gear wheel brakes for a helicopter.

Command.Name: setCamShakeDefParams
Command.Descr: Sets camera shake default params, the default camshake when, for example, you freelook at your character shooting a 12.
Command.Syntax: setCamShakeDefParams [power, duration, frequency, minSpeed, minMass, caliberCoefHit, vehicleCoef]

Command.Name: setCamShakeParams
Command.Descr: Set camera shake parameters. Will not have any effect until shake is started via addCamShake.

Command.Name: setCamUseTI
Command.Descr: Activates thermal vision.

Command.Name: setCamUseTi
Command.Descr: Activates thermal vision.

Command.Name: setCameraInterest
Command.Descr: Set camera interest for given entity. Camera interest is by default 0. Any unit which is speaking has its camera interest raised to 50.

Command.Name: setCaptive
Command.Descr: Mark a unit as captive. If unit is a vehicle, commander is marked.

Command.Name: setCaptive
Command.Descr: Mark a unit as captive. If unit is a vehicle, commander is marked.

Command.Name: setCenterOfMass
Command.Descr: Changes the center of mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds).

Command.Name: setCenterOfMass
Command.Descr: Changes the center of mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds).

Command.Name: setCollisionLight
Command.Descr: Switches collision lights of a vehicle on/off.

Command.Name: setCombatMode
Command.Descr: Set group combat mode (engagement rules).

Command.Name: setCombatMode
Command.Descr: Set group combat mode (engagement rules).

Command.Name: setCompassOscillation
Command.Descr: Sets compass oscillation.

Command.Name: setConvoySeparation
Command.Descr: Sets the distance to keep to following vehicle.

Command.Name: setCuratorCameraAreaCeiling
Command.Descr: Sets maximal height to which curator camera can move.

Command.Name: setCuratorCoef
Command.Descr: Sets coef for some action (coef have to be bigger than -1 000 000, anything lower is considered as disabled action).

Command.Name: setCuratorEditingAreaType
Command.Descr: Set whether curator can edit in all editing areas (true) or outside of them (false).

Command.Name: setCuratorWaypointCost
Command.Descr: Sets cost of waypoints (used for placing, editing and deleting).

Command.Name: setCurrentChannel
Command.Descr: Sets given channel as current chat channel. Scripted way of selecting desired channel on the UI.

Command.Name: setCurrentTask
Command.Descr: Set the task as a current task of the person.

Command.Name: setCurrentWaypoint
Command.Descr: Sets the currently active waypoint for a group.

Command.Name: setCurrentWaypoint
Command.Descr: Sets the currently active waypoint for a group.

Command.Name: setCustomAimCoef
Command.Descr: Set custom aim precision coefficient for weapon sway

Command.Name: setCustomSoundController
Command.Descr: Sets value of the specified custom sound controller to be used in simple expressions in config.

Command.Name: setCustomWeightRTD
Command.Descr: Add virtual custom weight to a helicopter's center of gravity.

Command.Name: setDamage
Command.Descr: Damage / repair object. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.

Command.Name: setDamage
Command.Descr: Damage / repair object. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.

Command.Name: setDammage
Command.Descr: Damage / repair object.Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.

Command.Name: setDate
Command.Descr: Sets the actual mission date and time.

Command.Name: setDebriefingText
Command.Descr: Sets debriefing text for endType defined in CfgDebriefing.

Command.Name: setDefaultCamera
Command.Descr: Sets the position and direction for the camera used after camera is set on no object (log out view when leaving MP game for example)

Command.Name: setDestination
Command.Descr: Set the destination for path planning of the pilot.

Command.Name: setDetailMapBlendPars
Command.Descr: Sets the detail texture map blend pars. Allows for smooth transition between detailed and undetailed terrain texture at distance.

Command.Name: setDiaryRecordText
Command.Descr: Set text of a log record.

Command.Name: setDir
Command.Descr: Sets object heading. Angles are measured in degrees clockwise from north.

Command.Name: setDirection
Command.Descr: Set's the orientation of a location. It's area and map icon (if it's type uses an icon) will be rotated to this orientation.

Command.Name: setDrawIcon
Command.Descr: Set the icon to be shown in 2D editor for the specified editor object. If maintain size is false,icon will not scale depending on the scale,of the map.

Command.Name: setDriveOnPath
Command.Descr: Sets the path to follow for AI driver

Command.Name: setDropInterval
Command.Descr: Set interval of emitting particles from particle source. In Arma 3 hardcoded limit of how many particles can exist at the same time is 18000.

Command.Name: setDynamicSimulationDistance
Command.Descr: Sets activation distance of Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for given category

Command.Name: setDynamicSimulationDistanceCoef
Command.Descr: Sets activation distance multiplier of Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for the given class

Command.Name: setEditorMode
Command.Descr: Sets map mode to MAP,3D or PREVIEW.

Command.Name: setEditorObjectScope
Command.Descr: This command defines the level of access a user has to editor objects.
Command.Syntax: map setEditorObjectScope [objects, editorType, condition, scope, subordinatesAlso]

Command.Name: setEffectCondition
Command.Descr: The statement is executed when the trigger or waypoint is activated and the effects are launched depending on the result.

Command.Name: setEffectCondition
Command.Descr: The statement is executed when the trigger or waypoint is activated and the effects are launched depending on the result.

Command.Name: setEffectiveCommander
Command.Descr: Sets effectiveCommander of the given vehicle. Effective commander is the person who commands the vehicle, i.e. gives commands to the driver.

Command.Name: setEngineRPMRTD
Command.Descr: engine index 1: engine #2engine index 2: engine #3engine index -1: all enginesFor this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter F

Command.Name: setFSMVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given FSM.The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

Command.Name: setFace
Command.Descr: Set person's face. For a list of available faces, check Category:CfgIdentities.

Command.Name: setFaceAnimation
Command.Descr: Set facial animation phase (eye blinking), blink is in the range from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setFatigue
Command.Descr: Sets the person's fatigue, from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setFeatureType
Command.Descr: Enable/disable object as a feature/landmark.

Command.Name: setFlagAnimationPhase
Command.Descr: Sets flag position on the flag pole according to the given animation phase, where 0 is the bottom of the flag pole, 1 is the top of the flag pole.

Command.Name: setFlagOwner
Command.Descr: Sets flag owner. When owner is set to objNull or any object other than a unit of class man or logic, flag is returned to the flagpole.

Command.Name: setFlagSide
Command.Descr: Sets flag Side. A flag may be taken by any unit that is enemy to the side that owns the flag.

Command.Name: setFlagTexture
Command.Descr: Sets flag texture.If texture is "", flag is not drawn.Custom texture can be used, as long as it is in *.

Command.Name: setFog
Command.Descr: Changes the fog smoothly over the the given TransitionTime (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setFog
Command.Descr: Changes the fog smoothly over the the given TransitionTime (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setFormDir
Command.Descr: Set group formation heading. Accepted heading range is 0 to 360. Formation is facing this direction unless enemy is seen.

Command.Name: setFormDir
Command.Descr: Set group formation heading. Accepted heading range is 0 to 360. Formation is facing this direction unless enemy is seen.

Command.Name: setFormation
Command.Descr: Set group formation.

Command.Name: setFormation
Command.Descr: Set group formation.

Command.Name: setFormationTask
Command.Descr: Set the current task of the formation member.

Command.Name: setFriend
Command.Descr: Sets how friendly side1 is with side2. For a value smaller than 0.6 it results in being enemy, otherwise it's friendly.

Command.Name: setFromEditor
Command.Descr: Set if given team member was inserted directly from editor.

Command.Name: setFuel
Command.Descr: Sets fuel percentage from 0 (empty) to 1 (full). The vehicle must be local to the computer where command is executed.

Command.Name: setFuelCargo
Command.Descr: Sets fuel amount in cargo space of refuel vehicle from empty (0) to full (1)Note, the carrying capacity of each side's refuel trucks differ.

Command.Name: setGroupIcon
Command.Descr: Set group icons properties.

Command.Name: setGroupIconParams
Command.Descr: Set group icons parameters.

Command.Name: setGroupIconsSelectable
Command.Descr: Sets if group icons raises onclick and onover events.

Command.Name: setGroupIconsVisible
Command.Descr: Sets if group icons are visible.

Command.Name: setGroupId
Command.Descr: Sets a group's identity, how it will be displayed in chat, for example.

Command.Name: setGroupId
Command.Descr: Sets a group's identity, how it will be displayed in chat, for example.

Command.Name: setGroupIdGlobal
Command.Descr: A global equivalent of setGroupId

Command.Name: setGroupIdGlobal
Command.Descr: A global equivalent of setGroupId

Command.Name: setGroupOwner
Command.Descr: Changes the ownership of a group (and all its units) to a given client. Group leader can't be a player. Only works when called from a server.

Command.Name: setGusts
Command.Descr: Changes the gusts value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. Value is 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setHUDMovementLevels
Command.Descr: Set min/max movement borders displayed in HUD gauges. Use -1 to skip some value.
Command.Syntax: setHUDMovementLevels [minSpeed, maxSpeed, minAlt, maxAlt, minDir, maxDir, targetOrPosition]

Command.Name: setHideBehind
Command.Descr: Sets the data for hiding. objectWhereHide can be taken using findCover. hidePosition can be taken using getHideFrom.

Command.Name: setHit
Command.Descr: Damage / repair part of object. The object must be local to the computer where command is executed.

Command.Name: setHitIndex
Command.Descr: Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index).

Command.Name: setHitPointDamage
Command.Descr: Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class).

Command.Name: setHorizonParallaxCoef
Command.Descr: Sets coef used to shift horizon position based on camera height (use 0 to disable shifting).

Command.Name: setIdentity
Command.Descr: Set identity of person.Identities are defined in Description.ext of the mission or campaign.

Command.Name: setImportance
Command.Descr: Sets the importance value of location.

Command.Name: setInfoPanel
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if panel was successfully opened, false otherwise (e.g.
Command.Descr: Opens given component or first component of given component type on specified info panel.

Command.Name: setLeader
Command.Descr: Set the leader of given team. Effect is local, unless both leader unit and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

Command.Name: setLightAmbient
Command.Descr: Set ambient color of light. This includes surfaces that face away from the light, unlike setLightColor.

Command.Name: setLightAttenuation
Command.Descr: Sets attenuation of light. Standard method of attenuation (1 / (constant + linear*dist + quadratic*dist*dist)).
Command.Syntax: light setLightAttenuation [start, constant, linear, quadratic, hardlimitstart, hardlimitend]

Command.Name: setLightBrightness
Command.Descr: Set brightness of light.

Command.Name: setLightColor
Command.Descr: Set diffuse color of light. Illuminates surfaces that are facing the light.

Command.Name: setLightDayLight
Command.Descr: Sets if light can be used during the day.

Command.Name: setLightFlareMaxDistance
Command.Descr: Sets max distance where the flare is visible.

Command.Name: setLightFlareSize
Command.Descr: Sets relative size of the flare for the light.

Command.Name: setLightIntensity
Command.Descr: Sets intensity of light.

Command.Name: setLightUseFlare
Command.Descr: Sets if light has flare.

Command.Name: setLightnings
Command.Descr: Changes the lightnings value smoothly during the given time (in seconds).A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setLocalWindParams
Command.Descr: Sets parameters for helicopter rotor wash.

Command.Name: setMagazineTurretAmmo
Command.Descr: Sets ammo count to given amount for given turret.

Command.Name: setMarkerAlpha
Command.Descr: Sets the marker alpha. The marker is modified on all computers in a network session.

Command.Name: setMarkerAlphaLocal
Command.Descr: Sets the marker alpha. The marker is only modified on the computer where the command is called.

Command.Name: setMarkerBrush
Command.Descr: Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.

Command.Name: setMarkerBrushLocal
Command.Descr: Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.

Command.Name: setMarkerColor
Command.Descr: Sets marker color.

Command.Name: setMarkerColorLocal
Command.Descr: Sets marker color for the given marker locally.

Command.Name: setMarkerDir
Command.Descr: Sets the orientation of the marker. Angle is in degrees.

Command.Name: setMarkerDirLocal
Command.Descr: Sets the orientation of the marker. Angle is in degrees.

Command.Name: setMarkerPos
Command.Descr: Moves the marker. Pos format is Position2D.

Command.Name: setMarkerPosLocal
Command.Descr: Moves the marker. Pos format is Position2D.

Command.Name: setMarkerShape
Command.Descr: Selects the shape (type) of the marker.Shape can be "ICON", "RECTANGLE", "ELLIPSE" or "POLYLINE".

Command.Name: setMarkerShapeLocal
Command.Descr: Selects the shape (type) of the marker.Shape can be "ICON", "RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE".

Command.Name: setMarkerSize
Command.Descr: Set marker size.Size is in format [a-axis, b-axis].

Command.Name: setMarkerSizeLocal
Command.Descr: Set marker size.Size is in format [a-axis, b-axis].

Command.Name: setMarkerText
Command.Descr: Sets the text label of an existing marker.

Command.Name: setMarkerTextLocal
Command.Descr: Sets the text label of an existing marker.

Command.Name: setMarkerType
Command.Descr: Set marker type. See cfgMarkers for a list of standard markers.

Command.Name: setMarkerTypeLocal
Command.Descr: Set marker type. See cfgMarkers for a list of standard markers.

Command.Name: setMass
Command.Descr: Changes the mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero (or using the alternative syntax) means an immediate change.

Command.Name: setMass
Command.Descr: Changes the mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero (or using the alternative syntax) means an immediate change.

Command.Name: setMimic
Command.Descr: Set person's facial expression.

Command.Name: setMissileTarget
Command.Descr: Sets a guided missile target. Doesn't work for all types of missiles. If target is dead, target is ignored.

Command.Name: setMissileTargetPos
Command.Descr: Sets a guided missile target position. Doesn't work for all types of missiles.

Command.Name: setMousePosition
Command.Descr: Moves mouse pointer to specified position on the screen. x and y could be any number, but will be clipped so mouse never leaves the screen area.

Command.Name: setMusicEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the music track played on activation.Track is a subclass name of CfgMusic. In addition, "$STOP$" (stops the current music track).

Command.Name: setMusicEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the music track played on activation.Track is a subclass name of CfgMusic. In addition, "$STOP$" (stops the current music track).

Command.Name: setMusicEventHandler
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - id of the event handler
Command.Descr: Sets given music track event handler. Will overwrite other music event handlers. Use addMusicEventHandler if you want to stack them.

Command.Name: setName
Command.Descr: Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set name of a person but only in single player.

Command.Name: setName
Command.Descr: Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set name of a person but only in single player.

Command.Name: setName
Command.Descr: Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set name of a person but only in single player.

Command.Name: setNameSound
Command.Descr: Sets the nameSound of a person.

Command.Name: setObjectArguments
Command.Descr: Set object arguments in mission editor.

Command.Name: setObjectMaterial
Command.Descr: Sets material of object selection. The selection number is defined through the hiddenselection[]={} array in the vehicle's config (starting with 0).

Command.Name: setObjectMaterialGlobal
Command.Descr: Set the material of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

Command.Name: setObjectProxy
Command.Descr: Set the proxy object associated with the given editor object.

Command.Name: setObjectTexture
Command.Descr: Textures object selection with texture named in array. Array has the form [selectionNumber, "Texture"].

Command.Name: setObjectTextureGlobal
Command.Descr: Set the texture of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

Command.Name: setObjectViewDistance
Command.Descr: Sets the rendering distance of objects (and shadows).

Command.Name: setObjectViewDistance
Command.Descr: Sets the rendering distance of objects (and shadows).

Command.Name: setOvercast
Command.Descr: Set overcast to given value smoothly during given time (in seconds). Zero time means immediate change.

Command.Name: setOwner
Command.Descr: From server machine, change the ownership of an object to a given client. Returns true if locality was changed.Since Arma 3 v1.

Command.Name: setOxygenRemaining
Command.Descr: Sets oxygen remaining. It has no effect when soldier is not diving. Oxygen remaining is a number between 0 and 1.

Command.Name: setParticleCircle
Command.Descr: Updates particle source, creates particles in circle with given radius. Velocity is transformed and added to total velocity.

Command.Name: setParticleClass
Command.Descr: Set parameters from existing config class. ClassName is name of the class from CfgCloudlets. Since version 1.11.

Command.Name: setParticleFire
Command.Descr: Set fire parameters to particle effect.Note: You need to create emitter at first. Basic parameters of particle effect must be defined too.

Command.Name: setParticleParams
Command.Descr: Set parameters to particle source. Array is in format ParticleArray. Since Arma 3 version 1.11.

Command.Name: setParticleRandom
Command.Descr: Sets randomization of particle source parameters.
Command.Syntax: particleSource setParticleRandom [lifeTime, position, moveVelocity, rotationVelocity, size, color, directionPeriod, directionIntensity, angle, bounceOnSurface]

Command.Name: setPiPEffect
Command.Descr: Sets Render Target's visual effect (Picture-in-Picture).

Command.Name: setPilotCameraDirection
Command.Descr: Sets the direction of object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera (vector in model space).

Command.Name: setPilotCameraRotation
Command.Descr: Sets rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

Command.Name: setPilotCameraTarget
Command.Descr: Sets an area or target to be tracked by the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera.

Command.Name: setPilotCameraTarget
Command.Descr: Sets an area or target to be tracked by the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera.

Command.Name: setPilotLight
Command.Descr: Switches headlights of a vehicle on/off.

Command.Name: setPitch
Command.Descr: Sets the pitch of a persons voice.

Command.Name: setPlateNumber
Command.Descr: Change the license plates on any vehicle which has plates configured.

Command.Name: setPlayable
Command.Descr: Create MP role for the unit. The roles created this way are used for Join In Progress and Team Switch.

Command.Name: setPlayerRespawnTime
Command.Descr: Set the time interval to wait on player respawn. It is set to mission default on mission start again.

Command.Name: setPlayerVoNVolume
Command.Descr: Sets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

Command.Name: setPos
Command.Descr: Sets object position.

Command.Name: setPosASL
Command.Descr: Sets the object position above sea level. The pos array uses the PositionASL format.

Command.Name: setPosASL2
Command.Descr: Sets the object position. The pos array uses the PositionASL format. The version of the command does not offset based on object center.

Command.Name: setPosASLW
Command.Descr: Sets the object position above sea surface. The pos array uses the PositionASLW format.

Command.Name: setPosATL
Command.Descr: Sets the position of an object relative to the terrain.

Command.Name: setPosWorld
Command.Descr: Sets position of an object based on PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0].

Command.Name: setPosition
Command.Descr: Sets the position of a location.

Command.Name: setPylonLoadOut
Command.Descr: Will add missile to vehicle pylon, TransportPylonsComponent in config is required

Command.Name: setPylonLoadout
Command.Descr: Will add missile to vehicle pylon, TransportPylonsComponent in config is required

Command.Name: setPylonsPriority
Command.Descr: Overrides default pylons priorities

Command.Name: setRadioMsg
Command.Descr: Sets radio trigger menu title text (0 -> 0 -> map radio). Use "NULL" to disable radio slot.

Command.Name: setRain
Command.Descr: Set rain density smoothly over the given transition time (in seconds). A transition time of zero means an immediate change.

Command.Name: setRainbow
Command.Descr: Changes the rainbow value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setRandomLip
Command.Descr: Enables/Disables random lip. When enabled, the unit continuously moves its lips as if it's talking.

Command.Name: setRank
Command.Descr: Sets rank of given unit.Possible values: PRIVATE, CORPORAL, SERGEANT, LIEUTENANT, CAPTAIN, MAJOR or COLONEL. Since Arma 3 v1.

Command.Name: setRectangular
Command.Descr: Set the shape of a location to be either rectangular or elliptical. Locations default shape is elliptical.

Command.Name: setRepairCargo
Command.Descr: Set amount of repair resources in cargo space of repair vehicle.Amount 1 is full cargo.

Command.Name: setRotorBrakeRTD
Command.Descr: Toggle a helicopter's rotor brake on or off.

Command.Name: setShadowDistance
Command.Descr: Sets the shadows rendering distance.

Command.Name: setShotParents
Command.Descr: Sets vehicle and instigator pair for the given projectile.

Command.Name: setSide
Command.Descr: Sets a location's side. The default side is Unknown.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskAlwaysVisible
Command.Descr: Makes the given task allways visible or not.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskCustomData
Command.Descr: Set custom data for the task. Tooltip will be drawn in task list on the right side. Description will be drawn in task description panel on the bottom.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskDescription
Command.Descr: Attach descriptions to the simple task.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskDestination
Command.Descr: Attach a destination to the simple task.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskTarget
Command.Descr: Attach a target to the simple task.Overrides setSimpleTaskDestination.

Command.Name: setSimpleTaskType
Command.Descr: Attach type to the simple task.

Command.Name: setSimulWeatherLayers
Command.Descr: Sets number of simul weather layers, affects quality of simul weather clouds.

Command.Name: setSize
Command.Descr: Sets the size (radius) of a location.The width is 2 * x, the height is 2 * y.

Command.Name: setSkill
Command.Descr: Sets ability level of person (commander unit). Value of skill may vary from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setSkill
Command.Descr: Sets ability level of person (commander unit). Value of skill may vary from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setSkill_array
Command.Descr: Sets sub-skill level of an unit / commander unit. Value of sub-skill may vary from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setSkill_array
Command.Descr: Sets sub-skill level of an unit / commander unit. Value of sub-skill may vary from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setSlingLoad
Command.Descr: Creates sling loading from first object to second object if possible. To unload cargo, pass objNull as second param.

Command.Name: setSoundEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the different sound effects.

Command.Name: setSoundEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the different sound effects.

Command.Name: setSpeaker
Command.Descr: Sets the speaker of a person.

Command.Name: setSpeech
Command.Descr: Add speech to location.

Command.Name: setSpeedMode
Command.Descr: Set group speed mode.

Command.Name: setSpeedMode
Command.Descr: Set group speed mode.

Command.Name: setStamina
Command.Descr: Set units' stamina (seconds until depletion)

Command.Name: setStaminaScheme
Command.Descr: Set stamina bar color. The scheme can be "Normal", "FastDrain", "Exhausted" or "Default".

Command.Name: setStatValue
Command.Descr: Sets a value to a given stat.

Command.Name: setSuppression
Command.Descr: Sets the person's suppression, from 0 to 1.

Command.Name: setSystemOfUnits
Command.Descr: Set system of units.

Command.Name: setTargetAge
Command.Descr: Sets how the target is known to the other centers. They behave like the target was seen age seconds ago.

Command.Name: setTaskMarkerOffset
Command.Descr: Sets the task marker position in model space.

Command.Name: setTaskResult
Command.Descr: Set a result of the task.

Command.Name: setTaskState
Command.Descr: Set the state of a given task.

Command.Name: setTerrainGrid
Command.Descr: Operation Flashpoint, VBS1: Set desired terrain resolution (in meters).

Command.Name: setText
Command.Descr: Sets the text associated with a location. This text will be displayed on the game map at the location's position.

Command.Name: setTimeMultiplier
Command.Descr: Sets a time multiplier for in-game time. The command range is now capped at 0.1 - 120 to avoid performance problems.

Command.Name: setTitleEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the title effect via [Type, Effect, Text] where'Type' can be "NONE", "OBJECT", 'Text' defines the shown object , a subclass of CfgTitles.

Command.Name: setTitleEffect
Command.Descr: Defines the title effect via [Type, Effect, Text] where'Type' can be "NONE", "OBJECT", 'Text' defines the shown object , a subclass of CfgTitles.

Command.Name: setTriggerActivation
Command.Descr: Defines the trigger activation type.

Command.Name: setTriggerArea
Command.Descr: Defines the area monitored by the given trigger. The area could be either rectangular or elliptical. Since Arma 3 v1.59.
Command.Syntax: trigger setTriggerArea [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

Command.Name: setTriggerInterval
Command.Descr: Sets the interval in seconds for trigger condition check. Triggers are configured to check condition approx. every 0.5 second by default.

Command.Name: setTriggerStatements
Command.Descr: Defines trigger condition, activation and deactivation statements. Trigger condition has to return Boolean.

Command.Name: setTriggerText
Command.Descr: Sets the text label attached to the trigger object. This is used for example as a radio slot label for radio activated triggers.

Command.Name: setTriggerTimeout
Command.Descr: Defines the time between condition satisfaction and trigger activation (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid).

Command.Name: setTriggerType
Command.Descr: Sets the type of action processed by the trigger after activation (no action, a waypoints switch or an end of mission): "NONE" "EAST G" - Guarded b

Command.Name: setType
Command.Descr: Changes a location to the specified class. Location classes are defined in CfgLocationTypes.

Command.Name: setUnconscious
Command.Descr: Since Arma 3 v1.63.136889, this command sets unit into incapacitated state and lifeState command returns "INCAPACITATED".

Command.Name: setUnitAbility
Command.Descr: Sets skill of given unit.

Command.Name: setUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Creates a loadout from given inventory structure and applies it to a unit. This command is not final and might be changed in a near future.

Command.Name: setUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Creates a loadout from given inventory structure and applies it to a unit. This command is not final and might be changed in a near future.

Command.Name: setUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Creates a loadout from given inventory structure and applies it to a unit. This command is not final and might be changed in a near future.

Command.Name: setUnitLoadout
Command.Descr: Creates a loadout from given inventory structure and applies it to a unit. This command is not final and might be changed in a near future.

Command.Name: setUnitPos
Command.Descr: Set unit position rules. Mode may be one of: "DOWN" - unit goes prone and stays prone. "UP" - unit stands and stays standing.

Command.Name: setUnitPosWeak
Command.Descr: Set unit position rules. Mode may be one of: "DOWN" - person goes prone and stays prone. "UP" - person stands and stays standing.

Command.Name: setUnitRank
Command.Descr: Sets rank of given unit.

Command.Name: setUnitRecoilCoefficient
Command.Descr: Proportionaly increase/decrease unit's recoil. Drives muzzle up with every shot when supplied positive number and down when negative. 0 cancels recoil.

Command.Name: setUnitTrait
Command.Descr: Enables or disables a trait or alters a trait of the given unit. Custom trait can only be a bool.

Command.Name: setUnloadInCombat
Command.Descr: If cargo or turret units should get out of vehicle when in combat. If true, vehicle will stop and units will dismount. Vehicle must be local.

Command.Name: setUserActionText
Command.Descr: Changes user added action (see addAction) menu item text. Since Arma 3 v1.61.

Command.Name: setUserMFDText
Command.Descr: Stored user text value in MFD, limit is 50, user0...

Command.Name: setUserMFDValue
Command.Descr: Store user value in MFD, limit is 10, user0...user9.

Command.Name: setUserMFDvalue
Command.Descr: Store user value in MFD, limit is 10, user0...user9.

Command.Name: setVariable
