Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVariable
Command.Descr: Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.To remove a variable, set it to nil (e.g. player setVariable ["varname", nil];).

Command.Name: setVectorDir
Command.Descr: Set object's direction vector. Up vector will remain unchanged.

Command.Name: setVectorDirAndUp
Command.Descr: Sets orientation of an object. The command takes 2 vector arrays, one for vectorDir and one for vectorUp.
Command.Syntax: vehicle setVectorDirAndUp [[x1, y1, z1], [x2, y2, z2]]

Command.Name: setVectorUp
Command.Descr: Set object's up vector. Direction of the object remain unchanged. Default object's vectorUp is [0,0,1].

Command.Name: setVehicleAmmo
Command.Descr: Sets how much ammunition (compared to a full state defined by the vehicle type) the vehicle has.

Command.Name: setVehicleAmmoDef
Command.Descr: Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has.

Command.Name: setVehicleArmor
Command.Descr: Sets the armor (or health for men) state of the vehicle (a value from 0 to 1).

Command.Name: setVehicleCargo
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - whether the vehicle was able to be loaded
Command.Descr: Load cargo vehicle inside vehicle if possible, returns bool based on whether the vehicle was able to be loaded.

Command.Name: setVehicleId
Command.Descr: Sets id (integer value) to vehicle. By this id vehicle is referenced by triggers and waypoints.

Command.Name: setVehicleInit
Command.Descr: Attach a statement to a unit. The statement is propagated over the network in MP games, it can be executed by invoking processInitCommands.

Command.Name: setVehicleLock
Command.Descr: Sets vehicle lock.

Command.Name: setVehiclePosition
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true on success, false on failure
Command.Descr: Moves the object to a given position (same as createVehicle placement algorithm).

Command.Name: setVehicleRadar
Command.Descr: Sets the AI rules of Radar usage (Emission Control). Automatic means Radar switched on only when in Combat.

Command.Name: setVehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
Command.Descr: Sets that the vehicle will be able to receive targets acquired by someone else via datalink from the Side center.

Command.Name: setVehicleReportOwnPosition
Command.Descr: Sets that the vehicle will share its own position via datalink to the Side center.

Command.Name: setVehicleReportRemoteTargets
Command.Descr: Sets that the vehicle will share targets that were acquired by its own sensors via datalink to the Side center.

Command.Name: setVehicleTIPars
Command.Descr: Sets the "heat" state of different vehicle parts (for TI detection).

Command.Name: setVehicleTiPars
Command.Descr: Sets the "heat" state of different vehicle parts (for TI detection).

Command.Name: setVehicleVarName
Command.Descr: Sets string representation of an object to a custom string.

Command.Name: setVelocity
Command.Descr: Set velocity (speed vector) of a vehicle. Units are in metres per second.

Command.Name: setVelocityModelSpace
Command.Descr: Sets the velocity (speed vector) of the given vehicle relative to its model.

Command.Name: setVelocityTransformation
Command.Descr: Interpolate and sets vectors. For additional info see this resource.
Command.Syntax: object setVelocityTransformation [fromPosASL, toPosASL, fromVelocity, toVelocity, fromVectorDir, toVectorDir, fromVectorUp, toVectorUp, interval]

Command.Name: setViewDistance
Command.Descr: Set rendering distance, in metres. Default is 900m (in OFP) or 1,200m (in ArmA), accepted range is 500m to 5,000m (in OFP) or 10,000m (in ArmA).

Command.Name: setVisibleIfTreeCollapsed
Command.Descr: Sets whether or not the object is visible even if the tree is collapsed.

Command.Name: setWPPos
Command.Descr: Set waypoint position

Command.Name: setWantedRPMRTD
Command.Descr: Tell the helicopter engine RPMs to reach the given value within a period of time.

Command.Name: setWaves
Command.Descr: Changes the waves value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setWaypointBehaviour
Command.Descr: Switches the unit behaviour when the waypoint becomes active.

Command.Name: setWaypointCombatMode
Command.Descr: The group combat mode is switched when the waypoint becomes active.

Command.Name: setWaypointCompletionRadius
Command.Descr: The completion radius allows units to call the waypoint completed once they are inside of the given circle.

Command.Name: setWaypointDescription
Command.Descr: Sets the description shown in the HUD while the waypoint is active.

Command.Name: setWaypointForceBehaviour
Command.Descr: Forces the behavior of waypoint, disables AUTOCOMBAT.

Command.Name: setWaypointFormation
Command.Descr: Switches the group formation when the waypoint becomes active.

Command.Name: setWaypointHousePosition
Command.Descr: For waypoints attached to a house, this defines the target house position.

Command.Name: setWaypointLoiterAltitude
Command.Descr: Assignes loiter altitude to waypoint

Command.Name: setWaypointLoiterRadius
Command.Descr: Assignes loiter radius to waypoint

Command.Name: setWaypointLoiterType
Command.Descr: Sets the waypoint loiter type.

Command.Name: setWaypointName
Command.Descr: Changes the waypoint name.

Command.Name: setWaypointPosition
Command.Descr: Moves the waypoint to a random position in a circle with the given center and radius.

Command.Name: setWaypointScript
Command.Descr: Attaches a script to a scripted waypoint.

Command.Name: setWaypointSpeed
Command.Descr: Switches the group speed mode when the waypoint becomes active.

Command.Name: setWaypointStatements
Command.Descr: The waypoint is done only when the condition is fulfilled. When the waypoint is done, the statement expression is executed.

Command.Name: setWaypointTimeout
Command.Descr: Defines the time between condition satisfaction and waypoint finish (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid).

Command.Name: setWaypointType
Command.Descr: Changes the waypoint type.

Command.Name: setWaypointVisible
Command.Descr: Sets the visibility of the waypoint.

Command.Name: setWeaponReloadingTime
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if given weapon is found
Command.Descr: Sets states and/or makes an action of/on weapon. Reload time is between 0 and 1 inclusive, where 1 is 100% of maximum reloading time.

Command.Name: setWind
Command.Descr: Set current (forced == false) or permanent (forced == true) wind vector.NOTE: The effect is global only if command is executed on the server.

Command.Name: setWindDir
Command.Descr: Changes the wind direction smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setWindForce
Command.Descr: Set max. wind overall wind changes in time. A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setWindStr
Command.Descr: Changes the wind strength smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

Command.Name: setWingForceScaleRTD
Command.Descr: Set effectivity of wings

Command.Name: show3DIcons
Command.Descr: Toggle the drawing of 3D icons.

Command.Name: showChat
Command.Descr: Shows/hides the whole chat window.

Command.Name: showCinemaBorder
Command.Descr: Forces drawing of cinema borders when using custom camera camCreate. This is normally used in cutscenes to indicate player has no control.

Command.Name: showCommandingMenu
Command.Descr: Create the commanding menu described by the given config class or menu name. When the name is empty, the current menu is hidden.

Command.Name: showCompass
Command.Descr: Shows or hides the compass on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item.

Command.Name: showCuratorCompass
Command.Descr: Hides or shows compass in curator interface.

Command.Name: showGPS
Command.Descr: Shows or hides the GPS receiver on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item.

Command.Name: showHUD
Command.Descr: Enable / disable showing of HUD.

Command.Name: showHUD
Command.Descr: Enable / disable showing of HUD.
Command.Syntax: showHUD [hud, info, radar, compass, direction, menu, group, cursors, panels, kills]

Command.Name: showLegend
Command.Descr: Show/hide map legend.

Command.Name: showMap
Command.Descr: Enable Map (default true)

Command.Name: showNewEditorObject
Command.Descr: Show the add editor object dialog,type is editor object type,class is,class definition to automatically select,side filters by a certain,side,pos is p

Command.Name: showPad
Command.Descr: Shows or hides the notebook on the map screen, if enabled for the mission. (default true). It is no longer relevant to Arma 2.

Command.Name: showRadio
Command.Descr: Shows or hides the radio on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item.

Command.Name: showScoretable
Command.Descr: Forces the score table to be shown, hidden or reset to default functionality. Forcing score table will make it show even in SP.

Command.Name: showSubtitles
Command.Descr: Enables / disables showing of subtitles in a chat. Only scripted/engine chatter is affected, player manual chat is unaffected.

Command.Name: showUAVFeed
Command.Descr: Shows/hides video feed transmitted from UAV.

Command.Name: showWarrant
Command.Descr: Enable ID card (default false). Obsolete command.

Command.Name: showWatch
Command.Descr: Shows or hides the watch on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item.

Command.Name: showWaypoint
Command.Descr: Sets the condition determining when the waypoint is shown.

Command.Name: showWaypoints
Command.Descr: Shows/Hides task HUD markers and waypoints that will fade out in time. Dependable on difficulty settings.

Command.Name: shownArtilleryComputer
Command.Descr: Checks whether the player has the artillery computer currently open.

Command.Name: shownChat
Command.Descr: Returns true if chat window is enabled. Chat window can be disabled with showChat command.

Command.Name: shownCompass
Command.Descr: Checks if client has Compass enabled in description.ext (showCompass param) or force enabled with showCompass command.

Command.Name: shownCuratorCompass
Command.Descr: Returns true if compass is shown.

Command.Name: shownGPS
Command.Descr: Checks if client has GPS reciever enabled in description.ext (showGPS param) or force enabled with showGPS command.

Command.Name: shownHUD
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [hud, info, radar, compass, direction, menu, group, cursors, pan
Command.Descr: Returns array of Booleans corresponding to the visibility of various HUD elements (see extended showHUD).

Command.Name: shownMap
Command.Descr: Checks if client has Map enabled in description.ext (showMap param) or force enabled with showMap command.

Command.Name: shownPad
Command.Descr: Checks if client has Notepad enabled.

Command.Name: shownRadio
Command.Descr: Check if player has Radio enabled.

Command.Name: shownScoretable
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - 0: Force hidden, 1: Force shown, -1: Default
Command.Descr: Returns the state of the score table set with showScoretable command. Since Arma 3 v1.63.

Command.Name: shownUAVFeed
Command.Descr: Returns true if video feed transmitted from UAV is shown.

Command.Name: shownWarrant
Command.Descr: Check if player has ID card enabled. Obsolete command.

Command.Name: shownWatch
Command.Descr: Checks if client has Watch enabled in description.ext (showWatch param) or force enabled with showWatch command.

Command.Name: side
Command.Descr: Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location. Once dead, a unit will be on the civilian side.

Command.Name: side
Command.Descr: Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location. Once dead, a unit will be on the civilian side.

Command.Name: side
Command.Descr: Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location. Once dead, a unit will be on the civilian side.

Command.Name: sideChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages.

Command.Name: sideChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages.

Command.Name: sideEnemy
Command.Descr: The enemy side (used for renegades). Unit of this side is enemy to everyone.To become one, you can attack members of your own side or use addRating.

Command.Name: sideFriendly
Command.Descr: The Friendly side (used for captives).

Command.Name: sideLogic
Command.Descr: The Logic side.Side of Game Logics and Modules.

Command.Name: sideRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the audio message to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to send or receive the transmission.

Command.Name: sideRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the audio message to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to send or receive the transmission.

Command.Name: sideUnknown
Command.Descr: The unknown side.Used when the side of a unit is unknown, e.g. for spotted targets with insufficient information.

Command.Name: simpleTasks
Command.Descr: Return all simple tasks assigned to given person.

Command.Name: simulCloudDensity
Command.Descr: Returns density of clouds at given position.

Command.Name: simulCloudOcclusion
Command.Descr: Returns clouds occlusion between two given points (0 - no clouds, 1 - full clouds).

Command.Name: simulInClouds
Command.Descr: Returns if given position is in clouds.

Command.Name: simulSetHumidity
Command.Descr: Sets simul cloud cover. This command does not affect overcast value.

Command.Name: simulWeatherSync
Command.Descr: Synchronizes Simul Weather with Arma weather, generates all keyframes.

Command.Name: simulationEnabled
Command.Descr: Check if the entity has enabled simulation.

Command.Name: sin
Command.Descr: Sine of x, argument in Degrees.

Command.Name: size
Command.Descr: Returns a location's size.

Command.Name: sizeOf
Command.Descr: Returns the diameter of bounding sphere of the object of given type in meters.

Command.Name: skill
Command.Descr: Returns current level of ability of person, in range between 0 and 1. Skill 1 is highest skill.

Command.Name: skill
Command.Descr: Returns current level of ability of person, in range between 0 and 1. Skill 1 is highest skill.

Command.Name: skillFinal
Command.Descr: Returns final, recalculated sub skill value of given unit. (with regard to AI Level coefficient (Difficulty settings)).

Command.Name: skipTime
Command.Descr: Jumps the specified number of hours forward or backward.The time of day and tides are adjusted, but no changes are made to any units.

Command.Name: sleep
Command.Descr: Suspends code execution for given time in seconds. The sleep precision is given by a framerate, the delay given is the minimal delay expected.

Command.Name: sliderPosition
Command.Descr: Return current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderPosition
Command.Descr: Return current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderRange
Command.Descr: Return limits, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderRange
Command.Descr: Return limits, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSetPosition
Command.Descr: Set current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSetPosition
Command.Descr: Set current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSetRange
Command.Descr: Set limits of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSetRange
Command.Descr: Set limits of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSetSpeed
Command.Descr: Set speed of slider with id idc of topmost user dialog. Click to arrow - move by line Click to scale outside thumb - move by page.

Command.Name: sliderSetSpeed
Command.Descr: Set speed of slider with id idc of topmost user dialog. Click to arrow - move by line Click to scale outside thumb - move by page.

Command.Name: sliderSpeed
Command.Descr: Return speed, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: sliderSpeed
Command.Descr: Return speed, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

Command.Name: slingLoadAssistantShown
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if sling load assistant is shown, false otherwise
Command.Descr: Returns true of Sling Load Assistant is open

Command.Name: soldierMagazines
Command.Descr: Get array with all magazines of the given unit.

Command.Name: someAmmo
Command.Descr: Check if unit has some ammo.

Command.Name: sort
Command.Descr: Attempts to sort given array either in ascending (true) or descending (false) order.

Command.Name: soundVolume
Command.Descr: Check current sound volume (set by fadeSound).

Command.Name: spawn
Command.ReturnDescr: Script Handle - can be used to determine (via scriptDone (also via isNull in Arm
Command.Descr: Adds given code to the scheduler.

Command.Name: speaker
Command.Descr: Returns the speaker of a person.

Command.Name: speed
Command.Descr: Object speed (in km/h). Returns relative speed of given object along Y axis. An equivalent to:3.

Command.Name: speedMode
Command.Descr: Returns speed mode of the group, which can be any of the following: "LIMITED" "NORMAL" "FULL"

Command.Name: speedMode
Command.Descr: Returns speed mode of the group, which can be any of the following: "LIMITED" "NORMAL" "FULL"

Command.Name: splitString
Command.Descr: An SQF version of C++ strtok. Splits given string str into an array of tokens according to given delimiters.

Command.Name: sqrt
Command.Descr: Returns square root of x.

Command.Name: squadParams
Command.Descr: Returns data about squad of given unit loaded from squad.xml.All items in returned array are String.

Command.Name: stance
Command.Descr: Returns the stance of given unit - can be "STAND", "CROUCH", "PRONE", "UNDEFINED" (for example, swimming) or "" (on non-human object)

Command.Name: startLoadingScreen
Command.Descr: Shows loading screen with the given text, using the given resource.

Command.Name: stop
Command.Descr: Stop AI unit.Stopped unit will not be able to move, fire, or change its orientation to follow a watched object.

Command.Name: stopEngineRTD
Command.Descr: Instant engines stop.

Command.Name: stopped
Command.Descr: Check if unit is stopped by stop command.

Command.Name: str
Command.Descr: Converts any value into a string by placing " and " around the argument. Since Arma 3 v1.63.

Command.Name: sunOrMoon
Command.Descr: Returns the sun to moon transition state in range 0...

Command.Name: supportInfo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array with requested info or empty array []
Command.Descr: Creates a list of supported operators and type.

Command.Name: suppressFor
Command.Descr: Force suppressive fire from the unit.

Command.Name: surfaceIsWater
Command.Descr: Returns whether water is at given position.

Command.Name: surfaceNormal
Command.Descr: Returns surface normal on given position.

Command.Name: surfaceTexture
Command.Descr: Same as surfaceType, but returns texture path to ground texture as string.

Command.Name: surfaceType
Command.Descr: Returns what surface type is at the given position.See the spoiler for surface types: Details anzeigenA3 1.

Command.Name: swimInDepth
Command.Descr: Sets the target depth level for swimming soldier.

Command.Name: switchAction
Command.Descr: When used on a person, the given action is started immediately (there is no transition).

Command.Name: switchCamera
Command.Descr: Switch camera to given vehicle / camera.

Command.Name: switchCamera
Command.Descr: Switch camera to given vehicle / camera.

Command.Name: switchGesture
Command.Descr: When used on a person,the given move is started immediately (there is no transition).

Command.Name: switchLight
Command.Descr: Controls whether a lamp is lit or not. For working with CfgNonAIVehicles class "StreetLamp" only.

Command.Name: switchMove
Command.Descr: When used on a person, the given move is started immediately (there is no transition).

Command.Name: switchableUnits
Command.Descr: Returns a list of units accessible through Team Switch.

Command.Name: synchronizeObjectsAdd
Command.Descr: Add given objects to the unit's list of synchronized objects.

Command.Name: synchronizeObjectsRemove
Command.Descr: Remove given objects from the unit's list of synchronized objects.

Command.Name: synchronizeTrigger
Command.Descr: Synchronizes the trigger with zero or more waypoints.

Command.Name: synchronizeWaypoint
Command.Descr: Synchronizes a trigger with other waypoints. Each waypoint is given as an array [group, index].

Command.Name: synchronizeWaypoint_trigger
Command.Descr: Synchronizes a trigger with other waypoints. Each waypoint is given as an array [group, index].

Command.Name: synchronizedObjects
Command.Descr: Return the list of objects synchronized with the given unit.

Command.Name: synchronizedTriggers
Command.Descr: Returns the list of triggers synchronized with a given waypoint.

Command.Name: synchronizedWaypoints
Command.Descr: Returns the list of waypoints synchronized with a given trigger or waypoint.

Command.Name: synchronizedWaypoints
Command.Descr: Returns the list of waypoints synchronized with a given trigger or waypoint.

Command.Name: systemChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the system radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed.

Command.Name: systemOfUnits
Command.Descr: Returns the currently selected system of units.

Command.Name: systemTime
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond]
Command.Descr: Returns system time.

Command.Name: systemTimeUTC
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond]
Command.Descr: Returns systemTime according to Universal Time Coordinated time scale.

Command.Name: tan
Command.Descr: Tangent of x, argument in Degrees.

Command.Name: targetKnowledge
Command.Descr: Returns unit's knowledge about target.

Command.Name: targets
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - unit's targets matching the criteria
Command.Descr: Retrives list of given unit targets matching specified filter. If the filter is not specified, all targets are returned.
Command.Syntax: unit targets [enemyOnly, maxDistance, sides, maxAge, alternateCenter]

Command.Name: targetsAggregate
Command.Descr: Aggregate candidates.
Command.Syntax: [speaker, side, unit, place, time] targetsAggregate candidates

Command.Name: targetsQuery
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - sorted array of returned targets in the following format: [[accuracy, t
Command.Descr: Returns sorted array of targets, known to the enquirer (including own troops), where the accuracy coefficient reflects how close the result matches th
Command.Syntax: enquirer targetsQuery [targetIgnore, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetMaxAge]

Command.Name: taskAlwaysVisible
Command.Descr: Returns true if the task is flagged to be always visible or false if not.

Command.Name: taskChildren
Command.Descr: Return the child tasks of the specified task.

Command.Name: taskCompleted
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if task has been Succeeded, Failed or Canceled
Command.Descr: Return if task is completed.

Command.Name: taskCustomData
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of string - iconPath, iconText, descriptionText
Command.Descr: Returns custom data attached to the local task or an empty array if there are no custom data attached.

Command.Name: taskDescription
Command.Descr: Returns the sub-parts of the task description. The returned Array is in format [Task description, Task title, Task waypoint description].

Command.Name: taskDestination
Command.Descr: Returns the position of the task (as specified by destination parameter in config).

Command.Name: taskHint
Command.Descr: Shows info about new, changed or failed task. The text can contain several lines. \n is used to indicate the end of a line.

Command.Name: taskMarkerOffset
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - offset in format [x, y, z]
Command.Descr: Returns model space position for the task marker

Command.Name: taskParent
Command.Descr: Return the parent task of the specified task.

Command.Name: taskResult
Command.Descr: Send a result of the task to the task sender.

Command.Name: taskState
Command.Descr: Returns the current state of a task.

Command.Name: taskType
Command.Descr: Returns the type of the given task

Command.Name: teamMember
Command.Descr: Return an agent for given person.

Command.Name: teamName
Command.Descr: Return a name of given team.

Command.Name: teamSwitch
Command.Descr: Invoke the Team Switch dialog (force it even when conditions are not met).

Command.Name: teamSwitchEnabled
Command.Descr: Check if Team Switch is currently enabled.Team Switch is enabled by default.

Command.Name: teamType
Command.Descr: Returns a type of given team.

Command.Name: teams
Command.Descr: Return a list of teams in the current mission.

Command.Name: terminate
Command.Descr: Terminate (abort) spawned or execVM'd script.

Command.Name: terrainIntersect
Command.Descr: Checks for intersection of terrain between two AGL positions. Returns true if intersects with terrain.

Command.Name: terrainIntersectASL
Command.Descr: Checks for intersection of terrain between two ASL positions. Returns true if intersects with terrain.

Command.Name: terrainIntersectAtASL
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - intersect position in format PositionASL
Command.Descr: Checks for intersection of terrain between two ASL positions.

Command.Name: text
Command.Descr: Creates a structured text containing the given plain text.

Command.Name: text
Command.Descr: Creates a structured text containing the given plain text.

Command.Name: textLog
Command.Descr: Dump argument value to debugging output.

Command.Name: textLogFormat
Command.Descr: Debugging output.

Command.Name: text_location
Command.Descr: Returns a location's text value.

Command.Name: text_location
Command.Descr: Returns a location's text value.

Command.Name: tg
Command.Descr: Identical to tan

Command.Name: throw
Command.Descr: Throws an exception. The exception is processed by first catch block.

Command.Name: time
Command.Descr: Returns time elapsed since mission started (in seconds). The value is different on each client. If you need unified time, use serverTime.

Command.Name: timeMultiplier
Command.Descr: Returns the value set with setTimeMultiplier.

Command.Name: titleCut
Command.Descr: this command was obsoleted, use cutText instead.

Command.Name: titleFadeOut
Command.Descr: Terminate the title effect and set duration of the fade out phase to the given time.

Command.Name: titleObj
Command.Descr: Shows object defined in global config in CfgTitles.

Command.Name: titleRsc
Command.Descr: Resource title - Resource can be defined in Description.ext Also see cutRsc, with these two commands you can show two different resources at once.

Command.Name: titleText
Command.Descr: Displays text across the screen.If used along with cutText two different texts (in different type styles) can be shown at once.

Command.Name: toArray
Command.Descr: Converts the supplied String into an Array of Numbers. The numbers in the created array are the decimal Unicode representations of characters.

Command.Name: toFixed
Command.Descr: Converts a number into a string, keeping a specified number of decimals.

Command.Name: toFixed
Command.Descr: Converts a number into a string, keeping a specified number of decimals.

Command.Name: toLower
Command.Descr: Converts the supplied string to all lowercase characters.

Command.Name: toLowerANSI
Command.Descr: ISO-8859-1Converts the supplied string to all lower case characters fast (could be 3x faster than toLower).

Command.Name: toString
Command.Descr: Converts the supplied Array of Numbers into a String. The numbers in the array to be converted are the decimal Unicode representations of characters.

Command.Name: toUpper
Command.Descr: Converts the supplied string to all uppercase characters.

Command.Name: toUpperANSI
Command.Descr: ISO-8859-1Converts the supplied string to all upper case characters fast (could be 3x faster than toUpper).

Command.Name: triggerActivated
Command.Descr: Returns true if the trigger has been activated.

Command.Name: triggerActivation
Command.Descr: Returns trigger activation in the form [by, type, repeating].

Command.Name: triggerAmmo
Command.Descr: Triggers a munition such as shells, bullets, missiles, rockets and bombs (shotSubmunition/shotShell/shotBullet/shotMissile/shotRocket) as if it did hi

Command.Name: triggerArea
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c], where:a - trigger area X size /
Command.Descr: Returns currently monitored trigger area.

Command.Name: triggerAttachObject
Command.Descr: Assigns a static object to the trigger. The activation source is changed to "STATIC".

Command.Name: triggerAttachVehicle
Command.Descr: Specifies the entity which will activate the selected trigger.If [] is given, the trigger is decoupled from the assigned vehicle (example 2).

Command.Name: triggerAttachedVehicle
Command.Descr: Returns vehicle attached to the trigger (for example using triggerAttachVehicle).

Command.Name: triggerDynamicSimulation
Command.Descr: Controls ability of given unit to activate entities with disabled Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation.

Command.Name: triggerInterval
Command.Descr: Returns trigger condition check frequency in seconds.

Command.Name: triggerStatements
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format:0: condition: String1: code on activation: String2: code on d

Command.Name: triggerText
Command.Descr: Returns trigger text.

Command.Name: triggerTimeout
Command.Descr: Returns trigger timeout in the form [min, mid, max, interruptable].

Command.Name: triggerTimeoutCurrent
Command.ReturnDescr: Number - time remaining before trigger activation.
Command.Descr: Returns trigger timeout or -1 if countdown is not in progress.

Command.Name: triggerType
Command.Descr: Returns trigger type (see setTriggerType).

Command.Name: try
Command.Descr: Defines a try-catch structure. This sets up an exception handling block. Any thrown exception in a try block is caught in a catch block.

Command.Name: try
Command.Descr: Defines a try-catch structure. This sets up an exception handling block. Any thrown exception in a try block is caught in a catch block.

Command.Name: turretLocal
Command.Descr: Checks if a turret is local.

Command.Name: turretOwner
Command.Descr: Returns id of the owner of the turret. On clients always returns 0.

Command.Name: turretUnit
Command.Descr: Returns the unit in the vehicle turret. Driver turret [-1] is supported since Arma 3 v1.57.

Command.Name: tvAdd

Command.Name: tvClear

Command.Name: tvClear
Command.Descr: Removes all items from Tree View with given idc.

Command.Name: tvCollapse
Command.Descr: Collapses tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCollapse
Command.Descr: Collapses tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCollapseAll
Command.Descr: Collapses all tree items for the given Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCollapseAll
Command.Descr: Collapses all tree items for the given Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCount
Command.Descr: Returns childrens count of item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCount
Command.Descr: Returns childrens count of item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvCurSel

Command.Name: tvCurSel
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Tree View Path of selected item
Command.Descr: Returns path to currently selected item. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvData
Command.Descr: Returns string data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvData
Command.Descr: Returns string data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvDelete
Command.Descr: Removes an item with given Tree View Path from Tree View. The paths of other items on the same branch are updated accordingly and may change.

Command.Name: tvDelete
Command.Descr: Removes an item with given Tree View Path from Tree View. The paths of other items on the same branch are updated accordingly and may change.

Command.Descr: Expands tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvExpand
Command.Descr: Expands tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvExpandAll
Command.Descr: Expands all tree items for the given Tree View.

Command.Name: tvExpandAll
Command.Descr: Expands all tree items for the given Tree View.

Command.Name: tvPicture
Command.Descr: Returns name of picture from item pointed to by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvPicture
Command.Descr: Returns name of picture from item pointed to by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetColor
Command.Descr: Sets text color on given Tree View Item

Command.Name: tvSetColor
Command.Descr: Sets text color on given Tree View Item

Command.Name: tvSetCurSel
Command.Descr: Sets cursor to given item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetCurSel
Command.Descr: Sets cursor to given item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetData
Command.Descr: Sets string data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetData
Command.Descr: Sets string data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetPicture
Command.Descr: Sets picture to item selected by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. Name is picture name. The picture is searched in the mission directory.

Command.Name: tvSetPicture
Command.Descr: Sets picture to item selected by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. Name is picture name. The picture is searched in the mission directory.

Command.Name: tvSetPictureColor
Command.Descr: Sets the colour of the picture (set via tvSetPicture) under the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvSetPictureColor
Command.Descr: Sets the colour of the picture (set via tvSetPicture) under the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvSetPictureColorDisabled
Command.Descr: Sets the color of left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

Command.Name: tvSetPictureColorSelected
Command.Descr: Sets the color of the left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRight
Command.Descr: Sets right picture on the tree view item defined by path

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRight
Command.Descr: Sets right picture on the tree view item defined by path

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRightColor
Command.Descr: Sets color of the right picture on the tree view item defined by path

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRightColor
Command.Descr: Sets color of the right picture on the tree view item defined by path

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRightColorDisabled
Command.Descr: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

Command.Name: tvSetPictureRightColorSelected
Command.Descr: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

Command.Name: tvSetText
Command.Descr: Sets string text to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetText
Command.Descr: Sets string text to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetTooltip
Command.Descr: Sets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvSetTooltip
Command.Descr: Sets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvSetValue
Command.Descr: Sets scalar data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSetValue
Command.Descr: Sets scalar data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSort
Command.Descr: Sorts childrens of given item by item name (tvText). IDC means id of parent Tree View.Param reversed is optional.

Command.Name: tvSort
Command.Descr: Sorts childrens of given item by item name (tvText). IDC means id of parent Tree View.Param reversed is optional.

Command.Name: tvSortByValue
Command.Descr: Sorts children of given item by tvValue from highest to lowest by default. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvSortByValue
Command.Descr: Sorts children of given item by tvValue from highest to lowest by default. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvText
Command.Descr: Returns shown text in the item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvText
Command.Descr: Returns shown text in the item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvTooltip
Command.Descr: Gets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvTooltip
Command.Descr: Gets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

Command.Name: tvValue
Command.Descr: Returns scalar data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: tvValue
Command.Descr: Returns scalar data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

Command.Name: type
Command.Descr: Returns a string of a location's class name.

Command.Name: type
Command.ReturnDescr: String - the type of the task
Command.Descr: Returns a string of a location's class name.

Command.Name: typeName
Command.Descr: Returns the data type of an expression.

Command.Name: typeOf
Command.Descr: Returns the class name of a given object.

Command.Name: uiNamespace
Command.Descr: Returns the global namespace attached to user interface.

Command.Name: uiSleep
Command.Descr: Suspend execution of script for given uitime. uiSleep is a sleep method to delay script execution where script time/simulation time is stopped.

Command.Name: unassignCurator
Command.Descr: Unassign curator (will destroy both sides of connection).

Command.Name: unassignItem
Command.Descr: Unassigns existing item and tries to put it into inventory. If there is no space in inventory the item simply disappears.

Command.Name: unassignTeam
Command.Descr: Unassigns the unit (in the case of a vehicle its commander unit) from his team. This is equal to unit assignTeam "MAIN".

Command.Name: unassignVehicle
Command.Descr: Unassigns individual unit from a vehicle, i.e removes assignedVehicleRole of the unit.

Command.Name: underwater
Command.Descr: Return whether object is fully underwater. From Arma 3 v1.66, this also works for units.

Command.Name: uniform
Command.Descr: Returns name of uniform.

Command.Name: uniformContainer
Command.Descr: Returns a cargo container of a unit's uniform.

Command.Name: uniformItems
Command.Descr: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from uniform.

Command.Name: uniformMagazines
Command.Descr: Get array with all magazines from uniform of the given unit.

Command.Name: unitAddons
Command.Descr: Returns list with addons the unit belongs to.

Command.Name: unitAimPosition
Command.Descr: Returns the position on the unit other units can aim at.

Command.Name: unitAimPositionVisual
Command.Descr: Returns the position on the unit other units can aim at in render scope. See also aimPos, unitAimPosition.

Command.Name: unitBackpack
Command.Descr: Returns unit's backpack

Command.Name: unitIsUAV
Command.Descr: Returns true if the unit type is UAV - coresponding to transport param "isUAV"

Command.Name: unitPos
Command.Descr: Return the unit position rules.The return value is always "Auto" unless the unit has gotten a setUnitPos command.

Command.Name: unitReady
Command.Descr: Check if the unit is ready. Unit is busy when it is given some command like move, until the command is finished.

Command.Name: unitRecoilCoefficient
Command.Descr: Returns recoil coefficient of a soldier.

Command.Name: unitTurret
Command.Descr: Returns the turret path the given vehicle's gunner is in. [-1] is returned if gunner is driver.

Command.Name: units
Command.Descr: Returns an array with all the units in the group or group of the unit.For a destroyed object an empty array is returned.

Command.Name: units
Command.Descr: Returns an array with all the units in the group or group of the unit.For a destroyed object an empty array is returned.

Command.Name: unitsBelowHeight
Command.Descr: Returns units in group/array below given height Above The Land (ATL).

Command.Name: unitsBelowHeight
Command.Descr: Returns units in group/array below given height Above The Land (ATL).

Command.Name: unlinkItem
Command.Descr: Unassign and delete existing item from its assigned slot. If item does not exist or is not in the assigned slot, command simply fails.

Command.Name: unlockAchievement
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - true if achievement was unlocked
Command.Descr: Unlock the given achievement.

Command.Name: unregisterTask
Command.Descr: Unregister a task type.

Command.Name: updateDrawIcon
Command.Descr: Updates the icon to be shown in 2D editor for the specified editor,object.

Command.Name: updateMenuItem
Command.Descr: Sets the text and command for the menu item. index is index as returned from addMenuItem command. command is optional.

Command.Name: updateObjectTree
Command.Descr: Update the editor object tree.

Command.Name: useAIOperMapObstructionTest
Command.Descr: Toggle secondary obstruction test on road paths.

Command.Name: useAISteeringComponent
Command.Descr: Enable the new AI driving, used to test the old and new AI driving.

Command.Name: useAudioTimeForMoves
Command.Descr: Switch between elapsed game time and audio time being used as animation timer. Used for audio/animation synchronization.

Command.Name: userInputDisabled
Command.Descr: Returns true if user input is disabled

Command.Name: vectorAdd
Command.Descr: Adds two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorCos
Command.Descr: Cosine of angle between two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorCrossProduct
Command.Descr: Cross product of two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorDiff
Command.Descr: Subtracts one 3D vector from another.

Command.Name: vectorDir
Command.Descr: Return object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]).

Command.Name: vectorDirVisual
Command.Descr: Return object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]) in render time scope.

Command.Name: vectorDistance
Command.Descr: Distance between two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorDistanceSqr
Command.Descr: Squared distance between two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorDotProduct
Command.Descr: Dot product of two 3D vectors.

Command.Name: vectorFromTo
Command.Descr: Unit vector, equal to direction from vector1 to vector2. In other words this command produces vectorNormalized between given 2 points.

Command.Name: vectorLinearConversion
Command.Descr: Converts given vector from given "from" range to wanted "to" range.
Command.Syntax: vectorLinearConversion [rangeFrom, rangeTo, rangeValue, vectorFrom, vectorTo, clip]

Command.Name: vectorMagnitude
Command.Descr: Magnitude of a 3D vector.

Command.Name: vectorMagnitudeSqr
Command.Descr: Squared magnitude of a 3D vector.

Command.Name: vectorModelToWorld
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]
Command.Descr: Converts vector direction from model to world space.

Command.Name: vectorModelToWorldVisual
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]
Command.Descr: Converts vector from model to world space in render time scope.

Command.Name: vectorMultiply
Command.Descr: Multiplies 3D vector by a scalar.

Command.Name: vectorNormalized
Command.Descr: Returns normalized vector (unit vector, vectorMagnitude = 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

Command.Name: vectorUp
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - up vector in format Vector3D
Command.Descr: Return object's up vector in world Position coordinates ( [x, y, z] ).

Command.Name: vectorUpVisual
Command.Descr: Return object's up vector in world Position coordinates ( [x, y, z] ) in render time scope.

Command.Name: vectorWorldToModel
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]
Command.Descr: Converts vector direction from world to model space.

Command.Name: vectorWorldToModelVisual
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]
Command.Descr: Converts vector direction from world to model space in render time scope.

Command.Name: vehicle
Command.Descr: Vehicle in which given unit is mounted. If none, unit is returned.

Command.Name: vehicleCargoEnabled
Command.ReturnDescr: Boolean - returns true if the vehicle has enabled transporting other vehicles, a
Command.Descr: Check if the vehicle has enabled transporting other vehicles or not.

Command.Name: vehicleChat
Command.Descr: Types text to the vehicle radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed.

Command.Name: vehicleMoveInfo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array in format [moveInfo, turnInfo], where:moveInfo: String - state of vehicle
Command.Descr: Returns current vehicle move/turn info (a getter for sendSimpleCommand) in format [moveInfo, turnInfo].

Command.Name: vehicleRadio
Command.Descr: Sends the audio message to the vehicle radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol.

Command.Name: vehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
Command.Descr: Gets whether the vehicle can acquire targets via datalink from the Side center.

Command.Name: vehicleReportOwnPosition
Command.Descr: Gets whether the vehicle shares its own position via datalink with the Side center.

Command.Name: vehicleReportRemoteTargets
Command.Descr: Gets whether the vehicle shares acquired targets via datalink with the Side center.

Command.Name: vehicleVarName
Command.Descr: Returns the name of the variable which contains a primary editor reference to this object.

Command.Name: vehicles
Command.Descr: Returns a list of all vehicles.

Command.Name: velocity
Command.Descr: Return velocity (speed vector) of Unit as an array with format [x, y, z]. Units are in metres per second.

Command.Name: velocityModelSpace
Command.Descr: Returns the velocity (speed vector) of the vehicle as an array with format [x, y, z]. Vector is in model space.

Command.Name: verifySignature
Command.Descr: Check if file is signed by any key present in game keys folders. Note: On client, it does not check against the keys accepted by server.

Command.Name: vest
Command.Descr: Returns name of vest.

Command.Name: vestContainer
Command.Descr: Returns a cargo container of a unit's vest.

Command.Name: vestItems
Command.Descr: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from vest.

Command.Name: vestMagazines
Command.Descr: Get array with all magazines from vest of the given unit.

Command.Name: viewDistance
Command.Descr: Returns the rendering distance.

Command.Name: visibleCompass
Command.Descr: Checks if the player has compass opened and visible

Command.Name: visibleGPS
Command.Descr: Checks if the player has GPS receiver opened and visible

Command.Name: visibleMap
Command.Descr: Return true if the main map is shown (active).

Command.Name: visiblePosition
Command.Descr: Returns an object's rendered position (z value above surface underneath) in render time scope.

Command.Name: visiblePositionASL
Command.Descr: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ASL (z value above sea level) in render time scope.

Command.Name: visibleScoretable
Command.Descr: Checks whether the score table is visible.

Command.Name: visibleWatch
Command.Descr: Checks if the player has watch opened and visible

Command.Name: waitUntil
Command.ReturnDescr: Anything - the value the condition evaluates to when the wait is over (normally
Command.Descr: Suspend execution of function or SQF based script until condition is satisfied.

Command.Name: waves
Command.Descr: Return waves value.

Command.Name: waypointAttachObject
Command.Descr: Attaches a static object via it's numeric ID to the given waypoint.The alternative syntax is (at least) available since Arma 2.

Command.Name: waypointAttachObject
Command.Descr: Attaches a static object via it's numeric ID to the given waypoint.The alternative syntax is (at least) available since Arma 2.

Command.Name: waypointAttachVehicle
Command.Descr: Attaches a Unit to the given Waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointAttachedObject
Command.Descr: Gets the object attached to the waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointAttachedVehicle
Command.Descr: Gets the vehicle attached to the waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointBehaviour
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint behavior.

Command.Name: waypointCombatMode
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint combat mode.

Command.Name: waypointCompletionRadius
Command.Descr: Gets the radius around the waypoint where the waypoint is completed.

Command.Name: waypointDescription
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint description.

Command.Name: waypointForceBehaviour
Command.Descr: Returns true if the waypoint behavior is forced.

Command.Name: waypointFormation
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint formation.

Command.Name: waypointHousePosition
Command.Descr: Gets the house position assigned to the waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointLoiterAltitude
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint loiter altitude. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointLoiterRadius
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint loiter radius. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointLoiterType
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint loiter type. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

Command.Name: waypointName
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint name.

Command.Name: waypointPosition
Command.Descr: Get Waypoint's Position. Note: This function is identical to getWPPos.

Command.Name: waypointScript
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint script.

Command.Name: waypointShow
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint show/hide status.

Command.Name: waypointSpeed
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint speed.

Command.Name: waypointStatements
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint statements.

Command.Name: waypointTimeout
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint timeout values.

Command.Name: waypointTimeoutCurrent
Command.Descr: Gets the current waypoint timeout or -1 if countdown is not in progress.

Command.Name: waypointType
Command.Descr: Gets the waypoint type.

Command.Name: waypointVisible
Command.Descr: Returns the visibility of the waypoint.Returns 0 (Number) for a non valid waypoint.

Command.Name: waypoints
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of waypoints each in format Waypoint
Command.Descr: Returns an array of waypoints for the specified unit/group.

Command.Name: waypointsEnabledUAV
Command.Descr: Checks if the UAV has waypoints enabled.

Command.Name: weaponAccessories
Command.Descr: Get array with all items linked to a given weapon.

Command.Name: weaponAccessoriesCargo
Command.Descr: Returns array with all items assigned to the given weapon in given cargo container.

Command.Name: weaponCargo
Command.ReturnDescr: Array of String - list of present classes
Command.Descr: Get array with weapons from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

Command.Name: weaponDirection
Command.Descr: Returns the direction that the vehicle weapon is aiming in.For addons the weapon name must be an entry in CfgWeapons.

Command.Name: weaponInertia
Command.Descr: Returns current rate of how much the weapon view is distorted because of quick aiming

Command.Name: weaponLowered
Command.Descr: True if given soldier's weapon is lowered.

Command.Name: weaponState
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [weapon, muzzle, firemode, magazine, ammoCount], where:weapon
Command.Descr: Returns the current weapon state as an array of strings in the following format [WeaponName, MuzzleName, ModeName, MagazineName, AmmoCount] (AmmoCount

Command.Name: weaponState
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - in format [weapon, muzzle, firemode, magazine, ammoCount], where:weapon
Command.Descr: Returns the current weapon state as an array of strings in the following format [WeaponName, MuzzleName, ModeName, MagazineName, AmmoCount] (AmmoCount

Command.Name: weapons
Command.Descr: Returns array of names of all Unit's weapons.

Command.Name: weaponsItems
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - array containing arrays of weapon items info in format [weapon:String, m
Command.Descr: Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's weapons.Since Arma 3 v1.21.

Command.Name: weaponsItemsCargo
Command.Descr: Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's cargo weapons in weaponsItems format.

Command.Name: weaponsTurret
Command.Descr: Returns all weapons of given turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Command.Name: weightRTD
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - [fuselage weight, crew weight, fuel weight, custom weight, weapons weig
Command.Descr: Returns weight of RTD helicopter.

Command.Name: wind
Command.Descr: Returns the current wind vector (in m/s) as array [x, z, y].

Command.Name: windDir
Command.Descr: Returns the current wind azimuth.

Command.Name: windRTD
Command.Descr: Returns wind strength and direction.For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled.

Command.Name: windStr
Command.Descr: Returns the current wind strength.

Command.Name: wingsForcesRTD
Command.Descr: Returns force produced by wings.

Command.Name: worldName
Command.Descr: Return the name of the currently loaded world.

Command.Name: worldSize
Command.Descr: Returns config size of the current world.

Command.Name: worldToModel
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - position relative to model, format PositionRelative
Command.Descr: Converts position from world space to object model space.

Command.Name: worldToModelVisual
Command.Descr: Converts position from world space to object model space in render time scope.

Command.Name: worldToScreen
Command.ReturnDescr: Array - Screen position [x,y] (see SafeZone for more info) - [] if not on-screen
Command.Descr: Converts position in world space into screen (UI) space. If a specified position is not within the current screen view, an empty array is returned.
